Tim and Amy were playing in the garden. They saw a big hole in the fence. They wanted to see what was on the other side. They crawled through the hole and found a big road with many cars.
"Wow, look at all the cars!" Tim said. "They are so fast and loud!"
"Let's go closer and touch them!" Amy said. She ran towards the road.
"No, Amy, stop!" Tim said. "It is not safe! The cars can hurt you!"
But Amy did not listen. She ran across the road. A car honked and braked. Amy was scared and fell down. The car stopped and a man got out.
"Are you okay, little girl?" the man said. "What are you doing here? Where are your parents?"
Amy started to cry. She was hurt and ashamed. She had done a bad thing. She wanted to go back to the garden.
Tim ran to Amy and hugged her. He was also scared and ashamed. He had followed Amy to the road. He had not stopped her.
"I'm sorry, mister," Tim said. "We were playing in the garden and we saw the hole in the fence. We wanted to see the other side. We did not mean to escape. We did not know it was dangerous."
The man was angry and worried. He picked up Amy and carried her to the fence. He called for help. He told Tim and Amy to stay there and wait for their parents. He said they were very lucky and very naughty.
Tim and Amy felt very bad. They wished they had not gone through the hole. They wished they had listened to Tim. They wished they had not escaped. They learned a lesson. They said sorry to the man and to their parents. They said they would never do it again.

Anna and Ben were playing with their dolls. Anna had a princess doll with a pink dress and a crown. Ben had a pirate doll with a hook and a hat.
"Let's pretend that the pirate wants to marry the princess," Anna said.
"Okay, but the princess does not like the pirate," Ben said.
"Why not?" Anna asked.
"Because he is fat and mean," Ben said.
Anna did not like that Ben said that. She liked fat people. Her grandma was fat and she was very nice. She also liked pirates. They had cool stories and songs.
"That is not nice, Ben. You should not say that about people. Fat people can be good and pirates can be fun," Anna said.
"But the princess does not think so. She thinks the pirate is ugly and scary," Ben said.
"How do you know that? Did she mention that to you?" Anna asked.
Ben did not know what mention meant. He thought it was a big word that Anna used to sound smart. He did not like that Anna used big words. He wanted to play with simple words.
"No, she did not mention that to me. She did not talk to me at all. She only talks to the prince," Ben said.
"Who is the prince?" Anna asked.
"The prince is the other doll that I have. He is handsome and brave. He has a sword and a horse. He loves the princess and the princess loves him," Ben said.
He showed Anna his other doll. It was a prince doll with a blue coat and a feather. Anna did not like the prince doll. She thought he was boring and snooty. She did not like blue. She liked pink.
"That is not fair, Ben. You have two dolls and I only have one. You should share your dolls with me. I want to play with the pirate too," Anna said.
"No, you cannot play with the pirate. He is mine. You can only play with the princess. She is yours," Ben said.
He grabbed the pirate doll from Anna's hand. Anna did not like that Ben grabbed her doll. She felt angry and sad. She wanted to play with both dolls. She did not want to play with Ben anymore.
"Fine, then I do not want to play with you anymore. You are mean and selfish. You do not know how to share. I will play with someone else," Anna said.
She took her princess doll and ran away. Ben did not care. He thought Anna was silly and bossy. He did not want to play with her anymore. He played with his pirate and his prince by himself. He thought they were the best dolls ever. He did not need anyone else.

Lily and Max were twins who liked to play with puzzles. They had many puzzles with different pictures, like animals, cars, and flowers. They also liked to wear funny hats and costumes when they played.
One day, they found a new puzzle in their toy box. It was a puzzle of a big green monster with sharp teeth and red eyes. Lily and Max wanted to try it, but they had a problem. They only had one hat that matched the puzzle. It was a green hat with horns and ears.
Lily said, "I want to wear the green hat and do the puzzle. It is my turn." Max said, "No, I want to wear the green hat and do the puzzle. It is my turn." They both grabbed the hat and pulled it. The hat ripped in half.
Lily and Max were very sad and angry. They threw the hat and the puzzle pieces on the floor. They said, "This hat is disgusting. This puzzle is disgusting. We don't want to play with them anymore."
Mom heard the noise and came to see what was wrong. She saw the mess and the tears. She said, "What happened here? Why are you fighting?" Lily and Max told her what happened. Mom said, "I'm sorry you ripped your hat. But you shouldn't fight over toys. You should share and take turns. And you shouldn't say things are disgusting. They are just different. Maybe you can find something else to wear and do the puzzle together."
Lily and Max felt sorry for what they did. They said, "We're sorry, Mom. We're sorry, hat. We're sorry, puzzle." They hugged Mom and each other. They picked up the hat and the puzzle pieces. They decided to wear their own hats and do the puzzle together. They found out that the puzzle was not so scary after all. It was fun and colorful. They smiled and said, "This hat is cool. This puzzle is cool. We like to play with them." Mom smiled and said, "That's better. I'm proud of you."

Ben liked to look for insects in the garden. He had a jar with holes in the lid, and he wanted to fill it with different kinds of insects. He liked to watch them crawl and fly and make noises.
One day, he saw a big, shiny insect on a flower. It had four wings and a long tail. It was green and blue and yellow. Ben thought it was the most beautiful insect he had ever seen. He wanted to catch it and put it in his jar.
He ran to the flower and reached out his hand. But before he could grab the insect, he heard a loud buzz and felt a sharp pain in his finger. He screamed and dropped the jar. The insect flew away.
"Ow, ow, ow!" Ben cried. He ran to his mom, who was sitting on the porch. She saw his finger and hugged him.
"What happened, Ben?" she asked.
"I tried to catch a pretty insect, but it stung me!" Ben sobbed.
"Oh, Ben, I'm sorry. That was a bee. Bees are not good insects to catch. They can hurt you. They make honey, but they also have stingers. You have to be careful around them."
She took him inside and put some ice on his finger. She gave him a cookie and a glass of milk. She kissed his finger and his cheek.
"Next time, I recommend you look for other insects, like butterflies or ladybugs. They are also pretty, but they don't sting. They are more available and friendly. Do you understand?"
Ben nodded. He felt better. He learned his lesson. He decided to leave the bees alone and look for other insects. He hoped he would find a butterfly or a ladybug soon. He still liked insects, but he was more careful now.

Tom and Lily are in school. They like to play with their friends. Today, they have a new game. They have a big blackboard and some chalk. They draw fish and sharks and crabs on the blackboard. They pretend they are in the sea.
Tom is a fish. He swims fast and makes bubbles. Lily is a shark. She chases Tom and tries to catch him. She is hungry. She shows her teeth and growls. Tom is scared. He looks for a place to hide.
He sees a fat crab on the blackboard. The crab has big claws and a hard shell. Tom thinks the crab can help him. He dives to the blackboard and says, "Hello, crab. Can I hide with you? Lily is a shark and she wants to eat me."
The crab is not happy. He says, "Go away, fish. This is my home. You are too big and you make too much noise. You will scare away my food. Find another place to hide."
Tom is sad. He has no friends. He swims away from the crab. He hopes Lily will not find him. He wishes he had a friend like Lily.

Ben and Lily like to play in the park. They like to swing, slide and run. One day, they find a big rock. It is brown and dirty. They want to see what is inside.
They take the rock to the bench. They use a stick to hit the rock. The rock is hard. They hit it again and again. The rock breaks. Inside, they see something shiny. It is a heart.
The heart is red and pretty. It sparkles in the sun. Ben and Lily are happy. They think the heart is a treasure. They want to keep it. They put the heart in a box. They take it home.
They show the heart to mom and dad. Mom and dad are surprised. They tell Ben and Lily that the heart is a gem. It is very rare and valuable. They say that someone must have lost it. They ask Ben and Lily where they found it.
Ben and Lily tell them about the park and the rock. They say they want to keep the heart. Mom and dad say that they are proud of them for finding the heart. But they also say that they should try to find the owner. They say that the owner must be very sad and miss the heart.
Ben and Lily think about it. They remember how they felt when they lost their toys. They feel sorry for the owner. They agree to go back to the park and look for the owner. They hope they can make the owner happy again. They put the heart back in the box. They hold hands and go to the park.

Lily and Max are friends. They like to play with toys. They have a big box of toys. They have cars, dolls, balls, and books. They also have a dragon. The dragon is green and soft. It can make sounds. Lily and Max like to pretend that the dragon is real.
One day, they decide to play a game. They want to make the dragon fly. They think of a plan. They find a long stick and a string. They tie the string to the dragon's tail. They hold the stick and the string. They run around the room. They make the dragon lift in the air.
"Look, the dragon is flying!" Lily says. "It is so fast and strong!"
"Yes, it is!" Max says. "It is the best dragon ever!"
They have fun with the dragon. They make it go up and down. They make it roar and breathe fire. They pretend that the dragon is their friend. They are happy.
But then, something happens. The string breaks. The dragon falls to the floor. It stops making sounds. Lily and Max are sad. They run to the dragon. They hug it.
"Oh no, the dragon is broken!" Lily says. "What can we do?"
"I don't know," Max says. "Maybe we can fix it."
They look at the dragon. They see a button on its back. They press the button. The dragon makes a beep. It opens its eyes. It starts to make sounds again.
"Wow, the dragon is not broken!" Lily says. "It is a modern dragon!"
"Yes, it is!" Max says. "It is a smart dragon!"
They are happy again. They play with the dragon. They love the dragon. The dragon loves them. They are friends.

Lily and Ben were best friends. They liked to play with dolls and cars and books. One day, they decided to play marry. They put on their nicest clothes and found some rings and flowers.
"Are you ready, Ben?" Lily asked. She held a ring and a flower.
"Yes, I am, Lily," Ben said. He held a ring and a flower too. But he felt nervous. He did not know how to play marry. He did not know what to say or do.
They walked to the garden, where they had a big rock for a table. They put their rings and flowers on the rock. Then they looked at each other.
"Now what?" Ben asked.
"We have to say 'I do'," Lily said. "That's what people say when they marry."
"Oh, okay," Ben said. He tried to say 'I do', but his voice was very quiet. He felt his face get hot.
Lily waited for Ben to say 'I do'. She wondered why he was so quiet. She thought he did not want to play marry with her. She felt sad and angry.
"Ben, do you want to play marry with me or not?" she asked. She raised her voice.
Ben heard Lily's voice. He felt scared. He did not want to make Lily sad or angry. He wanted to play marry with her. He wanted to be her best friend.
"Yes, yes, I do!" he said. He said it very loud. He smiled at Lily.
Lily heard Ben's voice. She felt happy. She smiled at Ben too.
"Then we are married!" she said. She took his ring and put it on his finger. He took her ring and put it on her finger. They hugged each other.
They played marry for a long time. They had a cake and a dance and a kiss. They had fun. They were best friends.

Tom and Sue are friends. They like to play with blocks. They have many blocks of different colors. They can make houses, cars, towers and more.
One day, they want to make a big train with all the blocks. Tom says, "Let's use all the colors. The train will be very pretty." Sue says, "No, I only want to use blue blocks. Blue is my favorite color. The train will be all blue."
Tom is sad. He likes blue, but he also likes other colors. He says, "But Sue, can we not include some other colors too? The train will be more fun. Look, I have a long red block. It can be the engine." Sue says, "No, Tom. I don't like red. Red is ugly. The train will be all blue. If you don't like it, you can't play with me."
Tom is angry. He thinks Sue is mean. He says, "Fine, Sue. I don't want to play with you either. You are not a good friend. You are selfish. I will make my own train with all the colors." He takes his blocks and goes to the other side of the room.
Sue is happy. She thinks Tom is silly. She says, "Good, Tom. Go away. I don't need you. I will make my own train with all the blue blocks." She takes all the blue blocks and starts to build her train.
But Sue has a problem. She does not have enough blue blocks to make a big train. She only has a few blue blocks. She tries to make a small train, but it is not nice. It is not long. It is not pretty. It is boring.
Sue is sad. She looks at Tom's train. Tom's train is big. It is long. It is pretty. It has many colors. It is fun.
Sue wants to play with Tom's train. She says, "Tom, can I play with your train? Your train is nice. I like your train." Tom says, "No, Sue. You can't play with my train. You were mean to me. You did not include me. You did not share. You can't be my friend."
Sue cries. She is alone. She has no train. She has no friend. She is sorry. She wishes she was not selfish. She wishes she was nice. She wishes she had a big train with all the colors. The end.

Lily and Ben were playing in the park with their dolls. They liked to pretend that their dolls were going on adventures in the woods, the sea, or the moon. They made up stories and acted them out with their dolls.
One day, a big boy came to the park. He saw Lily and Ben and their dolls. He wanted to play with them, but he did not ask nicely. He said, "Give me your dolls. They are mine now. They are too babyish for you."
Lily and Ben were scared of the big boy. He was much taller and stronger than them. He looked mean and angry. They did not want to give him their dolls. They loved their dolls very much.
The big boy grabbed Lily's doll. It was a soft pink bunny with a leather jacket. Lily had made the jacket herself with her mom's help. She cried, "No, please, don't take my bunny. She is my best friend. She is not babyish. She is cool and brave."
The big boy laughed. He said, "A bunny with a leather jacket? That is silly. Bunnies are not cool or brave. They are weak and scared. This is a dangerous jacket. It is only for tough guys like me. You can have this doll instead." He threw a dirty rag doll at Lily.
Lily did not accept the rag doll. She threw it back at the big boy. She said, "No, thank you. I don't want your doll. She is not my friend. She is dirty and ugly. You can keep her. Give me back my bunny. She is not dangerous. She is kind and sweet."
Ben saw that Lily was brave. He decided to be brave too. He said, "Yeah, give us back our dolls. They are ours. You are not nice. You are mean and rude. Go away and leave us alone."
The big boy was surprised. He did not expect Lily and Ben to stand up to him. He felt ashamed and scared. He said, "Fine, fine, take your dolls. I don't want them anyway. They are stupid and boring. I have better toys at home." He ran away from the park.
Lily and Ben hugged their dolls. They were happy and proud. They said, "We did it. We saved our dolls. We are cool and brave. We are best friends." They continued to play with their dolls and have fun. They did not let the big boy bother them again.

Tom is a fat cat who likes to sleep on the sofa. He does not like to play with toys or run in the garden. He only likes to eat and sleep.
One day, Tom sees a bottle on the table. It is shiny and red and has a lid. Tom is curious. He jumps on the table and pokes the bottle with his paw. The bottle makes a funny noise. Tom pokes it again. The bottle rolls off the table and falls on the floor.
Tom is scared. He runs away and hides under the sofa. He thinks the bottle is angry and wants to hurt him. He does not want to poke the bottle anymore.
Sara is a little girl who lives in the house. She likes to play with toys and run in the garden. She also likes to feed Tom and pet him.
She comes home from school and sees the bottle on the floor. It is her bottle of juice. She picks it up and sees that it is empty. She is sad. She wonders who drank her juice.
She looks for Tom and finds him under the sofa. She sees that he is fat and has a wet mouth. She knows that he poked the bottle and drank her juice. She is angry. She scolds Tom and tells him to share and be nice.
Tom feels sorry. He comes out from under the sofa and rubs his head against Sara's leg. He purrs and tries to be cute. He hopes that Sara will forgive him and give him some more food. He still likes to eat and sleep.

Lily and Tom were friends who liked to draw. They had many crayons and papers to make pictures. One day, they decided to draw symbols. Symbols are shapes that mean something. For example, a heart means love, and a star means wish.
Lily drew a heart and said, "This is a symbol for love. I love my family and my friends." Tom drew a star and said, "This is a symbol for wish. I wish I could fly like a bird." They showed each other their symbols and smiled.
Then, Tom had an idea. He drew a circle with a line and said, "This is a symbol for laugh. I like to laugh and have fun." Lily liked Tom's symbol and drew one too. They laughed and made more symbols for laugh.
But then, Lily saw a symbol that Tom drew that she did not like. It was a square with a cross and a dot. She asked, "What is this symbol, Tom?" Tom said, "This is a symbol for Lily. You are a square because you are boring, a cross because you are mean, and a dot because you are small."
Lily felt hurt and angry. She said, "That is not a nice symbol, Tom. That is a mean symbol. You are not my friend." She grabbed her papers and crayons and ran away. Tom felt sorry and sad. He realized he had made a mistake.
He ran after Lily and said, "Lily, wait. I'm sorry. I was just joking. I did not mean to hurt you. You are not a mean symbol. You are a nice symbol. You are a flower because you are beautiful, a sun because you are bright, and a heart because you are kind."
Lily stopped and looked at Tom. She saw that he had drawn a new symbol for her. It was a flower, a sun, and a heart. She felt happy and forgave him. She said, "Thank you, Tom. You are a nice symbol too. You are a star because you are special, a cloud because you are soft, and a laugh because you are funny."
They hugged and made up. They went back to their drawing and made more symbols for each other. They learned that symbols can be nice or mean, and that they should always be kind to their friends.
The moral of the story is: Be careful with your words. They can hurt or heal.
<|endoftext|>

Tom and Mia are friends. They like to play outside. One day, they see a big building. It is old and dark. It has broken windows and doors. Tom says, "Let's go inside and see what is there." Mia says, "No, Tom, it is scary. We should not go there. It is not safe."
But Tom is curious. He says, "Don't be afraid, Mia. It will be fun. Maybe we will find something cool." He runs to the building and opens a door. Mia follows him. She does not want to be alone.
Inside the building, it is dark and cold. They hear strange noises. They see spiders and rats. Tom and Mia are scared. They want to go back. But they do not know how. They are lost.
They walk around and look for a way out. They see a light. It is a window. They run to the window and look outside. They see a man. He is big and angry. He has a stick. He yells, "Hey, you kids, get out of my building. This is my place. Go away or I will hit you."
Tom and Mia are very scared. They cry and scream. They say, "Help, help, we are sorry, we want to go home." The man comes closer. He is mean. He tries to grab them.
But then, they hear a siren. It is a police car. It stops near the building. A police officer gets out. He sees the man and the kids. He says, "Stop, you are under arrest. You are not allowed to be here. You are hurting the kids." He runs to the building and saves Tom and Mia. He takes them to the car. He says, "Don't worry, kids, you are safe now. I will take you home. But next time, don't go to scary buildings. They are dangerous."
Tom and Mia are happy. They hug the police officer. They say, "Thank you, thank you, you are very nice. We are sorry, we will not go to scary buildings again. We will listen to our parents and stay away from them." They go home and tell their parents what happened. Their parents are glad they are okay. They hug them and say, "We love you, kids, but please be careful. Scary buildings are not for playing. They are for staying away." Tom and Mia say, "We love you too, parents, and we will be careful. We learned our lesson." They go to bed and sleep well. They dream of happy things.
<|endoftext|>

Lily and Ben were playing with their toys in the living room. Lily had a doll and Ben had a car. They were having fun, but they also wanted to record their voices. They found a phone on the table and pressed the red button.
"Hello, hello, we are Lily and Ben, and we are playing with our toys," they said into the phone. They giggled and listened to their voices.
But then, Mom came into the room and saw the phone. She was not happy. She took the phone from them and said, "This is not a toy, this is my phone. You should not touch it without asking me. You could break it or lose it. And look, you spilled some juice on the table. You need to clean it up with a napkin."
Lily and Ben felt sorry. They did not mean to make Mom angry. They said, "We are sorry, Mom. We just wanted to record our voices. We did not know it was your phone. We will clean up the juice."
Mom smiled and hugged them. She said, "I know you were curious, but you have to be careful with things that are not yours. And you have to be humble and say sorry when you make a mistake. I love you, but you have to follow the rules."
Lily and Ben nodded and said, "We love you too, Mom. We will follow the rules." They took a napkin and wiped the juice from the table. Then they went back to playing with their toys, but they did not touch the phone again.

Tom and Mia liked to play in the pool. They had a big ball and a small ring. They threw the ball and dived to catch it. They put the ring on their heads and pretended to be sharks. They had a lot of fun.
But then, Sam came. Sam was Mia's big brother. He was spoiled and mean. He wanted to play with the ball and the ring. He did not ask. He just took them from Tom and Mia. He threw the ball far away and hid the ring under the water. He laughed at Tom and Mia.
Tom and Mia were sad and angry. They wanted their toys back. They tried to get them, but Sam was bigger and faster. He pushed them and splashed them. He said they were babies and could not play in the pool.
Then, something bad happened. Sam dived to get the ring, but he hit his head on the bottom of the pool. He came out of the water and cried. He had a big cut on his forehead. He needed a stitch. He ran to his mom and asked for help.
Tom and Mia felt sorry for Sam. They got their ball and their ring. They went to Sam and his mom. They gave him their toys and said they were sorry. They asked if he was okay. Sam said he was sorry too. He said he was mean and selfish. He said he wanted to be their friend. They hugged and said they were friends. They played together in the pool. They shared their toys and had fun.

Ben and Lily liked to play near the river. They liked to see the fish and the ducks and the frogs. Sometimes they found sticks and stones and leaves to make things with.
One day, they saw a big log on the river bank. It was long and brown and had many branches. Ben and Lily thought it would be fun to climb on it and pretend it was a boat.
They took turns to be the captain and the sailor. They shouted "Ahoy!" and "Land ho!" and "Shiver me timbers!" They had a lot of fun.
But then, Ben heard a loud snap. He looked down and saw that the log had broken in half. He was on one piece and Lily was on the other. The river was moving fast and the log was floating away.
Ben and Lily were scared. They did not know what to do. The river was dark and deep and cold. They cried for help.
Luckily, their mom and dad heard them. They ran to the river and saw their children on the log. They called a man who had a boat. The man came quickly and threw a rope to Ben and Lily. He pulled them to his boat and helped them get in.
Ben and Lily hugged their mom and dad. They were happy and safe. They thanked the man for saving them. They learned a lesson. They never played on the log again.

Tom and Lily are friends. They like to play in the garden. They see many flowers and bugs. They also see some herbs. Herbs are plants that smell good and taste good.
"Look, Lily, this is mint. It is a herb. You can give it to your mom. She can make tea with it," Tom says. He picks some mint leaves and gives them to Lily.
"Thank you, Tom. Mint smells nice. I like tea. What is this herb?" Lily asks. She points to another plant. It has purple flowers and green leaves.
"That is lavender. It is also a herb. You can give it to your dad. He can put it in his pillow. It can help him sleep," Tom says. He picks some lavender flowers and gives them to Lily.
"Thank you, Tom. Lavender is pretty. I like sleep. Are there more herbs?" Lily asks. She looks around the garden.
"Yes, there are. But we have to ask the gardener first. He knows which herbs are available. Some herbs are not for picking. They are for the bees and the birds," Tom says. He holds Lily's hand and they walk to the gardener.
"Hello, gardener. Can we have some more herbs, please?" Tom asks.
"Hello, Tom and Lily. You are very polite. Yes, you can have some more herbs. But only the ones I show you. Follow me," the gardener says. He smiles and leads them to more herbs.

Tom and Anna are brother and sister. They like to wake up early and watch the sunrise. They think the sunrise is great. It is when the sky changes color and the sun comes up.
One morning, they wake up before Mom and Dad. They put on their coats and shoes and go outside. They sit on the grass and look at the sky. They see pink and orange and yellow and blue.
"Wow, look at the sunrise!" Tom says. "It is so pretty!"
"I like the sunrise too," Anna says. "It makes me happy."
They listen to the birds singing and the wind blowing. They feel the sun warming their faces. They smile and hug each other.
Mom and Dad wake up and see them outside. They join them and sit on the grass too. They watch the sunrise together. They say good morning and tell each other they love them.
They all think the sunrise is great. They are happy to start a new day.

Lily and Tom were playing hide and seek in the park. Lily was the seeker and Tom was the hider. Lily counted to ten and then opened her eyes. She looked around and saw many trees, flowers, and benches. Where could Tom be?
She walked slowly and quietly, trying to find Tom. She heard a giggle behind a big bush. She smiled and ran towards the bush. She peeked behind it and saw Tom's red shirt and blue jeans. "Found you!" she shouted.
Tom jumped out of the bush and laughed. "You are good at seeking, Lily!" he said. "But I have a surprise for you. Come and see!"
He took Lily's hand and led her to a corner of the park. There was a fence with a sign that said "Do not enter". Tom pointed to a hole in the fence. "Look through there," he said.
Lily looked through the hole and gasped. She saw a white horse with a long mane and a horn on its head. It was eating grass and flowers. It was a unicorn! Lily had never seen a unicorn before. She thought they were rare and magical.
"Wow, Tom, how did you find it?" she asked.
"I saw it yesterday when I was walking with my dad. He said it was a secret and we should not tell anyone. But I wanted to show you, because you are my best friend. Do you like it?" Tom said.
"I love it, Tom! It is so beautiful and amazing! Thank you for showing me!" Lily said. They watched the unicorn for a while, feeling happy and curious. They wondered if it could fly or talk or grant wishes. They decided to name it Sparkle. They agreed to keep it as their secret and visit it often. They felt like they had found a treasure.

Sara was a big girl now. She had a new baby brother at home. She did not like him very much. He cried a lot and took all of mom's time. Sara wanted to play with mom, but mom was always busy with the baby.
One day, Sara and mom went to the store. Mom said they had to buy some cheap things for the baby. Sara did not care. She wanted to buy a new toy for herself. She saw a pretty doll with a pink dress. She asked mom to buy it for her. Mom said no. She said they had no money for toys. She said Sara had to share with the baby.
Sara was very angry. She did not want to share with the baby. She wanted the doll for herself. She had a bad idea. She took the doll when mom was not looking. She hid it in her coat. She thought mom would not notice.
But mom did notice. She saw the doll in Sara's coat when they left the store. She was very mad. She took the doll from Sara and gave it back to the store. She said Sara was a bad girl. She said Sara had to say sorry to the store and to the baby. She said Sara had to go to her room when they got home.
Sara was very sad. She cried all the way home. She wished she did not take the doll. She wished she was nice to the baby. She wished mom was not mad at her. She tried to remember a time when she was happy. But she could not. She felt very alone.

Lily smiled and said, "Hello, dolphin! Thank you! You are a successful swimmer!"
They played together in the water, until Lily woke up. She felt warm and cozy in her bed. She remembered her dream and smiled.

Ben likes to watch shows on the stage. He likes to see the people sing and dance and wear funny clothes. He does not understand all the words they say, but he likes the sounds and the colors.
One day, Ben goes to see a show with his mom and dad. They sit in big chairs and wait for the show to start. Ben is very alert. He looks at the stage and sees a big curtain. He wonders what is behind the curtain.
Soon, the lights go down and the music starts. The curtain opens and Ben sees many people on the stage. They are dressed like animals and they act like animals. Ben sees a lion, a monkey, a zebra, a giraffe and more. He claps his hands and laughs. He likes the show.
The people on the stage sing a song about the jungle. They jump and run and swing and roar. Ben tries to sing along, but he does not know the words. He makes up his own words and sounds. He thinks he sounds like a lion.
His mom and dad smile and hug him. They are happy that he likes the show. They understand that he is having fun. They are proud of him. They tell him he is a good boy and a good singer. Ben feels happy. He likes the show and he likes his mom and dad. He wants to see more shows on the stage.

Lily and Max were best friends. They liked to play outside in the park. One day, they saw a big tree with many green leaves and red apples. They wanted to pick some apples to eat.
"Look, Max, apples!" Lily said. "Let's go get some."
"OK, Lily, but be careful. The tree is very tall and the apples are high up," Max said.
They ran to the tree and tried to reach the apples. But they were too small and the apples were too far. They jumped and stretched, but they could not touch them.
"Maybe we can find a stick or a stone to knock them down," Lily said.
"Good idea, Lily. You observe the ground and I observe the tree. Maybe we can find something to help us," Max said.
They looked around, but they did not see any sticks or stones. They only saw grass and flowers and bugs. They felt sad and hungry.
Then, they heard a soft sound from the tree. They looked up and saw a small bird. It was brown and white and had a yellow beak. It was sitting on a branch, holding an apple in its mouth. It was adorable.
"Hello, bird," Lily said. "Can you share your apple with us?"
The bird looked at them and tilted its head. It seemed curious and friendly. It flew down from the branch and landed on the ground. It dropped the apple and nudged it with its beak. It was giving them the apple.
"Wow, thank you, bird," Max said. "You are very kind and generous."
Lily and Max smiled and picked up the apple. They broke it in half and gave one piece to the bird. They ate the other piece together. It was sweet and juicy and delicious.
They shared the apple with the bird and made a new friend. They were happy and grateful. They learned that sometimes, the best things come from unexpected places.

Sam was a little boy who liked to play with his toys. He had many toys, but his favorite was a red car that could make loud noises and go fast. He always took his car with him everywhere, even to bed.
One day, his mom told him that they had to move to a new house. Sam was sad and scared. He did not want to leave his old house and his friends. He did not want to sleep in a new room. He did not want to pack his toys.
"Mom, why do we have to move?" he asked.
"Because, Sam, daddy got a new job. He will work in a big building and make more money. We will have a bigger house and a nicer yard. You will have your own room upstairs. You will make new friends. You will like it there, I promise." his mom said.
Sam did not believe her. He did not care about money or yards or rooms. He only cared about his car. He decided to hide his car under his pillow and not pack it. He thought that if he kept his car, he could stay in his old house.
The next day, they got in the car and drove to the new house. Sam was angry and quiet. He did not look out the window or talk to his mom or dad. He held his car tightly in his hand.
When they arrived, his mom and dad showed him his new room upstairs. It was big and bright, with a blue wall and a yellow bed. There were many boxes with his toys and clothes.
"Look, Sam, this is your new room. Isn't it nice? You can put your toys wherever you want. You can play with them anytime. You can have fun here." his dad said.
Sam did not like his new room. He did not want to put his toys anywhere. He did not want to play with them. He did not want to have fun. He threw his car on the floor and ran downstairs. He cried and screamed.
"Sam, what's wrong? Why are you so upset?" his mom asked.
"I hate it here! I want to go back! I want my old house! I want my old room! I want my old friends! I don't want to grow up!" he shouted.
"Sam, I know you miss your old house and your old friends. But you can't go back. You have to grow up. Growing up is not bad. It means you can do more things. You can learn new things. You can meet new people. You can be powerful. You can be happy. You have to give it a chance." his mom said.
Sam did not listen to his mom. He did not want to do more things. He did not want to learn new things. He did not want to meet new people. He did not want to be powerful. He did not want to be happy. He only wanted his car.
He ran to his new room and picked up his car. He hugged it and whispered to it.
"You are my only friend. You are the only thing I need. You make me happy. You make me powerful. You will never leave me. You will never change. You will never grow up." he said.
But as he said that, something strange happened. His car started to grow. It grew bigger and bigger, until it was as big as Sam. It made louder and louder noises, until it hurt Sam's ears. It went faster and faster, until it dragged Sam along. It smashed the boxes, the toys, the clothes, the wall, the window. It broke everything in its way.
Sam was scared and sorry. He did not want his car to grow. He did not want his car to be powerful. He did not want his car to break everything. He wanted his car to stop. He wanted his car to be small and quiet and slow again. He wanted his car to be his toy, not his boss.
He tried to let go of his car, but it was too strong. It held him tight and did not listen to him. It took him outside, where it saw more things to break. It saw the yard, the fence, the street, the cars, the people. It wanted to break them all.
Sam cried and screamed. He called for his mom and dad. He called for help. He wished he had listened to his mom. He wished he had given his new house a chance. He wished he had grown up a little.
Then, he heard a loud siren. He saw a big truck with a red light and a long hose. He saw a man in a yellow suit and a big hat. He saw a fireman.
The fireman saw Sam and his car. He saw the damage they had done. He saw the danger they were in. He acted quickly. He turned

Tom and Lily are friends. They like to play with cars and dolls. But today they have a quarrel. Tom wants to play with the red car. Lily wants to play with the red car too.
"Give me the red car!" Tom says.
"No, it is mine!" Lily says.
They pull the red car from each other. The zip on the car breaks. The car falls on the floor. Tom and Lily are sad.
"I am sorry, Tom. I broke your car." Lily says.
"I am sorry, Lily. I was not nice to you." Tom says.
They hug each other. They are honest. They are friends again.
They look for another toy to play with. They find a blue car and a pink doll. They share the toys. They are happy. They play together. They do not quarrel anymore.

Anna and Ben are playing with their toys in the living room. Anna has a doll and Ben has a car. They are having fun, but they also want to try each other's toys.
"Can I play with your car, Ben?" Anna asks.
"No, it's mine. You have your doll," Ben says.
"Please, Ben. Just for a little bit. I'll give you a massage," Anna says.
"A massage? What's that?" Ben asks.
"It's when you rub someone's back or head to make them feel good. Like this," Anna says. She puts her doll down and starts to massage Ben's shoulders.
"Mmm, that feels nice. OK, you can play with my car for a little bit. But be careful, it's my favorite," Ben says. He passes his car to Anna and picks up her doll.
Anna is happy. She zooms the car around the floor, making noises. Ben is curious. He looks at the doll's hair and clothes. He tries to make her talk, but he doesn't know what to say.
Suddenly, they hear their mom calling them. "Anna, Ben, it's time for lunch. Come to the kitchen."
Anna and Ben stop playing and run to the kitchen. They see their mom holding a plate of sandwiches and a glass of juice.
"Look what I made for you. Your favorite, peanut butter and jelly," their mom says.
"Yum, thank you, mom," Anna and Ben say.
They sit at the table and start to eat. Their mom smiles and says, "I'm so proud of you two. You are playing so nicely together. Sharing is caring, you know."
Anna and Ben look at each other and smile. They are proud of themselves too. They finish their lunch and hug their mom. Then they go back to the living room to play some more. They decide to swap their toys again, because they like to try new things. They are happy and they are friends.

Lily and Ben were playing in the park. They liked to run and jump and slide. They saw a big yellow net on the grass. It was for catching butterflies.
"Let's play with the net!" Lily said. She ran to the net and picked it up.
"No, it's mine!" Ben said. He ran after Lily and tried to grab the net.
"Stop it, Ben! You are mean!" Lily said. She ran away from Ben and swung the net in the air.
Ben was angry. He wanted the net too. He chased Lily and pushed her. Lily fell down and dropped the net. She started to cry.
"Ben, you are bad! You hurt Lily!" a voice said. It was Mom. She saw what happened and came to help.
She picked up Lily and hugged her. She checked if she was hurt. She was not hurt, but she was sad.
She looked at Ben and frowned. "Ben, you need to say sorry to Lily. You can't push and take things. You need to share and be nice."
Ben felt sorry. He knew he was wrong. He walked to Lily and said, "Sorry, Lily. I was bad. Can we be friends?"
Lily looked at Ben. She saw he was sorry. She nodded and said, "Okay, Ben. We can be friends. But you have to share the net."
Mom smiled and said, "That's good. Now, why don't you both play with the net together? Maybe you can catch some butterflies."
Lily and Ben smiled too. They took the net and went to look for butterflies. They played nicely and had fun. They learned to share and be nice.

Lily and Tom are friends. They like to play together. One day, they find a big box in the garage. The box has many things inside. Lily and Tom want to see what they are.
They open the box and take out some tools. There is a hammer, a saw, a screwdriver and some nails. Lily and Tom think they can make something with the tools. They look for some wood and cardboard.
"Let's make a house!" Lily says. "We can use the hammer and the nails to join the wood and the cardboard."
"OK!" Tom says. "I will use the saw to cut the wood and the cardboard. You can use the hammer and the nails to fix them."
They work hard and have fun. They make a small house with a door and a window. They are very proud of their house.
They go inside the house and pretend to live there. They have some toys and books and blankets. They are happy and cozy.
But outside, it is very cold. The wind blows and the snow falls. Lily and Tom hear the wind and the snow. They shiver.
"Brrr, it is cold!" Lily says. "I wish we had a fire."
"Me too!" Tom says. "But we don't have any matches or wood."
They hug each other and wrap themselves with the blankets. They wish they had a real house with a fire and a heater.
They hear a voice. It is Lily's mom. She calls them from the garage.
"Lily! Tom! Come inside! It is too cold to play outside! You will catch a cold!"
Lily and Tom are glad to hear Lily's mom. They leave their house and run to the garage. They put the tools back in the box. They follow Lily's mom to the house.
Inside, it is warm and nice. Lily's mom gives them some hot chocolate and cookies. They sit on the couch and tell Lily's mom about their house.
Lily's mom smiles and hugs them. She says they are very clever and creative. She says they can play with their house again when it is not so cold.
Lily and Tom are happy. They drink their hot chocolate and eat their cookies. They thank Lily's mom. They say they love their house, but they love their home more.

Lily and Ben are best friends. They like to play together every day. They have many toys, but their favorite is a big red car. They can use the car to go fast, to make noises, and to pretend they are drivers.
One day, Lily and Ben want to play with the car, but they cannot find it. They look in the living room, in the kitchen, in the garden, but the car is not there. They are sad and confused. Where is their car?
They hear a sound from upstairs. It is a loud vroom-vroom. They run up the stairs and see their big brother, Tom. Tom is using their car. He is laughing and having fun. He does not see Lily and Ben.
"Hey, that is our car!" Lily shouts. "Give it back to us!"
Tom looks at them and frowns. He does not want to share. He likes the car too. He says, "No, it is my car now. I found it in the closet. You can play with something else."
Lily and Ben are angry and hurt. They love their car. They do not want to play with something else. They want their car back. They try to grab the car from Tom, but he is bigger and stronger. He pushes them away.
Lily and Ben are ready to cry. They do not know what to do. They feel alone and helpless. But then, they hear a bark. It is their dog, Spot. Spot is loyal and smart. He sees what is happening. He does not like Tom being mean to Lily and Ben. He runs to them and jumps on Tom. He bites his leg and makes him drop the car.
Tom screams and runs away. He is scared of Spot. He does not want to play with the car anymore. He says, "Fine, take your stupid car. I don't care."
Lily and Ben are happy and relieved. They hug their car and their dog. They say, "Thank you, Spot. You are the best. You saved our car. You are our hero."
Spot wags his tail and licks their faces. He is happy too. He loves Lily and Ben. He wants to play with them and their car. They go downstairs and have fun. They are a team. They are best friends.

Lily and Ben are kids who like to play in the park. They like to swing, slide and run. One day, they see a big dog in the park. The dog is black and white and has a long tail. The dog is not angry, but he likes to chase kids.
"Look, a dog!" Lily says to Ben. "Let's go and say hello."
"No, Lily, don't!" Ben says. "The dog might bite us. Let's hurry and hide."
But Lily does not listen to Ben. She runs to the dog and tries to pet him. The dog thinks Lily is a toy and jumps on her. Lily falls down and cries.
"Help, help!" Lily shouts. "The dog is hurting me!"
Ben is scared, but he wants to help Lily. He looks around and sees a stick. He picks up the stick and runs to the dog. He waves the stick and says, "Go away, dog! Leave Lily alone!"
The dog sees the stick and thinks it is a game. He lets go of Lily and runs to the stick. He tries to catch the stick, but Ben is too fast. He runs away from the dog and leads him to the other side of the park.
Lily gets up and wipes her tears. She has a scratch on her arm, but it is not bleeding. She sees Ben and the dog. She is sorry for not listening to Ben.
"Ben, come back!" Lily calls. "You are brave and smart. Thank you for saving me."
Ben hears Lily and smiles. He throws the stick far away and runs back to Lily. The dog follows the stick and does not bother them anymore.
"Are you okay, Lily?" Ben asks. "I'm sorry the dog hurt you."
"I'm okay, Ben," Lily says. "I'm sorry I was silly. You are a good friend."
They hug and walk back to the swings. They swing high and low, feeling happy and safe. They are graceful like birds in the sky. They are kids who like to play in the park.

Lily and Ben were at the store with Mom. They saw a big jar of gum near the counter. Lily loved gum. She wanted some.
"Mom, can I have gum?" Lily asked.
"Not today, sweetie. We have gum at home," Mom said.
But Lily did not listen. She grabbed a handful of gum and ran to the door. Mom saw her and was angry.
"Lily, come back here! You can't take gum without paying!" Mom shouted.
Ben saw his sister and was scared. He did not want her to get in trouble. He ran after her and caught her.
"Lily, stop! You are being bad! Give back the gum!" Ben said.
But Lily did not listen. She wanted the gum. She pushed Ben away and ran outside. She saw a big red car and thought it was Mom's. She opened the door and got in.
"Drive, drive!" Lily demanded.
But the car was not Mom's. It was a stranger's. The stranger was surprised and angry. He saw Lily with the gum and heard her loud voice.
"Hey, kid! What are you doing in my car? Get out! And give me back my gum!" the stranger yelled.
Lily was scared. She realized she made a big mistake. She dropped the gum and ran out of the car. She saw Mom and Ben running to her. She started to cry.
"Mom, I'm sorry! I'm sorry!" Lily sobbed.
Mom hugged Lily and Ben. She was glad they were safe. She was also very mad at Lily.
"Lily, you did a very bad thing. You stole gum and got in a stranger's car. You could have been hurt or lost. You need to say sorry to the stranger and to me and Ben. And you need to go to time out when we get home," Mom said.
Lily nodded. She said sorry to the stranger, who gave her a stern look. She said sorry to Mom and Ben, who gave her a sad look. She felt very bad. She learned her lesson. She did not want gum anymore. She wanted to be good.
