Tom and Sue are friends. They like to play in the garden. They find a big potato in the dirt. They both want the potato.
"Give me the potato!" Tom says.
"No, it is mine!" Sue says.
They pull and tug. They quarrel and shout. They are not happy.
Mom hears them. She comes to the garden. She sees the potato.
"What are you doing?" Mom asks.
"We found a potato. We both want it." Tom and Sue say.
Mom smiles. She has an idea.
"Why don't you share the potato?" Mom says. "You can wash it and cut it. Then we can cook it and eat it together. It will be yummy."
Tom and Sue think. They like yummy food. They do not like to quarrel.
"OK, Mom. We will share the potato." Tom and Sue say.
They let go of the potato. They hug and say sorry. They are friends again.
They wash the potato and cut it. Mom cooks it and makes a salad. They sit at the table and eat. They talk and laugh. They are happy.
The garden is peaceful. The potato is gone. But Tom and Sue have something better. They have each other.

Tom and Sam were playing in the garden. They liked to look for bugs and animals. They saw a cricket on a leaf. It was green and shiny.
"Look, a cricket!" Tom said. "I want to catch it!"
He reached out his hand to grab the cricket. But Sam stopped him.
"No, Tom, don't!" Sam said. "Cricket is dangerous. It can slap you with its legs. It can hurt you."
Tom did not listen to Sam. He thought Sam was silly. He wanted to touch the cricket. He moved his hand closer to the leaf.
The cricket saw Tom's hand. It did not like Tom. It felt scared. It jumped off the leaf and slapped Tom's hand with its legs. Tom felt a sharp pain. He cried out loud.
"Ow, ow, ow!" Tom said. "The cricket slapped me! It slapped me!"
Sam ran to Tom. He hugged him and said sorry.
"I told you, Tom, cricket is dangerous," Sam said. "You should listen to me. I am your big brother. I know things."
Tom nodded. He was sorry too. He learned his lesson. He did not want to touch cricket again. He wanted to play with Sam. They went to find other bugs and animals. They had fun in the garden.
<|endoftext|>

Sara likes to write. She writes with her crayons on paper. She writes her name, and the names of her toys, and the things she sees. She writes big and small, and in many colors.
One day, she writes a story about a powerful dragon. The dragon is very big and strong. He can fly and breathe fire. He is the king of the sky and the land. He is very happy and kind. Sara likes her story. She shows it to her mom.
"Wow, Sara, this is a great story!" her mom says. "You are very good at writing. Where did you get the idea for the dragon?"
"I saw him in my dream," Sara says. "He was my friend. He told me his name is Rolo."
"That's a nice name," her mom says. "Do you want to keep your story, or do you want to throw it in the bin?"
"I want to keep it," Sara says. "I want to read it again and again. And maybe Rolo will come back in my dream."
"Okay, then," her mom says. "You can put it in your drawer, or on your wall, or wherever you like. But remember to clean up your crayons and paper, okay?"
"Okay, mom," Sara says. She puts her story in her drawer, and puts her crayons and paper in a box. She is very proud of her writing. She hopes Rolo will visit her again.
<|endoftext|>

Lily and Max were playing in the park. They liked to slide, swing and run. But Max was not careful. He tripped on a rock and fell down. He hurt his knee and it was bleeding.
"Ow, ow, ow!" Max cried. "It hurts!"
Lily ran to him and hugged him. She saw his knee and said, "You need a bandage. A bandage will make it better."
She looked around and saw a lady with a bag. She ran to her and asked, "Please, can you help? My friend needs a bandage. He has a boo-boo."
The lady smiled and said, "Of course, I can help. I have some bandages in my bag. What color do you want?"
Lily looked at Max and said, "What color do you want, Max?"
Max thought for a moment and said, "I want green. Green is my favorite color."
The lady nodded and said, "Okay, here is a green bandage. Let me put it on your knee. There, does it feel better?"
Max looked at his knee and saw the green bandage. He smiled and said, "Yes, it feels better. Thank you, lady. And thank you, Lily. You are a good friend."
Lily smiled and said, "You are welcome, Max. I am glad you are okay. Do you want to play some more?"
Max nodded and said, "Yes, I want to play some more. But let's be careful. I don't want another boo-boo."
They hugged the lady and said goodbye. Then they went back to the playground and played some more. They had fun and they were happy.

Tom and Mia like to play at the park. They like to slide, swing and climb on the structure. The structure is big and has many colors. Tom and Mia have fun on the structure.
One day, a new boy comes to the park. His name is Sam. He has a big bike and a loud voice. He sees Tom and Mia on the structure. He wants to play too. But he does not ask nicely. He says, "Move! This is my structure now!"
Tom and Mia are scared and sad. They do not want to leave the structure. They like to play there. They say, "No, this is our structure. We were here first. You can play with us, but you have to share."
Sam does not like to share. He says, "No, I do not want to share. I want the whole structure for myself. You have to go away. Or I will push you!"
Tom and Mia do not know what to do. They do not want to fight with Sam. They do not want to get hurt. They look for help. They see a lady on a bench. She is reading a book. She has a modest dress and a kind smile. She is Tom and Mia's teacher. They run to her and tell her what happened.
The teacher listens to Tom and Mia. She is not happy with Sam. She says, "That is not nice, Sam. You cannot take the structure from Tom and Mia. You have to be polite and respectful. You have to ask if you can join them. And you have to share the structure with them. That is how you make friends and play well."
Sam feels ashamed. He knows he was wrong. He says, "I am sorry, Tom and Mia. I was rude and mean. Can I play with you on the structure? I will share and be nice."
Tom and Mia are glad. They say, "Yes, you can play with us. We will share and be nice too."
The teacher smiles. She says, "That is good, Sam. I am proud of you. Now you can all play together and have fun on the structure."
Tom, Mia and Sam go back to the structure. They slide, swing and climb. They laugh and talk. They have fun on the structure. They are friends.

Lily and Ben are playing with their toy printer. They like to print pictures of animals and cars and flowers. Lily is very bossy. She tells Ben what to print and how to print it.
"Print a big lion, Ben. Lions are my favorite. Make it roar!" Lily says.
Ben does not like lions. He likes elephants. He wants to print an elephant. But he is afraid of Lily. She is bigger than him and louder than him. He prints a lion.
"Good, Ben. Now print a salad. Salads are healthy. We can pretend to eat it." Lily says.
Ben does not like salads. He likes pizza. He wants to print a pizza. But he is afraid of Lily. She is stronger than him and faster than him. He prints a salad.
"Good, Ben. Now print a crown. I am the queen. You are my servant. You have to do what I say." Lily says.
Ben does not like crowns. He likes hats. He wants to print a hat. But he is afraid of Lily. She is smarter than him and prettier than him. He prints a crown.
Lily puts the crown on her head. She holds the lion and the salad. She smiles. She is happy. She thinks she is the best.
Ben is sad. He does not have any pictures he likes. He does not have any fun. He thinks he is the worst.
Then, Mom comes in. She sees the pictures. She sees Lily and Ben.
"What are you doing, kids?" Mom asks.
"We are playing with the printer. I am the queen. Ben is my servant." Lily says.
"Is that so? And do you like being the queen, Lily?" Mom asks.
"Yes, I do. I am very bossy. I tell Ben what to print and how to print it." Lily says.
"And do you like being the servant, Ben?" Mom asks.
"No, I don't. I am very sad. I don't get to print what I want and how I want it." Ben says.
Mom frowns. She does not like what she hears. She does not like bossy queens and sad servants. She has an idea.
"How about we switch roles, kids? Lily, you can be the servant. Ben, you can be the king. You can print what you want and how you want it. And you have to be nice to each other. OK?" Mom says.
Lily and Ben look at each other. They are surprised. They are curious. They nod.
"OK, Mom." They say.
Mom smiles. She gives them a hug. She leaves them to play.
Lily and Ben switch roles. Lily gives Ben the crown. Ben gives Lily the lion and the salad. They start to print new pictures. They print elephants and pizzas and hats. They print stars and hearts and rainbows. They print what they want and how they want it. They share and take turns. They say please and thank you. They laugh and smile. They are happy. They think they are the best.

Lily and Ben are friends. They like to play in the park. They see a big swing. The swing is brown and has two seats.
"Can we go on the swing?" Lily asks Ben.
"Yes, let's go!" Ben says. They run to the swing. Lily gets on one seat and Ben gets on the other. They hold the ropes and push with their feet.
The swing goes up and down, up and down. Lily and Ben feel happy. They laugh and shout.
"Look, we are flying!" Lily says.
"We are so high!" Ben says.
They swing for a long time. They have fun. They do not want to stop. They want to swing more and more.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to design pretty dresses for her dolls. One day, she decided to design a special dress for her mommy's tea party.
Lily's mommy was very excited to see the dress Lily had designed. She poured some tea for herself and her friends and they all sat down to enjoy the party. But after a while, Lily started feeling dizzy and had to lie down.
Her mommy realized that Lily had forgotten to eat something before the party and gave her some cookies. Lily felt better and was able to join the party again. Everyone complimented her on her beautiful dress and she felt very proud of herself.
From that day on, Lily always made sure to eat something before attending a party. She also continued to design beautiful dresses for her dolls and her mommy's tea parties.

Once upon a time, there was a playful puppy named Max. Max loved to play with his toys and run around in the yard. One day, Max's owner gave him a new toy axe to play with. Max was so happy and ran around with it in his mouth.
Max's owner said, "I permit you to play with the axe, but you must be careful." Max wagged his tail and continued to play with the axe. Suddenly, Max accidentally hit a rock with the axe and it broke into pieces.
Max's owner was sad that the axe was broken, but he was happy that Max was okay. From that day on, Max played with his toys and ran around in the yard, but he never played with an axe again.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, she went to the park to play. She saw an empty swing and sat on it. Suddenly, she heard a noise and turned around. She saw a big owl sitting on a tree. She said, "Hello, Mr. Owl! Do you want to play with me?"
The owl replied, "No, I don't want to play. I am very hungry and need to find some food to eat."
Lily said, "Oh no! You can't fight with other animals to get food. That's not nice. Let's find some berries for you to eat together."
So, they looked for berries and found a lot of them. They sat together and ate the berries. The owl was very happy and said, "Thank you, Lily. You are a good friend." From that day on, they played together every day.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside and run in the grass. One day, Lily saw her mom carrying a big, heavy basket of clothes. 
Lily asked, "Mommy, what are you doing?"
"I'm doing the laundry, sweetie," her mom replied.
Lily wanted to help her mommy, so she asked, "Can I give you a hand?"
Her mom smiled and said, "Yes, you can help me fold the clothes. But be careful, some of them are heavy."
Lily was happy to help and started folding the clothes. She picked up a big, heavy towel and said, "This cloth is heavy, Mommy!"
Her mom laughed and said, "Yes, it is. But you're doing a great job helping me." 
Lily felt proud of herself for helping her mommy and they finished the laundry together.
<|endoftext|>

Her little brother, Max, came into the room and asked, "Can I see your watch, Lily?" Lily replied, "Sure, but be careful, it's fragile." Max looked at the watch and said, "Wow, it's so pretty!"
Later that day, Lily's friend came over to play. They were having so much fun, but then Lily's friend accidentally knocked over the watch. Lily was upset and said, "My watch is broken now." Her friend apologized and said, "I'm sorry, Lily. I didn't mean to break it." Lily forgave her friend and said, "It's okay, accidents happen. Let's play with our toys instead."

The veterinarian took the bird to her clinic and put a bandage on its wing. The bird felt much better and was happy to be able to fly again. The bird thanked the veterinarian and flew back to its tree. From that day on, the bird was very careful and made sure not to let anything bad happen to its wings again.

Lily ran inside and told her mommy, "Mommy, I saw a big, bright lightning in the sky! It was very loud." 
Her mommy said, "Yes, Lily, lightning can be very scary. But don't worry, we are safe inside." 
Lily was still a little scared, but she felt better knowing that she was safe. She hugged her mommy and said, "Thank you for keeping me safe, mommy. You're the best!" 
Her mommy smiled and said, "Of course, Lily. I will always keep you safe. Now, let's play a game of ring toss!" 
Lily smiled and forgot all about the lightning. She loved playing games with her mommy. Even though she was a little stubborn and wanted to win every time, she always had fun.

Max's owner picked him up and gave him a hug. They continued their walk and soon came across a zip on a jacket. Max was fascinated by the way it moved up and down. His owner showed him how to use the zip and Max tried it out himself. He was so proud when he was able to zip and unzip the jacket all on his own.
As they walked back home, Max couldn't stop thinking about the slide. He wanted to try it again and show his owner how brave he was. Once upon a time, there was a little bird named Tweet. Tweet was gray and loved to sing. One day, Tweet found a letter in her nest. The letter was from her friend, Squeak the mouse. 
"Dear Tweet," the letter said. "I am sad because I lost my cheese. Can you help me find it?" 
Tweet wanted to help her friend, but she was also feeling selfish. She wanted to sing and play all day. 
"I don't want to help Squeak find his cheese," Tweet said to herself. "I want to have fun." 
But then, Tweet thought about how she would feel if she lost her favorite worm. She knew how important it was to have friends who would help her. 
So, Tweet flew to Squeak's house and helped him look for his cheese. They searched high and low, and finally found it behind a big rock. 
"Thank you, Tweet!" Squeak said. "You are such a good friend." 
Tweet felt happy that she had helped her friend. She realized that being kind and helpful was more important than being selfish. And she even mailed a letter to Squeak to remind him that she would always be there for him.

Benny decided to water the herb every day. He was very alert and made sure the herb was getting enough water. But one day, Benny saw a big deer eating the herb! Benny was sad and angry. He said to the deer, "Why did you eat my herb? Now it cannot grow anymore!"
The deer replied, "I am sorry, little rabbit. I was hungry and did not know the herb was yours. I will not eat it again." Benny forgave the deer and they became friends. Benny continued to water the herb and it grew bigger and stronger than ever before. Benny was happy and proud of his herb.

"I want to be the hider!" Lily exclaimed.
"Okay," Mommy said, "I'll count to ten and then come search for you."
Lily quickly ran around the house, looking for a good hiding spot. She found a big box and climbed inside. It was a tight fit, but she was very flexible and managed to squeeze in.
Mommy finished counting and started searching. "Hmm, where could Lily be?" she wondered aloud.
Suddenly, Lily popped out of the box and yelled, "Found me!"
Mommy smiled and said, "You're such a good hider, Lily. I always enjoy playing with you."

"Thank you, Timmy," said Benny. "I like your shiny cane. Can I carry it for you?"
Timmy thought for a moment. "Sure, Benny! But be careful not to break it."
Benny picked up the cane and held it carefully in his big paws. "Don't worry, Timmy. I'll take good care of it."
From that day on, Benny and Timmy became the best of friends. Benny would often carry Timmy's cane for him, and Timmy would share his clever ideas with Benny. They had many adventures together in the forest, and they always looked out for each other.

But one day, the weather turned very cold and everything became icy. The flower started to shiver and it was very sad because it knew it would not bloom again until the weather became warm. But the little seed inside the flower knew that one day it would bloom again and it felt happy knowing that.

As the rain started to pour down, the duck felt happy and safe under the tree. But then, the rain got heavier and heavier, and the water started to rise. The duck realized that he needed to find a higher place to stay dry.
Suddenly, the duck remembered a big, wild bush that he had seen nearby. He knew that if he could get there, he would be safe from the rising water. So, he quickly swam to the bush and climbed up to the top. From there, he watched as the pond became completely soaked and flooded.
Thanks to the duck's quick thinking, he stayed safe and dry during the storm. And from that day on, he always remembered to look for a safe place when the rain started to pour down.

The hero had an idea. The hero said, "I will help you see the world. Let's stretch together!" So, the hero grabbed the rock and they stretched as far as they could. Suddenly, the rock started to roll and they went on an adventure together. They saw mountains, rivers, and even a big, blue ocean.
The rock was so happy and thanked the hero for helping it see the world. The hero replied, "It was my pleasure to help a friend." And from that day on, they were the best of friends and went on many more adventures together.

Once upon a time, there was a giraffe named Jerry. Jerry had a very long neck that he used to reach leaves on tall trees. One day, Jerry was walking in the jungle when he saw a monkey named Timmy. 
"Hi, Timmy!" Jerry said. 
"Hi, Jerry!" Timmy said back. "What are you doing today?" 
"I'm looking for some tasty leaves to eat," Jerry said. 
"I'm hungry too," Timmy said impatiently. "Let's find some bananas!" 
Jerry and Timmy walked through the jungle together, looking for food. Suddenly, they heard a loud noise. 
"What was that?" Jerry said. 
"I don't know," Timmy said. "Let's go see!" 
They walked towards the noise and found a group of elephants playing in the river. 
"Wow, that looks like fun!" Jerry said. 
"I want to play too!" Timmy said impatiently. 
The elephants saw Jerry and Timmy and said, "Hello! Do you want to play with us?" 
Jerry and Timmy happily joined in the fun and played in the river with the elephants all day long.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to go to the park and feed the ducks. He would open his bag of bread and throw pieces to the ducks. One day, Timmy saw a big duck that he had never seen before. The duck was very hungry and kept following Timmy around. Timmy didn't like this and started to complain to his mom. 
But his mom didn't listen and told Timmy to be kind to the duck. So Timmy kept feeding the duck, but the duck kept following him. Timmy got very angry and threw his bag of bread at the duck. The duck got scared and flew away. Timmy felt bad because he had hurt the duck's feelings. 
The next day, when Timmy went back to the park, he couldn't find any ducks. He looked everywhere, but they were all gone. Timmy realized that it was his fault that the ducks had left. He felt very sad and wished he had been kinder to the big duck. From that day on, Timmy always made sure to be kind to all animals, even if they followed him around.
<|endoftext|>
Once upon a time, there was a dog named Max. Max loved to play outside and chase his tail. One day, Max's owner told him to "stay" while she went inside the house. Max was a good dog and "obediently" waited for his owner to come back.
While waiting, Max saw a squirrel and wanted to "get" it. But Max remembered his owner's command to "stay" and decided to be a good dog. Max waited patiently until his owner came back outside.
Max's owner was very proud of him for being so "obedient." She gave him a treat and lots of love. Max was happy because he knew that being a good dog and following his owner's commands made her happy. From that day on, Max always "stayed" when his owner told him to, even when he wanted to "get" something.
<|endoftext|>
Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, Lily and her mom went outside to gather some flowers. They found many pretty flowers in different colors. Lily loved the pink ones the most.
Suddenly, Lily's mom felt sick. She had a fever. Lily had seen her mom use a thermometer before, so she ran inside to get it. She brought it back to her mom and helped her use it. The thermometer showed that her mom had a high temperature.
Lily said, "Mommy, you have a fever. We need to take care of you." Her mom smiled and said, "Thank you, Lily. You're not stupid. You're very smart and helpful." Lily felt happy that she could help her mom feel better.
<|endoftext|>
Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to dance and twirl around in her pretty pink dress. One day, she went to a party and saw a big cake with zero candles on it. The cake looked so delicious that Lily couldn't resist taking a bite. 
As she ate the cake, she felt so happy that she started to dance again. Her friends joined in and they all danced together, laughing and having fun. Lily realized that even though there were zero candles on the cake, the party was still amazing. 
From that day on, Lily danced whenever she felt happy, and she always remembered that even if there were zero candles, there was still plenty to celebrate. And whenever she ate something delicious, she couldn't help but dance a little jig.

Once upon a time, there was a little duck who lived in a pond. The pond was very wide and there were many other animals living there too. Every day the duck would swim around, looking for food and friends to play with.
One day, the duck found a new friend - it was a frog! The duck and the frog had lots of fun together swimming in the pond. They would swim around until they were so tired.
But one day, the frog felt very sick and couldn't swim. The duck was very worried, so it asked its other animal friends what to do. They said that they need to get the frog some special medicine that would make it feel better.
So, the duck and the other animals went on a big journey to find the medicine. After a long time, they finally found it! They quickly brought it back to the pond, so that the frog could take it and get better.
And sure enough, the frog felt much better after taking the medicine - it could swim again! The duck was so happy that it hopped around and splashed in the water with the frog. They had lots of fun, swimming around in the wide pond.
<|endoftext|>
Once upon a time, in a far away land, there lived a little boy called John. He lived in a castle and he was very curious and loved to explore. One day, he decided to explore a mysterious forest nearby. 
As he walked, he saw something sparkling on the ground. It was a bottle containing a special glue. He picked it up and opened it. When he did, something magical began to happen.
The glue started to grow and grow. Soon it began to rise up off the ground, and it kept going, until it was as tall as a giant tree. John discovered that the glue could make anything he wanted, so he asked it to build him a treehouse. 
The glue began to build a treehouse right before his eyes. It rose higher and higher and before he knew it, he had a beautiful treehouse to play in. John was overjoyed and enjoyed playing in his mysterious treehouse every day. 
The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl who was very eager to play. She asked her mom if she could invite a friend over to play. Her mom said yes, so the little girl ran off to invite her friend.
When her friend arrived, they decided to play a game. They each picked a bulb and had fun pretending to plant flowers in a pretend garden.
The little girl had a great time with her friend. They played together until it was time for her friend to go. When her friend left, the little girl was sad but still very eager for their next play date.

One day, Mommy was doing the laundry. She put some clothes into the washing machine and then she poured some soap over them. She wanted to make sure the clothes were really clean, so the machine filled up with water and all the clothes began to soak. 
Daddy was cooking dinner in the kitchen. He had a big pot on the stove and he was making a yummy stew. But soon, he realized he left his cell phone near the stove and it had gotten very wet. He was so sad that he had made a mistake and ruined his phone.
Mommy and Daddy called their little 3 year old daughter on the other phone to come over and see what had happened. When the little girl saw the wet phone, she quickly ran to get her wash cloth. She came back and began to gently wipe away the water from the phone, until it was all dry.
Mommy and Daddy were so impressed with their daughter's determination and care. They praised her for her quick fix and told her how proud they were of her. Later, they realized that their spoiled little girl had rescued Daddy's phone!
<|endoftext|>

Mama, Papa and baby Lucy went to the park in the evening. They heard the birds chirping and the leaves rustling in the breeze. The sun was setting and the sky was getting darker.
Papa took out a big blanket from his bag and spread it on the grass. Mama carried Lucy up to the playground and put her in the swing. Mama and Papa pushed her high and Lucy shouted with joy. She felt like she was flying in the sky.
Papa then went to get two large ice creams. They were so yummy! Mama and Lucy shared the ice cream and made funny faces. Papa then went to the top of the slide and tickled Lucy when she came down. They all laughed and laughed.
The last thing they did before going home was ride the large merry-go-round. It was slow enough for them to stay on but fast enough to feel like they were going super quickly. They laughed as they spun round and round.
Finally, they said goodbye to the park and promised to come back soon. Lucy was tired but happy. She hugged her mama and papa and held their hands as they walked home.

Once upon a time there was a princess. She loved to clap. She was the best clapper in the world. Her clapping was so brilliant it made her happy all the time.
Every day the princess looked for things to clap about. She wanted to find the loudest and happiest things around her.
One day, the princess found a label. It said, "Clap if you're happy!" She was so excited, she clapped and clapped. She was so pleased with the label that she took it home with her.
Every day, the princess made the label happy by clapping whenever she saw it. She clapped and clapped until the label seemed to smile.
The princess was so proud to show off her brilliant clapping. She was so happy that she clapped even louder and brighter than before. Everyone who heard her clapping said she was the best.
The princess was so pleased that she kept clapping every day, and always will. Clapping made her days brighter and better, and that made her smile bigger and bigger.

Once upon a time there was a girl named Anna. She was very brave. One day Anna wanted to try something new and exciting. She asked her mom for help and her mom said yes! 
The mom and Anna went to a store. There were lots of colorful things to see. Anna saw a big needle and stared at it. She wondered what she could do with it. 
Her mom said that they could make something special. Anna was very excited and helped pick out some colorful fabric and pretty buttons. When it was time to use the needle, they put safety glasses on Anna and she was ready. 
Anna practiced poking the fabric with the needle. She was a natural! She carefully sewed the fabric and added the colorful buttons. When she was done, she had made a beautiful dress. Anna was so proud of her work. 
The mom said that the dress was perfect and the two of them had such a fun day together! They were both very thankful for the special needle that helped Anna to create something amazing.

Once there was a wild squirrel. He lived in a tree and liked to act silly. He would run up the trunk and around the branches, then be daring and jump across the gap to another tree. He would act very brave and shake his tail wildly. 
Every day, he would act curious and search for tasty nuts to eat. He looked up and down the tree, sniffing and tapping the bark. He scampered down the trunk to see if there were any hidden nuts on the ground. 
One day, the squirrel spotted a delicious looking nut on the ground - it was big and wild. He quickly grabbed it with his little claws and ran back up the tree. He was so happy with his prize that he acted very proudly. He shook his tail in victory and settled down to enjoy his snack. 
The squirrel was so pleased that he decided to act happy and climb another tree. He was determined to find more wild nuts and have more tasty treats!

But one day, the boy started to pause. He didn't do anything, he just stopped. He stared around the room and wondered why it was so boring. He wanted something new and fun.
Then suddenly, he had an idea! He would play a game. He started to move around the room, jumping and singing and having fun. His boredom was gone.
The little boy had a great time, and he never forgot this day. He learned that you don't have to stay bored, even if you are in the same room all the time.

Mia was a very happy little girl. One day she was walking in the park and she saw an apple tree. She went to the tree and she saw lots of apples. She was so excited! Mia reached up and tried to pick an apple, but it was too high. She didn't know what to do.
Suddenly, Mia heard a voice. It was a tiny, friendly voice. "Hello," said the voice, "my name is Joey. I can help you." Mia was very surprised. She looked around and saw Joey, a tiny blue bird.
Joey flew to the branch and picked an apple. He brought it back to Mia and said, "Here you go." Mia was so excited! She thanked Joey and said goodbye.
Mia ate the apple in the peaceful park. It was the sweetest apple she had ever tasted. She knew she would always remember this special day.

Once upon a time, there was a nut. It was a flexible nut and it lived in a tree. One day, it was very sunny and hot. The warm sun made the nut feel sleepy. So it rolled itself off the tree, and landed in some mud.
The mud was very wet, and the nut started to soak. It wasn't a comfortable feeling, but the nut stayed in the mud and kept soaking.
After a while, the nut felt much better. The mud had made it flexible, so it could roll around on the ground. The nut was very happy and said goodbye to the mud.
It rolled back to the tree, and stayed there for many days, feeling flexible and content. The end.

First, she went to a lab. It was a big, big place with lots of machines. Jane thought it was very exciting. She looked around and found a hidden door. She opened it and inside was a secret room!
Inside the room was a beautiful bow. Jane was so excited. She touched it and it sparkled. She asked herself what to do with it. Then she smiled and made a plan.
Jane took the bow and went outside. She carefully hid it in the bushes so that no one would find it. Then she ran back home.
The next day when Jane came back, the bow was still in its hiding spot! She smiled and carefully picked it up. Jane twirled and danced with the bow and thought she was the luckiest girl in the world.

Once there was a classroom full of children who sailed to school each day. Most of the time, they got along together quite nicely. But one day, things were different.
One of the children was very troubled. He had been crying, and his classmates began to worry. So they decided to come up with a plan. They told him they would go sailing together the next day.
The next morning, the children all put on their jackets and jumped into the boat they had brought. They sailed up and down the river, laughing and singing together. By the time they reached school, the troubled child was smiling!
The children had a great day in their classroom. They discussed what had happened and how their plan had worked. In the end, sailing helped the children to understand how important friendship is.

Daniel was a brilliant three year old. He loved to sort things. One day his mum brought home a big box. Inside the box was lots of different tops. Daniel couldn't wait to sort them all out.
First, he sorted the tops into colours. He put all the red ones together and all the blue ones together. Then, he sorted them by size. He put all the big ones in one pile and all the small ones in another. 
After that, he sorted them by shape. He put all the round ones in one group and all the square ones in another. When he had sorted them all, he looked at his piles and felt very proud. He had sorted them all in a very brilliant way. 
Daniel's mum was very proud too and she gave him a big cuddle. She told him how brilliant he had been. Daniel was so happy - he couldn't wait to go sorting again the next day.

Nina lay in her bed. The sun was so hot, it made her angry. She wanted to get up and play but she was too tired. 
Suddenly, she heard something outside her window. It sounded like birds chirping and it made her happy. She slowly got out of bed and walked to the window. 
Nina saw a big tree with lots of birds sitting on its branches. She said hello to the birds and they all chirped back. She smiled and waved to them. 
But then, some angry crows came to the tree. The crows were so loud and they chased away the birds. Nina got really mad. She started to yell at the crows and they flew away.
Nina smiled, happy that the birds were back. She waved goodbye to them and then went back to her bed. She lay down, feeling happy and content.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sarah. She loved to play in the park and with her toys. One afternoon, Sarah got a very special surprise: a birthday cake! She was so excited and wanted to show it to everyone. She ran to her mom and dad and said, "Look what I got!" 
Her mom grabbed her hand and said, "Let's go show everyone!" So they took the big beautiful cake to the park next door. When they arrived, all of Sarah's friends saw it and cheered! They wanted to eat it right away. 
But Sarah's mom said, "Wait a minute! I have a special surprise!" She opened a box to reveal a fake cake! "It looks so real!" said Sarah. It was made of plastic with pretend icing and colorful sprinkles. Everyone laughed when they saw the fake cake. 
They all had so much fun that day. Sarah was so happy that she got to show off her cake, even if it was fake. And when it was time to go home, it was still one of the best days ever!

Eventually, the news was finished and the man smiled. He put the white paper away and left the news room to tell everyone the news. Everyone was so happy when they heard the news that they wanted to keep it forever.
So the man found a way to record the news. He put it on a special machine that turned it into sounds. Everyone was so amazed when they heard the recorded news! They listened to it every day, so they would never forget the news. 
The end.

He looked around, but he couldn't see anything. Then, he noticed something fluffy and white moving through the trees. It was a big fluffy bear! It ran along the hard track and Mike followed it. He was so excited.
The bear ran and ran until it reached a rock. Suddenly, it started to cover the rock with its furry body. Then, it stopped and just lay there.
Mike was so amazed by what he had seen. It was like the bear had its own special track. From that day forward, Mike remembered how the bear had covered the hard track with its body.

The boy went back to the store and asked the man for a case again. This time the man was not so harsh and said yes. The boy was so happy and bought the case.
He took the case home and put all of his toys inside of it. He was never sad again because now he had a pretty and useful case. The End.

Then something magical happened! Jimmy put his hand in the bag and he felt something furry. Suddenly, the bag became alive. Out popped a small, soft kitty, who purred and mewed. Her fur was soft and fluffy, and she looked so cuddly.
Jimmy was so excited to have a real pet. He named her Daisy, and he gave her some food and played games with her. They were best friends and did everything together. Jimmy and Daisy were now inseparable.

He looked up and noticed his collar was missing. He started whining and crying, looking for it everywhere. He looked under the chairs and tables, but still couldn't find it.
Suddenly he saw a cat sitting in a tree. It had his collar in its mouth. The puppy was very happy. The cat jumped down and handed him his collar.
He was thankful and put it back on his neck. He then went back to playing, never to forget how important his collar was.

Once upon a time, there was a green frog. He hopped around a big pond and liked to dance for fun. One day, the sun was very hot and the frog was so hot that he needed to cool off. So, he danced in the pond to cool down. He kept hopping from side to side and up and down and he felt the cool water against his body. The heat from the sun went away and soon he was feeling cold. He was so happy that he hopped out of the water and kept on dancing. He had so much fun dancing in the sun and he smiled with joy. He kept on dancing until his body was tired and he hopped back into the pond to go to sleep. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a pistol. It was shiny and silver. Everyone wanted it because it was so special. 
The pistol had a secret. It could close and that was fun. Everyone tried to see what it could do. One day, a little girl was embarrassed. She wanted to try the pistol too. 
She closed her eyes tight and pulled the trigger. To her surprise, the pistol closed and she opened her eyes wide. Everyone was so excited by the surprise. They all cheered. The little girl blushed. She was embarrassed but so proud of herself. 
The little girl continued to try the pistol. Every time she closed it correctly, she was so happy. 
The End.

One day, his mom saw him taking a toy from one of his friends. She became very angry and decided to punish him for being so selfish. She asked him to tie a knot in a piece of string, and then untangle it.
The boy tried, but the knot was too hard. He then realized how selfish he had been and asked his mom to forgive him. His mom knew he was sorry and let him off the punishment. From then on, the boy never took any of his friends' toys again.

She felt so much better and was even happier than before! She flew back to her home and shared the apple with her fairy friends. From that day on, the fairy was never lonely again and the bitter apple had helped to heal her.

Soon, the wool started to look like a big bright ball. Lola rolled the wool around until it was really nice and round. Lola was very proud of her work.
The next day, Lola took her wool ball outside to play with her friends. She and her friends laughed and smiled as they rolled the bright wool around the grass.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Sam. He was only three years old, but he was very brave.
One day, Sam went for a long hike in the woods. He saw so many wonderful things, such as birds singing in the trees and blossoms growing on the ground.
Sam noticed something shiny at the bottom of a stream. He waded in carefully, and then he saw it! It was a big chunk of gold.
Sam wanted to take it with him, but he knew that he had to make a choice. He thought and thought and finally, he decided to leave it there and go back home.
When he got home, his mum asked why he hadn't chosen the gold. Sam told her all about his hike, and how he thought it would be more helpful to leave it where it was.
His mum was so proud of him. She smiled and said, That was a very brave and helpful choice you made Sam! Sam smiled in return, happy that he had made the right decision.

Mary was fearful as she gazed at the cage. Inside were two small kittens, their eyes peeking out between the bars. She wanted to take them home and keep them safe.
She reached out her hand and meowed softly. The kittens meowed back and moved closer to the cage door. Then, with a gentle smile, Mary opened it and watched them scamper away.
Mary watched them from the window, still feeling very fearful. She had never been so close to such small animals before and wasn't sure if she had done the right thing.
But then, much to her surprise, the kittens came back to her, hopping up onto the windowsill. They meowed and rubed against her hand until she couldn't help but be filled with joy.
Mary looked at the cage and realized it was no longer needed. Now she and the kittens were friends, and she knew they wouldn't want to be locked away. She gathered them into her arms, feeling relieved and excited to take them home.

Tommy was scared. He felt very itchy. He looked around and couldn't find anyone to help him. Everywhere he looked he felt the itchy feeling. He tried to stop the itch by scratching, but it just wouldn't go away. 
He went to find his mommy, hoping she could help. But when he got to the kitchen, he was all alone. He started to cry and he felt really scared and itchy. 
But then he saw the door to the garden. He remembered something his mommy said about the garden being special. Without thinking he opened the door and stepped outside. Immediately, the itchy feeling went away! 
Tommy couldn't believe it. He started to run around the garden and he felt so happy! He wanted his mommy to come out too, so she could feel the same! 
The end.

Once upon a time, there was an ancient jar. The jar was very special and the people that lived nearby were in awe of it. 
They used to tell stories about the jar, about how it used to be full of treasures. The jar was said to be full of secrets that only it knew. 
One day, a three-year-old boy was walking by the jar. He was so small and curious and he wanted to see what was inside. 
He went up to the jar and gently touched it with his little hands. Suddenly, the jar began to glow. 
The boy was so amazed that he just kept looking at the jar until it disappeared. He never told anyone what he saw, but the jar was still talked about in the town.

Once upon a time, there was a yellow bird. His name was Quick. He lived in the big green tree. Quick loved to hang from the tree branches. He thought it was so much fun!
One day, Quick was hanging from a branch when he heard a noise. It was a cat - it wanted the bird for dinner! Quick was scared, so he flapped his wings and flew away. 
Quick flew high in the sky. He was so far away from the cat now. He was so glad he could fly so quickly!
Quick flew all the way home to his tree. He was so happy to be back. He decided that it would be safer to hang on a branch inside the tree, instead of outside.
So Quick hung his claws onto a branch and fell fast asleep. He was relieved to be safe in the tree and to have such a yellow and quick bird body to fly away with. That was the end of Quick's scary adventure!
<|endoftext|>

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Sue. She loved to play outside, but nothing made her happier than when she would take her tricycle for a ride!
One day, Sue was flying along on her tricycle. She really felt amazing, zipping around the streets. Suddenly, she felt a bump on her knee. It was a pebble that had gotten stuck!
Sue was crying, but then she felt something tickling her nose. What was it? She took a closer look and saw a tiny mouse doing cartwheels around her knee! She was amazed.
The mouse had a little paper bag in his hands. He handed it to Sue and she opened it up. Inside was a shiny pearl!
The mouse said, "This will help your knee get better." Sue thanked him and put the pearl in her pocket. She hopped back on her tricycle and zoomed off into the sunset!
<|endoftext|>

One day a 3 year old was given a microphone. He was so excited that he opened it up right away. When he looked inside, he was amazed to find a small, shiny button. He pressed it and he heard a loud noise!
He grabbed the microphone and started speaking into it. He kept talking and singing, until he heard his voice on the radio. He was so surprised that he shouted out loud.
This made the 3 year old even more excited. He had so much fun that he asked his friends to come over. They all had a great time pretending they were rock stars, each taking turns at the microphone.
The 3 year old soon realized he was getting better and better with the microphone. He started to get competitive, wanting to be the loudest one in the room! He kept practicing and got better and better. Soon all his friends were impressed with how well he was doing.
Eventually he became a professional performer. All his friends were proud of him and he even got to perform in front of an audience of thousands!
The 3 year old had worked really hard, and it paid off. All thanks to his very special microphone!
<|endoftext|>
 
Mia and her mom went to the park. It was very pretty! Mia wanted to play on the swings, but her mom wanted to go for a walk. 
Mia spotted something in the grass - it was a broccoli! It looked so tasty! She asked her mom if she could pick it up. 
Mom said no, so Mia scrunched up her face and stamped her foot. But when Mia kept stamping her foot, her mom said that she would make her a special lunch - it would be broccoli and cheese! That sounded delicious! 
Mia was so happy that she grabbed her mom's hand and skipped all around the park. She even said the broccoli made their park trip even more pretty!
<|endoftext|>

Molly and her family went to the park. They observed the sunshine and the blue sky. Molly saw a lot of birds flying around and some butterflies. She was tired and a bit sleepy.
The sun was very warm and the air was still. Molly closed her eyes and laid down in the grass. She could feel the sunshine on her and relaxed. She thought it was the coziest feeling.
Molly's mom saw her and went over to tell her it was time to go home. She was so sleepy and happy that she didn't want to leave. She said goodbye to the sunshine and followed her mom home.
Molly fell asleep on the way home in the car. She was so happy that she had the opportunity to spend some time with the sunshine. She couldn't wait to go back again to observe the blue sky and the birds flying around.
<|endoftext|>

Little Tom was playing in his room. Suddenly, he heard a noise coming from the ceiling. He looked up and saw a crack. He was worried. He ran to his mom to tell her what he had heard. His mom went to the room to have a look at the ceiling. She said to Tom, "Don't worry, I will fix it." Tom felt relieved. His mom called a repairman to come and fix the ceiling. The repairman looked at the crack, then got all the things he needed and started to work. Soon little Tom heard a tapping noise above. The repairman had fixed the ceiling quickly and it looked perfect. Little Tom was happy that the ceiling was fixed and he ran back to his room to play.
<|endoftext|>
Once upon a time, there was a patient bear. He liked taking walks in the forest. One day, as he was walking, he came across a large tree with very thick branches. The bear was excited, he wanted to climb the tree! He tried, but he couldn't reach the upper branches. He was very sad, he wanted to experience what it was like from the top of the tree.
Suddenly, a man appeared and knew exactly what the bear wanted. The man pulled out a saw and said he could help. He carefully cut away some of the thick branches. The bear saw that the man was very patient and made sure to cut away the branches without hurting the tree.
After the man was done, the bear thanked him. He was so happy he could now climb the tree. He climbed all the way to the top and looked out at the beautiful forest. He realized how happy he was that the man was so patient and cut away the branches just right, so that he could enjoy this view. 
The end.
<|endoftext|>

Once upon a time, there was a messy turkey. It had feathers everywhere and didn't look very nice at all. One day, the messy turkey wanted to find somewhere special to go. So, it started to wander off through the woods.
As the turkey wandered, it saw a secret door. It was curious to see what was behind it, so the turkey hopped right up to the door. It was scared but still excited, then it revealed what was hiding behind the door.
The turkey found an amazing surprise! There were lots and lots of yummy toys and treats! The turkey was so excited and started to eat all the food. It ate so much food, it felt so full!
The mess turkey was so happy to have found the secret door and all the food behind it. It went back to the woods and revealed its happy secret with all its friends. They all had a great time enjoying the yummy treats.
<|endoftext|>

Once upon a time, there were two friends: Alex and Zoe. Zoe had a very special idea - she wanted to count to ten! Alex was so excited to hear Zoe's idea because he had never heard of counting before. It sounded like a very new and unknown thing to do.
The friends decided to try it. First they counted with their toes. Then their fingers. They even counted the animals they saw in their garden! Alex and Zoe were having so much fun counting.
Next, they had a new idea. They decided to try to count to ten in the sky. They both looked up and there were many colourful things to count. They counted the white clouds and the bright stars.
In the end, Alex and Zoe counted to ten in the sky together! It was a fun, new activity and they felt so proud of themselves. Now, when they go out to play, they love to count the things they see.
<|endoftext|>

Once upon a time, there was a red mine. It was mine all by itself. Every day, the mine had something special to do. Today, the mine was to complete a task.
The mine worked hard on the task. It tried its best to finish it. Finally, the mine was done. The task was complete!
The mine was so happy. It danced and sang. Everyone around could see how happy it was.
The mine was proud of itself. It had completed its task all by itself. After a while, the mine went back to its red home, feeling glad it had finished its job. 
The end.
<|endoftext|>
Once upon a time, there was a beautiful independent dove. She liked to stay on her own and do her own thing. One day she was flying around looking for somewhere to stay for the night.
Suddenly she saw a nice big tree with a cozy nest in its branches. She flew over to take a closer look. The nest looked perfect, so she decided to stay there for the night.
She settled down in the nest, feeling nice and safe there. But just when she was about to sleep, a little bird flew up to see who was there. It was a little three year old bird.
The three year old bird was happy to see the dove and asked if she was staying in the nest. The dove said yes, and the three year old bird asked if they could stay together.
The dove thought about it and thought it would be nice to have some company. So she said yes, and the whole night they stayed together in the nest, chatting and laughing and telling stories until the morning.
The next morning the dove said goodbye to the three year old bird and flew away to find another place to stay. But she was always thankful for her night with the little bird. From then on, she was even more independent, ready to stay anywhere she wanted.
<|endoftext|>

Mary walked down the street with her mom. She saw a figure at the park that seemed very old. The figure was wearing a big hat, a long coat and was walking very slowly. Mary knew the figure was elderly.
Her mom stopped and said hello to the figure. Mary heard them chatting happily. She saw the figure smile and was happy too.
They talked for a while before the figure started walking away. Mary and her mom waved goodbye.
Mary felt happy when she saw the elderly figure. She seemed so nice and friendly. Mary smiled and looked forward to seeing the figure next time.

Charlie walked along the beach. He saw a group of kids jumping in the sand. He wanted to join them, so he ran up and jumped with them.
The kids were excited. They gave Charlie a bow and showed him how to play a game. Every time Charlie picked up the bow, he jumped as high as he could.
Charlie saw that some of the kids were very persistent. They jumped again and again, until they were the highest. Charlie wanted to be like them, so he jumped again and again. He got higher and higher.
Soon, Charlie was the highest jumper. The other kids cheered and congratulated him. Charlie felt proud of himself. He couldn't believe he had done it.

Once upon a time there was a brown junk. It had lots of pieces that wouldn't stay together. One day, a kid came by and saw the junk. She wanted to fix it up.
The kid grabbed some spray and started spraying the junk. The aerosol made the brown junk look shiny and new. Now it was easier to fit the pieces together. 
The kid kept spraying until everything was attached. She looked at the junk with pride. Now it was nice and new! She was very happy and went off to play with her new toy. 
The end.

Once upon a time there was an ant. He was walking through the woods and he came to a meadow. In the meadow, he saw something delicious. It was a cookie! The ant was so happy and he wanted to stay and eat the cookie.
The ant looked around to make sure no one was watching. Then he quickly grabbed the cookie and started to eat it. He was so happy and it was so delicious. He kept eating until he finished the whole thing. 
When the ant was done, he was full. He was so happy that he stayed in the meadow and started to look for more delicious things to eat. And that is the story of the ant who found a delicious cookie.

Once upon a time there was a boy who wanted to be brave, so he decided to go in the ocean all by himself. He put on his swimsuit and jumped in. He saw a big shark and became very scared. He wanted to run away but the shark started to come closer.
The boy tried to stay calm and he thought of a plan. He raised his arms and started to make loud noises. The shark stopped moving and the boy felt brave again. 
He was so proud that he had faced the shark and he waved at it as it swam away. On the shore, he heard his family shouting his name. They were very proud of the boy and they thanked him for being brave.
The boy felt ashamed because he had been so scared at first. But, his family told him he was very brave and he shouldn't be ashamed of being scared. The boy smiled and hugged his family, and he knew he was brave enough to face the shark.

Once upon a time there was a mom and dad who had a baby girl. She was very eager to make something fun. One day when her mom and dad were outside, she found a lime. She ran up to her mom and dad and showed them what she had found. They said she could make something fun with it.
The little girl was very excited. She put the lime in a cup and added some water and sugar. She stirred it and watched the lime turn into a special drink. She was so proud of her work.
The little girl was eager to share her drink with her mom and dad. She entered the kitchen and found them there. With a smile she presented them her lime drink. Her mom, dad and everyone else in the house all enjoyed it. 
The little girl was very proud of herself. She was happy that she was able to make something fun with the lime and make her family happy.

He started looking around the house for things of different colors. He found a red toy car, a yellow book and a green blanket. Jimmy was so proud of himself for finding all the colors of the rainbow.
He started playing with the colors and started mixing them together. He created a beautiful purple and orange ball. His mum was so proud of his creativity and gentle studying.
Jimmy continued to study colors, shapes and other topics with his mum. He enjoyed exploring, learning and having fun all in one.

Mama and Papa went to the store and bought a big surprise for their three year old daughter. It was a thick, black grill for their backyard. The little girl was so excited, she could not wait to try it out! She asked mama if she could have a barbeque party soon. Mama smiled and said yes. She promised her daughter she would make all of her favorite burgers, hotdogs, and roasted vegetables.
The little girl smiled, ran off to play and did not forget about the promise. A few days later, Papa, Mama, and the little girl went to the backyard. Papa set up the grill, Mama put on her special cooking hat, and together they loaded the big grill with all the food.
The little girl watched as the grill heated up while Papa put all the food on it. Mama put lettuce, tomatoes, and all the other veggies on the burgers. Papa put hotdogs and hamburgers on the thick grill. The little girl smelled the delicious aroma as the food cooked. 
Finally, it was time to eat! Papa said grace, and everyone enjoyed the delicious food. The little girl clapped, smiled and said. Thank you for the promise and the grill!

Once upon a time, there was a famous girl named Sophie. She had a special place upstairs that nobody knew about. It was a secret place, and she loved going there to think and daydream.
One day, Sophie decided to rise up the stairs to her secret place. She was so excited that she took two steps at a time! She opened the door and stepped inside. The room felt cozy and warm.
Sophie went over to her favorite chair and sat down. She felt so special here and loved the way she felt in this special spot. Soon, she forgot all about the outside world and just enjoyed the moment.
Suddenly, Sophie heard a voice from behind her. "Good morning Sophie! You're very famous, you know!" It turns out the voice belonged to Sophie's pet cat! Sophie was so surprised, she had forgotten all about her cat!
The cat jumped up onto the chair and curled up beside Sophie. Together they enjoyed the peaceful moment, until eventually the sun started to set. With the day coming to an end, Sophie rose up the stairs to her secret place one last time.

Once upon a time, there was a boy. He dreamed of being wise. One day, he found a white egg in the forest. He thought it was so special that he took it home.
The next day, the egg hatches, and out came a snowman! The little boy was so excited that the snowman was alive.
The snowman was kind, and full of wisdom. He told the boy stories and taught him important lessons.
One day it was so cold outside, the snowman started to freeze! The little boy wanted to save his new friend, so he made a plan. He grabbed all of his warm blankets and wrapped the snowman up tightly.
The snowman stayed warm and safe. From then on, the boy and snowman shared special adventures, and the little boy was always learning new wisdom!

The girl was very proud of herself and kept following the teacher's orders. She not only felt confident in class, but also, she was becoming more humble every day.

When she was done, Mia dried herself off with a big, fluffy towel. Then she went to sit in the chair by the fan. It blew cool, gentle air on her. She felt much better.
Mia enjoyed the fan's cool breeze and soon fell asleep. After a while, she woke up feeling strong and refreshed. She was happy she had taken a bath.

Inside the box was a surprise. It was something special! Inside was a big golden trophy. It was huge and sparkly! They had all won something amazing. 
Everyone was so happy and they thought they had won the biggest prize ever. It was the best win they'd ever had!

"Oh no," said mom. "We have to fix this!"
Wendy watched as her mom talked to the store clerk. Mom seemed to be explaining the problem with their order. The store clerk nodded and smiled.
Soon, the store clerk had fixed the order. Wendy's mom thanked the store clerk and they were able to get their things. 
Everyone was happy! Wendy was no longer worried. She hugged her mom and they went home with the order safely.

He called his best friend, who was also a builder. He told the friend to get ready because they were going to build something awesome!
The man and the friend started working. They used wood and stones to build it. They built and built, until finally the thing was ready - they had made a big, beautiful treehouse! 
The man was so happy and proud of what they had made. He wrote his name on the treehouse and he planned to go there every day - to play, to have a picnic, or just to relax.

He found it was very reliable and never broke.

Once upon a time, there was a famous farm. It had lots of animals, who liked to run and play. One day, the animals were running around and having fun, when all of a sudden, they heard a loud noise. They looked up and saw a bright light. It was a red, loud truck!
The animals were so surprised! But they didn't know the truck was there to stop at the farm, with a very special guest. When the truck stopped, a little girl hopped out. She was so excited to be at the farm to meet all the animals.
The animals were just as excited to meet her. They ran up to her, and the girl laughed and hugged them. She spent most of the day feeding the animals and playing with them. It was such a fun day!
When it was time to leave, the girl hugged all the animals goodbye. She thanked them for the wonderful day and said she would never forget about her visit to the famous farm. And she never did!

Mummy and Daddy were playing with their little girl. They said it was time to leave, but she didn't want to. Daddy had a joke and said, " shh, it's time to go". She laughed with a big smile and was patient. 
Mummy put on her coat and said goodbye. Daddy picked up the little girl and kissed her goodbye. She smiled and said, "Bye, Daddy". Daddy said, "I love you" and left. 
Mummy was so patient and gentle with her. She said, "Come on, let's go home now" and the little girl nodded. 
When they got home, Daddy was waiting there with a big smile. He said, "I've got another joke. What do you get if you cross a rabbit and a elephant?" 
The little girl said, "I don't know!" Daddy said, "A harephant!", and the little girl laughed again.

Once upon a time, there was a lovely girl named Marie. Marie loved to explore the world around her and listen carefully to the sounds of nature.
One day, on her regular walk in the park, Marie saw a beautiful shape in the sky. She stopped and looked up, amazed. It was a beautiful butterfly! 
Marie watched it flutter away and then followed it. She followed it from the park, through a meadow, and over a river. Everywhere the butterfly went, Marie listened closely to the sounds of nature.
Eventually, she reached a tall tree with a special shape. Marie looked up and saw that the shape was the same as the butterfly. She was so excited because she had found the butterfly's home. 
Marie smiled and thanked the butterfly before she went home. From then on, she made sure to stop and listen carefully to nature whenever she was in the park.

They looked for a mattress, but none were available. So John and Jane decided to find something else to do. They agreed to play hide and seek in the backyard.
John hid first and Jane went to look for him. She looked in the tree but he wasn't there. Finally, she found him in the playhouse. They were both very happy.
They played hide and seek all afternoon. After that, they went back inside and both agreed they had a great day.

She started to rub it up and down with her little hands. Suddenly, a terrible thing happened! The lights in the house started to blink on and off, loudly and quickly! Emily was scared and started to cry. Her mom heard the noise and came rushing into the room. She saw the switch and knew what had happened. She hugged Emily tight, helped her calm down and then showed her how to turn the switch off. Everything was normal again. From then on, Emily was extra careful when exploring her world.

Once upon a time there was a little boy. He saw a barber and wanted to see what the barber was doing. The barber had thick, dry hair and he was cutting it. The little boy admired him. 
The barber stopped cutting the man's hair and smiled at the little boy. The barber asked the boy if he wanted to have a turn with the scissors. The little boy was very excited. He held out his hand, careful not to touch the scissors. 
The barber put the scissors in the boy's hand and the little boy was amazed. He began to cut his own hair with the scissors. The barber stood there and admired the little boy's courage. 
The little boy was very proud of what he had done. When he finished, he looked at the barber with a big smile. The barber said, "You did a great job. You did a better job than some adults!" 
The little boy was very happy. He thanked the barber and he knew that he had gained a special skill. From then on, he knew he had the power to take care of his own hair.

One day, the little boy saw his teacher walking in the park. The teacher smiled at the little boy and said, "Do you want to race?" The boy was so excited that he raced the teacher around the park. The teacher let him win, and the little boy was so happy.
The next day, all of the little boy's classmates came to school. They were all given a special staff, which was for racing! The little boy was shy, but he soon realized that he had nothing to be scared of. He held his staff tightly and raced against all of his friends. The other boys cheered the little boy on, and soon he was the fastest runner in his class.
At the end of the race, the little boys teacher said, Well done! You are the best racer here! The little boy was so proud. He had shown everyone that he was brave and that he could do great things. He felt happy and shy at the same time. He knew he would never forget that special day.

When Jack arrived at the restaurant, the waiter greeted him. Jack was very happy and ordered his food. The food was yummy and Jack enjoyed his meal. After he finished his food, he decided to explore the restaurant some more. 
Jack walked around and saw many things he liked. He saw giant statues and bright lights. He even spotted a cupcake! He was so excited, he started running around the restaurant making funny noises. 
The people in the restaurant smiled when they saw Jack having fun. After a while, Jack got tired and he said goodbye to the waiter. He was so excited to tell everyone at home about his restaurant adventure.

Hannah and her Daddy said goodbye to the nosy duck and started walking back across the bridge. Hannah held her Daddy's hand tight and knew this would be a day she would never forget.

Sara went to find some silly things, like stickers and glitter. She then put them all onto the star to make it sparkle. 
When she was done, Sara smiled. Her star was so pretty! She hugged it, then put it in her pocket and ran back home.
Every day, Sara looked at her star and improved it a bit more. She would add different things like beads and ribbons. 
Soon her star was the most beautiful thing in her room. Sara was so proud of what she had made! Now, whenever she felt a little sad or lonely, she would just hold her star and smile.

One day, a wise old man saw the pupil and took pity on him. He saw how tired the boy was and decided to help. The man leaned over and gently whispered something into the pupil's ear. Suddenly, the pupil's eyes lit up and he stood up straight.
From then on, the pupil wasn't poor anymore. He understood his lessons and was always eager to learn more. With the old man's help, the pupil became the smartest in his class. Everyone marveled at how he knew so much!

The boy went to the cave and it was so big! He looked around and it was dark, except for some light coming from a blue crystal. It was so beautiful! He touched it and it sparkled in the darkness. The boy was so amazed and he stayed for a long time.
When it was time to go home, the boy thanked his mum for paying. He was so happy because he had been inside such a special cave. So he was very grateful.

Once upon a time there was a little girl called Jessie. She was very curious and one day she became very interested in tasting a comet. Even though she knew it was not allowed, she decided to have a bite. 
It tasted strange, not at all like the usual sweet treats she was used to. Jessie was so amazed that she decided to have another bite. Unfortunately, this time her parents saw her. 
As soon as they came out of the house, they shouted at Jessie for tasting a comet without asking them first. She was so ashamed and ran away Immediately, stopping only when she reached the woods.
She stayed there for hours, thinking about her mistake. In the end, she decided to go home, apologise to her parents and promise them never to do it again. 
Jessie learned an important lesson that day: never taste a comet without asking first.

Once there was a little boy who liked to play outside on his own. One day, he was running around when he tripped over his own big toe and fell down on his knee! It really hurt, and he started to cry. 
His mom came running over and saw what happened. She put her hand on his shoulder and said, "It's okay, sweetheart." Then she slowly put her arms under him and lifted him up from the ground. She was very gentle and cared for him.
She hugged him tight and then helped him walk towards his house. When they got inside, she put a soft cushy pillow on the couch for him to sit on and then she put a warm wet cloth on his knee.
The little boy's knee felt better with the wet cloth, and he started to smile. He thanked his mom for helping him and then went back to playing outside, but this time a bit more slowly. 
The End.
<|endoftext|>
Danny was very excited for his first trip to the ocean. As he stepped out of the car, he could feel the sand on his feet, see the waves crashing against the shore, and hear the seagulls calling. He smiled, taking it all in.
He ran to kneel at the edge of the ocean. He scooped up a handful of water and it trickled through his fingers, like tiny silver drops. The water felt cool and it refreshed him.
The sun was hot, and soon the ocean began to melt. Danny was mesmerized as the water melted more and more. He watched as it licked up the shore and swirled around his feet. He jumped up and down as the waves lapped against him.
Danny spent the rest of the day playing in the ocean, exploring its depths, and feeling its warmth melt away the day. He was so happy, and he couldnt wait to come back again soon.

Mum said it was time to go outside and play. The sun was shining in the sky, and the birds were chirping.
So mummy got the small girl and they went outside. But the grass was high, so mummy had to order her to get back inside.
The little girl was disappointed, until she saw the stairs. She ran to them and started to climb them. She was so happy and chubby as she reached the top of the stairs.
Mummy was worried about the girl, but when she saw how happy the little one was, she smiled too. The girl gave her a big hug and a kiss and they enjoyed the day together.

Once upon a time, there was a big football. It was round and bouncy and shiny. It was very special. Every day, the boy liked to play with it. He liked to kick it around and catch it.
One day, the boy was playing with his football in the park. Then he slipped on the grass. His football rolled away. The boy chased it, but it kept slipping away. The boy could not catch it.
The boy was sad and hungry. He started to look around. Then he saw a delicious cake in the grass. It was a special surprise! The boy smiled and had a yummy snack. Then he went back to playing with his football. It was so much fun!

Once upon a time there was a wild video. All the animals liked to watch it. It made them laugh and smile. 
One day, a 3 year old saw the video too and he loved it. He wanted to use it all the time. He watched the video every day and it made him so happy. He laughed and he danced and he sang.
Soon, the 3 year old's friends wanted to watch the video too. He showed it to them, and they all had so much fun. They sang and they danced and they laughed together. 
The wild video was so much fun that they decided to use it every day. It made them very happy and they never got bored. They found a way to always use the video and put a smile on their faces.

Once upon a time, there was a gentle wagon. It was red, with big, round wheels. The wagon liked to go on adventures.
One day, the wagon went to the park with its friend, a little girl named Ali. Ali was excited to use the wagon, so she filled it with her toys.
As Ali began to pull the wagon, it made a loud noise. People started to frown. But Ali kept pulling the wagon. She smiled and she was gentle.
Before long, Ali and the wagon were all the way around the park. They had had a great adventure together. The wagon was happy and Ali was happy, so she gave the wagon a big hug.
The wagon would always remember the gentle adventure it had with Ali.

Mummy was pushing the pram down the street. Inside was the little girl, chatting away happily. Suddenly, Mummy stopped and picked up a white envelope from the ground. She looked inside and smiled. Inside was a sweet letter from Grandma.
Mummy hugged the envelope and urged the little girl to read it. She carefully opened the envelope and read what it said. It said that Grandma was coming to visit soon and she was very excited.
The little girl smiled. She couldn't wait for Grandma to come and give her lots of sweet hugs. She begged Mummy to hurry and find Grandma so she could come and see her. Mummy smiled and said that Grandma was on her way.
The little girl's face lit up with excitement. She knew that Grandma was going to arrive soon and she couldn't wait to give her a big, sweet hug.

Once upon a time, there was a deaf drum. His name was Sam. Sam wanted to be able to hear the music that everyone was playing, but he was unable to do so.
One day, he met a friend. His friend's name was Tim. Even though Sam was deaf, Tim trusted Sam and decided to play music with him.
Tim gave Sam a drum and showed him how to play it. Sam felt very excited! He was so happy that Tim trusted him with a drum.
The whole day, Tim and Sam played music together. Sam was finally able to hear what music sounded like and he loved it!
After that day, Sam and Tim were great friends. They trusted each other and enjoyed making music together. And whenever Sam felt down, he just had to think about that day and all of the trust that Tim gave him.

Once, there was a little girl who wanted to play a game. She ran to her room and got out her toy box. Inside, she found a shield, but it was very messy.
The little girl wanted to organize it so she could play with it. She put all the pieces in a line and made sure they were neat. Then she took a cloth and polished the shield.
Finally, it was time to play. She picked up the shield and pretended she was a knight. With it, she could protect herself and fight against the bad guys.
The little girl was very happy with her cheap shield. She waved it around, imagining all the adventures that were waiting for her. From then on, she kept it organized and used it to make all kinds of stories.

Once upon a time, there was a cold leather hat. It had been sitting on a shelf for a long time, but one day it needed some help. A little girl named Daisy came up to the hat, and she had a plan to solve the problem.
She tried to pull the hat off the shelf, but it was too high for her. Her dad saw what she was trying to do, and he gave her a step stool. Daisy climbed up and grabbed the hat, and she moved it safely to the floor.
She tried to warm it up by rubbing it with her hand, but it was still cold. That's when she thought of an idea. She took a blankie from her bed and wrapped it around the hat.
Shortly after, the hat wasn't cold anymore! Daisy was so proud of herself for solving the problem and making the hat warm. Her dad was proud of her too. From that moment on, Daisy always wore the hat when it was cold outside.

There was a little boy and he was so dirty! He wanted to be clean so he decided to take a shower. He took off all his clothes and got in the shower. His mom cut up a bar of soap and he lathered up his body with it. He scrubbed and scrubbed until he was clean. He rinsed off and felt so much better! He was so proud that he was nice and clean again!

Once there was a girl named Anna. She loved to explore in the woods near her house. One day she was looking for things to explore, when she spotted a vine growing off the side of a tree. Anna decided to poke it. She poked it gently and suddenly, something unexpected happened. Suddenly the vine started to wriggle and wiggle like a pet snake!
Anna was so surprised and excited. She started to poke the vine again and again and it kept moving. Then all of a sudden the vine split apart, revealing two little creatures. Anna was amazed to see they were organized little ants!
The ants quickly started to move in an organized line up the vine. Anna was so excited she started to poke the vine which made the ants go faster. Anna giggled at the ants marching up the vine. She waited to see what the ants would do next. 
The ants kept marching on. After a while, the ants turned around and started marching down the vine again. Anna was very pleased with her new friends and decided to take them home. From that day on Anna and the ants were the best of friends!

As Jimmy and his mommy walked into the gym, Jimmy heard loud music. He heard people talking and laughing. Everyone was very friendly. 
Jimmy and his mommy explored the gym. They saw people running, lifting weights, and even climbing up a wall. Jimmy was so curious, he wanted to try everything!
However, Jimmy got a bit too excited. He accidentally knocked over some weights and made a big mess. He was being too careless and his mommy had to clean it up.
Jimmy learned a valuable lesson from his adventure at the gym: be careful!
