Once upon a time there was a little boy who was very foolish. He believed what everyone told him, even if it wasn't true. 
One day he saw a sign that said he could get free candy if he followed it. He thought this sounded like a good idea and followed the sign. 
But when he got to where he was supposed to be, there was no candy. Someone had lied to the little boy and tricked him. He felt very silly and foolish. 
But he learnt a valuable lesson that day: always be careful who you trust and don't believe someone just because they tell you something. Sometimes people will lie to get what they want.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Lily. She was three years old and loved finding new things. One day, Lily was playing in her room when she saw something shiny in the corner. She went over to take a look, and saw a chest. It was a special shiny chest and it was locked with a key. Lily really wanted to know what was in the chest, but she couldn't work out how to open it. She started to think about how to open the chest. After a while, Lily remembered that she had a key at home. She ran back to get the key and quickly came back. Lily put the key in the chest and turned it. The chest opened and inside was a big, tasty treat. Lily was so excited. She smiled and took a bite of the tasty treat. She thought it was the best treat ever. She enjoyed it so much, she decided to keep the chest and key in her room, so she could get more treats in the future.

Once there was a boy named Joe who lived all by himself. Joe felt very lonely. One day he wanted to do something to make himself feel better. 
He went to the store and bought some paper. He took it outside and started to fold it into different shapes. He made a boat, an airplane, and even a car! 
Joe took his new creations and put them into the gas tank of his father's car. Suddenly the car started to move! Joe was so surprised. He drove and drove until he reached the end of the street. 
Joe realized that he had used up all the gas, so he got out of the car. He smiled with joy because he had made the most of his lonely day. From then on, Joe loved to fold paper whenever he felt lonely.

Jack was having fun playing with his toys when suddenly he heard a deep sigh coming from his living room. He was curious, so he went over to investigate.
He noticed his mum sitting on the sofa, frowning. He asked her what was wrong, but all she said was that she was feeling a bit boring.
Jack wanted to help make his mum feel better. He looked around the room and noticed a shelf full of books. He smiled, got up and grabbed a book and took it to his mum. 
To Jack's surprise, his mum's face lit up with a big smile. She thanked him and began to read the book together. 
The day had been saved! Jack and his mum read together and had lots of fun. He was glad that he could cheer his mum up.

One day, Susie was given a task; to wipe the windows with a special cloth. She was given a long pole to help her reach the top.
Susie did as she was told and worked very hard. She wiped the windows in the kitchen, the lounge, and the bedrooms.
When mum and dad saw how hard Susie worked, they were very pleased. They rewarded her with a sweet treat for being so obedient.
Susie was thrilled! She smiled and thanked her parents. From that day on she was even more obedient and did all the jobs she was asked to do.

Once there was a graceful bird. It was so graceful that it loved to fly around the sky. Every day, it woke up to the warm sun and flew up high. No matter what it did, it felt graceful.
One day, the bird was thirsty so it flew to a river. It found a spot and decided to drink from the cool, clear water. As it drank, it felt very refreshed. The brainy bird suddenly thought of a great idea. It could use its grace to help other birds get quench their thirst too!
So, the graceful bird taught all the other birds how to drink from the river. Now, all the birds could feel refreshed and quench their thirst. The graceful bird was so proud that it could use its brain to help others.

One day, she decided to fly away and explore the world. She flew and flew, going higher and higher. Suddenly, strong winds came and pushed her wings, sending her further away.
But the bird was brave. She kept her wings tight and kEPT flapping. She flew and flew, until she saw a bright green tree. Then she slowly made her way down and landed on a branch.
The little bird was very happy. She had flown far away and she could see so many interesting things in the distance. She looked up at the sky and promised herself to keep flapping her wings to explore and learn new things.

Aunt and Anne got down to play. Aunt showed Anne how the car can be reversed by pressing a button. Anne was amazed! She had so much fun reversing the car back and forth. Time flew and soon it was time to go. Anne remembered to say thank you before they left.
Anne felt so lucky to have an aunt who loves her so much. She was so happy as they drove back home, feeling sleepy but content.

One day, he had even more work to do. He needed more help to get the work done. So he went looking for someone to give him a hand. He met a little boy with a very big smile.
The man asked the little boy if he wanted to help. The boy said yes, and he hopped into the big truck. Together they drove around town, providing people with the things they needed.
The little boy was a great help and they finished all the work quickly. The man was very happy and thanked the little boy for his hard work. The boy smiled and thanked him right back. It was a big job, but they worked together, and did a great job.

Callie's parents helped her climb into the kayak and showed her what to do. She learned how to turn the kayak from side to side with the paddle. She learned that the more gentle her movements were, the better.
Callie asked her parents a million questions about kayaking as her adventure began. She was eager to learn more so that she could become a better kayaker. Her parents answered each and every one of her questions.
Callie enjoyed her first kayaking trip so much and she was glad that her parents answered all her questions. She can't wait to go kayaking again soon!

Once upon a time, there was a mighty inchworm. He lived in the big green forest. He liked to match leaves and sticks together. He wanted to create something special.
One day, he found a big stick that was too hard to break. He wriggled and wiggled, but he couldn't match it with the other sticks. He felt so disappointed and was about to give up. 
Suddenly, a shiny yellow bird flew down from the sky. The bird was so kind and offered to help the inchworm. He cupped his wings to the ground and used its beak to break the stick into two pieces. The inchworm was so happy and thanked the bird. Together, they matched all the sticks and leaves into a beautiful pattern.
The inchworm was happy to have found a new friend. And it was all thanks to his mighty inch!

Once upon a time, there was a spoiled girl who loved to show her symbol. Everywhere she went, she let her symbol follow. Wherever she went, people knew who she was. 
One day, she decided to go on a journey. She grabbed her symbol and let it shine bright. All the animals smiled at her and waved goodbye. 
As the day went on, the spoiled girl and her symbol kept walking further and further. Suddenly, the symbol stopped and grinned at her. 
"Let's go fly," it said. The spoiled girl's eyes lit up and said yes. Together, they flew up in the sky and released the symbol into the air. It flew around and around, letting everyone know the spoiled girl was near. 
When it was time to say goodbye, they waved and the symbol flew back down. Everyone cheered as the symbol landed on the spoiled girl's shoulder. 
The two made a new promise that they would always let their symbol show. From then on, the spoiled girl and her symbol were always together and never apart.

Once upon a time, a little girl felt very anxious. She wanted to go to the city, but she was too scared. Then, she had a thought  what if she could jump to the city?
So she tried. She jumped really really high, stretching into the sky and reaching for the clouds. Slowly, she flew through the air and landed in the city.
She was so excited to see the city up close! Everywhere she looked, there were bright buildings, lots of people and cars zooming around.
She looked up and saw the sun, beginning to set and all the lights of the city were beginning to turn on. It was so beautiful she couldn't help but smile.
The little girl was very happy that she had jumped to the city. She was no longer anxious, but brave and strong.

Once upon a time there was an old train. It travelled up and down the hills.
Every day it left the station filled with people. They clapped and sang to the rhythm of the train rolling along.
One day, a little girl came to the station. She clapped and waved to the old train as it pulled up. The train conductor smiled at her. He opened the door and she got on. All of the passengers clapped and cheered.
The little girl was so excited. She counted the windows as the train rolled along. She was so happy that she started to clap her hands. As she clapped, the sound echoed around the railway tunnel.
The old train arrived at the station safely. Everyone clapped to show their thanks for the trains journey. The little girl smiled and waved goodbye to the old train as it pulled away.

Once, there was a mitten. It was made of wool and was very soft and warm. But one day, something sad happened to it. A big, mean wind came and destroyed it. All the pieces were blowing in the air. The mitten was so sad that it started to cry. 
But then something very special happened. The sun came and put all the pieces of the mitten back together. The mitten was so happy. It looked just as good as before, and it was even warmer. 
The mitten was so happy. It was so glad that it was no longer sad. It promised to never be destroyed again.

Once upon a time there was a mommy who worked hard to make yarn. She was very strong and she worked day and night to spin the yarn. Every morning she woke up and she would go to work to make the yarn.
She would spin the yarn so fast and it always came out so healthy and strong. Every day she wrapped the yarn around her spinning wheel and made lots of yarn. She worked very hard and every night she was very tired. She also sold some of her yarn so she could buy food for her family.
One day, she made very special yarn, it was the softest and prettiest yarn ever. She used the yarn to make a special blanket for her baby. The baby was so happy with the blanket, it kept her warm and cozy every night.
The mommy was so proud of her work, she made very healthy, strong and beautiful yarn. She was a very special yarn maker and her work was amazing!

John was sitting outside in the garden when he saw a light mosquito flying around. "What a funny looking mosquito," he thought. He laughed to himself, thinking it was fun to see the mosquito flying around like that.
Suddenly, John thought up a joke. He waved his arms around like the mosquito and said in a silly voice, "Hee hee, I'm a mosquito!" His mom heard him and couldn't help but giggle.
John laughed at himself for being silly, it was fun to joke about. He waved his arms up and down like he was flying around, and he made funny buzzing noises too.
John's mom smiled and said, "John, that was a funny joke!" She tickled his side and they both laughed together.
John had lots of fun making silly mosquito jokes. He was so happy he could make his mom laugh!

The little girl got her paintbrush and started painting the mineral. She wanted to make it look really special and so she used some really expensive paints. The mineral looked so beautiful that she hung it up on her bedroom wall to show off to her friends.
Everyone who came to the little girl's house admired the mineral, it was so vibrant and colourful thanks to all the expensive paints she used! The little girl was very proud of her work and it made her very happy.

Once there was a little girl. She was three years old and very careful. Every day the girl used to play in the garden. She loved to sing and dance with the butterflies. 
One day, it was very hot outside. The little girl was getting very thirsty and started to tremble. Then she saw a fan in the corner of the garden. She was so happy! She walked towards it and switched it on. 
The fan started to whirl and the little girl felt cool and happy. She started to dance and sing with the fan like a friend. She was so happy that she jumped up and down and laughed.
Then suddenly, the fan stopped working. The girl froze. She was so careful and didn't want to break the fan. She closed her eyes and started to tremble. She was very scared. But then she slowly opened her eyes and saw that the fan was working again! 
The little girl was very happy and danced around the fan. She said goodbye to the fan and thanked it for keeping her cool in the hot summer day.

Suddenly, something magical happened. A tiny golden box floated in the air right above her. She quickly reached up and grabbed on to it. She opened the box and inside was a perfect shiny crystal. She was so happy and yelled out for joy!
The girl knew that the crystal was just what she had been searching for and she couldn't believe her luck. She closed up the box and thanked the sky for giving it to her. She was the happiest she had ever been and the perfect crystal belonged to her forever.

Holly's mom heard her from the other room. Mom knew what Holly wanted. She had to do something. So, she found a big box and put the cable in it. She put the box on the floor to make it easier for Holly.
Holly was so excited! She grabbed the cable and started playing with it. The cable was very soft and comfortable. She hugged it and stayed with it all day. From that day on, Holly always opened the box to play with her special cable.

He wanted to study the bubble, so he went up close and realized it was available for him to pop. He got some bubble mix and blew some bubbles of his own.
Jimmy played with the bubbles all afternoon. He used his hands to make the bubbles bigger and bigger and they sparkled in the sunshine. Jimmy wanted to study the bubbles more, so he got some of his drawing paper. With his pencils, he drew pictures of the bubbles and wrote a story about them. 
Jimmy was so happy that he had a project to study and he enjoyed learning about the bubbles. He was so proud of his work that he shared it with his mom and dad. They were so impressed! From then on, Jimmy would go outside every day to study the bubbles and draw pictures of them. He was so fascinated by bubbles that he even wrote a song about them!

Once there was a little boy. His name was Joe. One day Joe went outside to play. It was a nice day and there were leaves everywhere. Joe liked to collect the leaves.
But as Joe was walking, he heard a bad sound. He looked all around and couldn't see anything. He heard the sound again. Joe followed the bad sound and found a cat. The cat was stuck in a tree and it was crying.
Joe wanted to help the cat, so he grabbed a big leaf. He threw the leaf and the cat was able to use it to jump down. The cat was very happy and thanked Joe before running away. Joe was glad he could help the cat. He went back home and told his mom all about his adventure.

The trophy was very shiny and very special. Everyone clapped and smiled when they saw it. Then, it was time to put the trophy on display.

Once upon a time, there lived a mule. He lived in a forest and everyday he would wake up at sunrise.
The mule loved to work hard and he worked very hard on the farm. He carried heavy loads of hay from one side of the farm to another, never stopping until the job was done. He was the best mule on the farm.
But one morning, when the mule woke up, something was different. He couldn't move his legs! He was so tired from his hard work that he couldn't wake up.
The farmer was scared, he didn't know what to do. But then, one of the other animals on the farm gave him an idea. He found a wheelbarrow and put the mule in it. 
Everyone on the farm took turns pushing the wheelbarrow with the mule in it and soon, he was able to walk again. He was happy, and they were all happy too.
The mule knew that from that day on, he had to take better care of himself and get more rest. And everyone on the farm made sure of that. The mule was always safe and well-rested!

Once upon a time, there were two bunnies named Bobby and Bonnie. They were very playful and liked to hop around. One day Bobby and Bonnie decided to go on an adventure. They hopped and hopped and hopped until they came across a mysterious spell. The spell was sparkling and glittery and Bobby and Bonnie were very curious. 
They hopped up to it and Bobby said to the spell, "Please, let us have some fun!" The spell was so happy and it granted their wish. It made them very playful and they began to hop around like crazy. 
Bobby and Bonnie were so happy they could hop and play with the spell. They hopped faster and faster and higher and higher until they had to take a break. They hopped back to the spell again and this time it was spinning and dancing. Bobby and Bonnie laughed and laughed as they watched the spell dance. 
The spell was so playful and the bunnies had so much fun. They hopped and hopped around the spell until it was time to go home. They thanked the spell for the fun day and said goodbye. They hopped happily away, knowing that they could come back and play another day.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Jenna. Jenna liked to dress up in her mama's clothes. One day she put on a pair of mama's pants that were way too big for her! She looked at herself in the mirror and began to giggle. Suddenly she heard a loud whisper coming from the pants! Jenna was scared so she quickly took them off and threw them on the floor.
When Jenna's mom came in the room, she asked Jenna why the pants were so dirty. Jenna admitted that she had been wearing them. Her mom was disgusted and scolded her! She said, You cant go putting on my clothes when Im not around! 
Jenna was sad and said she was sorry. Her mom gave her a hug and said, Lets put these disgusting pants in the laundry. 
So Jenna put the pants in the laundry basket, and together she and her mom went to do the laundry. From that day on, Jenna never snuck into her mom's closet again!
<|endoftext|>

One day, a small town was filled with joy. There was a very special event happening. Everyone gathered in the town square and watched as a beautiful lady stepped out of a carriage wearing a long white dress. She kneeled down to the ground, with a kind look in her eyes.
The people in the town had no idea why she was kneeling, so they waited in silence. Suddenly, the sky grew dark and a voice boomed from the heavens. It said that the lady had come to bless the town and asked everyone to kneel too.
The people all obeyed and kneeled to the ground. When the voice stopped speaking, it was suddenly very bright outside again. Everyone got up and exchanged happy smiles, thrilled that they had been blessed. The lady said goodbye, waved to everyone and hopped back in the carriage.
The people of the small town felt special, grateful for the amazing blessing that had been bestowed upon them. They talked amongst themselves and always remembered the special day when they all kneeled together.

The umbrella was normal. It was yellow and blue. She opened it and it made a funny sound. It was big enough to cover her whole body so she wouldn't get wet. She played with the umbrella for a while. Then she went inside with her mommy and the umbrella.
It was so nice that her mommy brought the umbrella! It was fun to play in the rain and not get wet. The umbrella kept her dry. She was so lucky!

Once upon a time, there was a bad man. He had a steak for dinner, and he wanted to eat it outside. He took the steak, and walked out onto the balcony. Suddenly, he stumbled and the steak dropped from his hands. It fell down, far below and landed in the street. The bad man was so sad that he couldn't eat the steak. He knew he would never have it again. 
He stopped and looked down. He saw a little girl standing by the steak, in the street. She was smiling and eating it. The bad man felt better, he was happy that the little girl was enjoying his steak. 
The next day, the little girl came back with her mommy. The little girl gave the bad man a hug and said, 'Thank you for letting me have the steak!' 
The bad man smiled, and they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time there was a large monster who lived in the toilet. He wanted to protect himself so he decided to hide in the large toilet and never come out.
One day, a brave girl heard noises coming from the toilet and decided to investigate. She opened the lid and found the monster! She was a little scared at first but then she remembered that monsters need friends too, so she said hello and offered her hand. The monster smiled and reached out to shake her hand.
The girl and the monster became best friends and would spend hours playing and having fun. The monster now had a safe place to call home and the girl was happy to have a new friend to look after and protect. They would travel all around the world together, finding new places to explore and adventures to embark on.
They lived happily ever after, safe in the knowledge that they would always have each other to protect.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl. She was three years old and very brave. She was sitting on the shore, to her right was a bright blue sea. She couldn't believe how blue it was!
Suddenly, she heard a loud noise. It was the sea  it was demanding something from her. She had no idea what the sea wanted, but she was brave and so she decided to find out.
So the little girl jumped up and started walking towards the sea. Her brave heart was pounding as she approached the shore.
When she was close by, the sea spoke. It told her, I want you to collect shells from the beach. The little girl had never done this before but she was brave and so she said Yes.
So she gathered some pretty blue shells and proudly returned to the shore. The sea was pleased and said, Well done brave one!
The little girl was so happy! She had done something brave and made the sea very happy. She couldn't wait to tell her family all about it!

So the knob started to try out some of the things it could do, like unlocking doors and turning things on and off. But the knob was getting tired of always being the same.
So the knob decided to go on an adventure. It was so much fun! The knob did all kinds of things and became more competitive with each new thing it tried.
At the end of the day, the knob was feeling very proud of itself and it went back home, whispering to itself "I am a very special knob!"

Once upon a time, there was a young boy named Tom. Tom was very curious and always wanted to explore and try new things. 
One day he went to a lake to try and catch some fish with a spear. But Tom was a bit foolish, and instead of waiting for the fish to come to him, he tried to throw the spear in the water. Unfortunately, he couldn't throw very far and the spear got stuck in a tree!
Tom tried to pull the spear out of the tree, but it was too difficult. He gave up and decided to go home.
On his way, he passed a big barn covered by a shut gate. The gate was shut and there was no way of getting in. But Tom was still curious, so he tried to climb the gate. 
After a few attempts, he was able to get over the gate and he discovered that inside the barn were two horses, who had been locked inside. Tom felt a bit foolish so he quickly shut the gate and ran off home.

John stopped in his tracks and looked around. It was his owner. His owner called him over and he went.
John remembered to listen after that. He knew that when his owner said 'stop' he had to stop. He enjoyed the morning still, but he tried not to run over to the cat too quickly. He was a good boy and he listened to his owner.

From that day, she never again lost her pick. She made sure it stayed safe and sparkled in the sunshine. She continued to use it to dig in the sand and the sun continued to shine brightly down on her.

One day, a little girl was walking along the river and when she saw the crocodile she stopped. She waved to him and he waved back. They kept waving for the longest time and it made the little girl so happy.
Every day after that, the girl and the crocodile kept waving. She would wave to him from the riverbank and he would wave from the water. Even on a rainy day, when everyone stayed inside, the crocodile and the girl would still wave to each other from far away.
The crocodile and the little girl were the best of friends and their special wave always made them smile.

He was so relieved and quickly put his cap back on his head. From that day on, he remembered to blink his eyes every time they get tired. Because he was so stubborn and kept his cap on, he was able to remember this lesson and never forget it!

John's mom gave him some vegetables anyway. He pretend to like them, but inside he thought they were still disgusting. He ate the vegetables and pretended to like them. Then, he was happy to close the dinner and go back to playing with his toy.

One day, he was walking in the woods when he saw a  big strong tree standing in his way. He wanted to cut it down, so he got ready to chop it with his axe. He kicked the tree with all his might, but it wouldn't move. So he pulled out his axe and started chopping away.
The tree took a long time to cut down, but the woodcutter was patient. Finally, he chopped it down and it fell to the ground.
The woodcutter was proud of his work. He had used just his thick axe and one kick to cut down the big strong tree. He knew he had done a job well done.

When she pointed it out, her friend Lily noticed something very special about the doll. It was wearing the latest fashion! Lily was so excited, she started screaming and pointing at the doll. Everyone was amazed by the doll's style. 
But then, things started to get a bit more complicated. Another one of Emma's friends, Sam, became very upset when he saw the doll. He didn't like the way it was dressed. He said it wasn't fashionable enough and that it should be changed. 
Emma was very upset. She had spent a lot of time picking out the perfect dress for her doll and now Sam was telling her it was wrong. She knew that her doll's fashion was just perfect and she didn't want to change it. 
So, Emma decided to stand up for her fashion. She politely told Sam that she didn't want to change her doll and that it was the perfect fashion for her.

Mom said, "Here you go. I found it down the street." Then she handed them the newspaper the man had stolen. The man and woman were very happy to get their newspaper back. 
Timmy and his mom went back to their house. Mom said that it is important to be patient and kind in this world. Timmy was very proud of his mom. He knew that it was wrong to steal.

The man didn't notice the little girl. He just kept stealing hats from the people. But then, he tried to steal the hat off of the little girl's head. He reached for her hat, but the little girl was too fast. She ran away from the man and back to her family's home.

Once upon a time there was an oak tree. It was very tall and strong. One day, a slow wind blew. Slowly, it began to strike the oak tree. The oak tree shook and shivered under the strong wind.
Then, after a while, the wind stopped. The oak tree was relieved. It had been shaking so much that its leaves had started to fall off.
But then, the wind began again, striking the tree and shaking it harder. The oak was starting to get scared. Its leaves were falling off faster.
Finally, the wind stopped for good. The oak was very happy and it was glad that it was not struck by the wind anymore.
The oak tree was able to rest and all of its leaves grew back. It was happy and strong again. And from that day on, the oak always remembered to be brave when a strong wind came up!

Jack's cap also flew off his head. It flew away and landed far away. Jack was sad and ran towards the cap. When he got there, he saw a dog playing with the cap.
So Jack decided to kick the ball towards the dog. The dog was scared and ran away. But it left the cap behind!

The family bought the toy and took it home. They replaced their broken old toy with the new one and played with it all day long. The new toy was so much fun that the family never wanted to put it away.

Little Joe had an uncle who was always very tidy. When Joe asked his uncle why he kept things so neat and clean, he just shrugged. Joe asked his dad what a shrug meant, and he said it meant that Uncle wasn't sure why he kept things so tidy.
One day, Joe's uncle told him he had a surprise. Little Joe was so excited and couldn't wait to find out what it was. His uncle handed Joe a big box and told him to open it. Inside, there were markers and paper and lots of stickers. Joe's uncle said he had gotten it all so Joe could be tidy too.
Joe smiled, and hugged his uncle. He knew that a shrug meant something nice all along.
<|endoftext|>

Once upon a time, there was a harmless green frog. The frog loved to hop around in the sunshine. One day, the frog spotted a pond. The pond looked like it had lots of tasty bugs. But when the frog hopped over to the pond, he couldn't get in. The pond was surrounded by some sort of fence. The frog asked himself, 'Why can't I get in, when all the bugs are in there?'
Suddenly, a kindly mallard duck flew down. She said to the frog, 'My friend, you can't get in the pond until I permit you.' The frog was confused. He asked, 'What does "permit" mean?' The duck said, 'It means I'm allowing you to come inside.' The duck then flew away and the frog happily hopped over to the pond.
He happily hopped around in the pond all day, eating bugs, and having a lot of fun! The kindly mallard had permitted him to have this wonderful experience, and he was grateful for her kindness. The frog learned an important lesson -sometimes we need to ask for permission, before we have fun.
<|endoftext|>

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Sophie. Sophie was very loyal to her friends, and would always help them if they were in trouble. One day, Sophie and her friends decided to go to a party at the circus.
When they got there, they saw the most amazing clown! He was dressed in a funny hat and jumpsuit, and Sophie begged her friends to let her take a photo with the clown. So they all lined up and took photos with him.
Just then, a big wind blew through the circus tent and the clown's hat broke off! Sophie was so sad, she wanted to help the clown. She started to look around for something to fix the hat so that he could look his best again.
After searching for a bit, she found a piece of string. She quickly threaded it through the broken hat and tied it in a knot. Then she showed it to the clown and the clown smiled.
The clown thanked Sophie for her help and said that she was the most loyal friend he had ever seen. Sophie was so happy and everyone at the circus had a great time for the rest of the day.

The boy looked all around, but he couldnt find a heel that would work. He was about to give up when he found a special store. Inside, the clerk smiled and said he had just the right heel for the boy!
He gave the boy the new heel and the boy was so happy he could jump and run around. He put the new heel on his shoe, and then he was off! Now the boys shoes were perfect and he could keep walking and walking. The end.

The girl smiled as she saw the rake working. She was excited and wanted to try out the rake. So, mommy let the girl use the rake, but told her to be careful and gentle, because the rake was fragile.
The girl used the rake with care, and was happy to have been able to use it. Once they finished, they put the rake back in the woods and when they looked back, it had disappeared. It was time to go, but the girl remembered the fragile yellow rake.

The engine was feeling very sad and lonely. But then a family of mice came and made a teacup home right next to the engine. The mice kept the engine company and helped give it a good night's sleep.
The engine was so thankful. It felt spoiled and was so happy to be loved. The engine and the mice were friends forever.

The birds were now so shiny in the sun! The little girl and her friends were so happy with the results that they decided that every day, they would borrow some oil and make the birds even more beautiful. When the little boy got close to the steam, he wanted to touch it. He put out his hand and he felt the steam tickle his fingers like soft feathers. It was so much fun that he started to laugh! The little boy's laughter made the steam rise up even higher. 
Then, suddenly, the steam started to turn into white clouds. He reached out to touch the clouds, but they were too high up in the sky. So the boy did the only thing he could. He closed his eyes and tears started falling down his cheeks. 
The tears made the clouds break up and suddenly the sun shone brighter than before. The boy looked up at the sun and smiled. He knew that everything was alright. He ran back to his parents, happy and free.

Once upon a time there was a little boy named Joe. Joe was three and he was very brave. Joe had a best friend, a horse named Sally.
One day Joe said to Sally, "Let's go on an adventure!" Sally said, "Yes! Let's go!" So off they rode into the woods.
When they arrived in the woods, Joe saw a little house. He decided to knock on the door to see who was inside. An old man opened the door and said, "Yes, can I help you?"
Joe asked the old man, "Can I borrow your whip?" The old man chuckled and said yes. Joe thanked him and grabbed the whip.
The two friends went deeper into the woods. Pretty soon they saw a helpless fox that was stuck in a bush. Joe said, "I can help this fox!" He used the whip to help the fox get out of the bush.
The fox thanked Joe and Sally and then ran away back into the woods. Joe and Sally smiled and happily rode back home.

Amy was very grateful and put the bracelet around her wrist. She thanked the owl, who then nodded and flew away. She watched him go, then started whistling as she walked back home, feeling very happy.

Mommy and Baby spent the day painting. Baby helped Mommy paint a big wall. The wall was plain before, but now it looked very special! 
When they were finished, Mommy sprayed a big word: "Welcome". It was beautiful, and sparkling in the sun! Baby was very proud. He said, "Look Mommy, I helped make something special!" 
Mommy smiled and said, "Yes, you did! Now everyone who sees it will know that our home is a place of welcome!"
<|endoftext|>

Once upon a time there was a little girl called Ruby. She lived in a hot and dry place, with lots of sand. One day she decided to explore beyond her own home. She started walking, but it was very hot, so she had to go slow. 
After a while she came to a special and magical place. She saw a small pond and it was surrounded by green plants. It was like a tiny oasis in the middle of the desert. Ruby had never seen anything like it and she was amazed. 
But then something very peculiar happened. She could feel a gentle breeze, and suddenly the little oasis started to turn. Ruby couldn't believe her eyes! The plants, the little pond and everything else, all just turned around! 
Ruby couldn't understand what had happened. But suddenly she realised that the oasis had been part of a tiny merry-go-round! She laughed with happiness, and started to turn it very slowly. 
The End.
<|endoftext|>
Once upon a time, there was an adorable puppy. He loved to rub his back against the carpet so it felt nice and cozy. But one day, he started to feel an itch that wouldn't go away.
The puppy tried to rub his back against the carpet but it didn't help the itch. He searched all over the house to find something to help, but nothing was right.
He lay down and closed his eyes, wondering what he could do. Then, he felt something tickle his back and was so relieved! His owner had found a special brush that was perfect for rubbing away the itch.
The puppy was so happy he jumped and danced around the room, feeling much better. From that day on, the puppy never itched again.

When the special day came, her dad brought her a shiny steel bike. She was so happy and couldn't wait to ride it.
Her dad said he went to the shop to find the perfect bike. He looked at lots of different ones but he saw this one and thought it was the best. It was available in many different colors but Nina chose a bright blue one.
Nina thanked her dad for the bike as she hopped on and began to ride. She was so happy and couldn't wait to show her friends her new steel bike.

Molly was feeling very thirsty. She had been playing with her toys all day and was ready for a drink.
Molly went to the kitchen and opened the cupboard. Inside was a big bag of juice. She smiled and took it out.
Molly grabbed a cup from the top shelf and poured some juice into it. She lifted the cup to her lips and took a big drink. It was so delicious!
After she finished, Molly tipped the last bit of juice into the cup. But some of it spilled onto the counter and made a big messy puddle. Oh no!
Molly quickly cleaned up the mess with a cloth and put the bag of juice away. She looked around, satisfied that everything was clean. Now she could go back to playing with her toys.

 Johnny loved to watch the dancers. Every day he would take a break from his toys to stand in front of the tv and watch the dancers. He liked to try and move with them, but it was never quite the same. 
One day Johnny was watching a show and the dancers were wearing special costumes. He was so angry he couldn't dance like them and he started to cry. Suddenly, a sparkly cup of juice appeared in front of him. He was so happy, he drank it all up. 
He felt different after he drank the juice. Suddenly he could move like the dancers on the tv. He jumped around the room with a smile on his face. 
The rich man who gave him the juice had been watching him dance. He was so impressed that he gave Johnny a present. It was a sparkly tutu, just like the ones the dancers on the tv wore. 
Now Johnny was just like the dancers. And every day he would don his tutu and stand in front of the tv and dance!

On his way to school, he saw a cat. He wanted to chase it but his mom said not to. He was so embarrassed when his mom told him he couldn't chase it. 
He had a quick lunch with his classmates at school. He ate a hotdog and had some juice. The lunch was really yummy but it was over very quickly. 
In a few minutes the teacher asked everyone to gather around the table. He was a bit scared but started to follow the other students. The teacher gave each student a long pencil. He felt relaxed and happy when he saw his pencil was the longest one. 
Tommy was so proud to have such a long pencil. He was so excited for his first day of school that he almost forgot about his embarrassing moment with the cat.

She took tiny steps towards the alligator and he smiled. Together, they played in the river all day. They jumped and splashed until it was time to go home. Daisy said goodbye to the alligator, "It was so fun!" She took one last big step, away from the river and went home with Mommy.

Once upon a time, there was a big box. It was a special box, with a label on it that said "Things to Make Noise". Inside the box was a lot of noisy things like drums and a whistle. But it was a secret and nobody knew what was inside!
One day, a little girl called Lily found the box. She was very curious and wanted to see what was inside. But before she opened it, she decided to cover the box with some paper. That way, no one would know what was inside!
She took a blank piece of paper and carefully covered the label. Then, Lily carefully opened the box. Inside were lots of things to make noise. There were drums, bells, cymbals and lots of other musical instruments. She was so excited and started to make some really loud music!
The whole house was suddenly so noisy. Everyone came running to see what was going on. When they saw Lily and the box, everyone smiled and clapped. Lily had discovered a special box full of noisy things and nobody knew about it until she covered the label and opened the box.

At lunchtime, Grandma and Grandpa ate some vegetables from the plant. The vegetables were bitter. Grandpa said they were good for his health. Grandma smiled and said they were yummy.
When Grandma and Grandpa were done, the sun was setting. Grandma and Grandpa said good-bye and went home.
The next day, they went back to the plant to work. Grandma and Grandpa worked hard all day again and then ate some of the vegetables from the plant. They were still very bitter, but Grandma and Grandpa said they were still tasty.
Grandma and Grandpa worked hard at the plant for many days. They were very happy to help make things. Grandma and Grandpa said goodbye when the sun was setting. They went home and were very tired from a long day of work.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Anna. She was so adorable, with bright blue eyes and curly dark hair.
One night, Anna needed to find her way in the dark, so she grabbed her flashlight and headed out of her bedroom. She walked carefully, and remembered what her mom told her to do. "Always use your flashlight to light your way," her Mom would remind her.
Anna shone her flashlight all around her, and then she noticed something unusual - a big, white bunny had followed her out of her room! The bunny was so cute and gentle, but Anna knew she should head back to her bedroom.
So, holding her flashlight in one hand, she gently picked up the bunny in her other one. She took one last look at the bunny, then went back to her room.
Anna placed the bunny back in its place, then hugged it goodbye. She stood back, smiled, and remembered the gentle bunny with its big, floppy ears - so adorable!  Anna made sure to remind herself to use her flashlight in the dark, so she can avoid any unexpected surprises.

Once upon a time, there was a driver. He was driving when he noticed something yucky. He couldn't figure out what it was. Then he saw it! It was a bitter bug, squished on his windshield. The driver didn't like this bug, but he had an idea. He could join it together with the other bugs outside his window.
So, the driver joined and mixed all the bugs outside. He mixed them until they were all stuck together. Then he watched as the bugs flew away!
The driver was so happy he joined the bugs together. He was glad that the bitter bug was gone and he could continue to drive. He drove for many miles and eventually felt much better! The end.

Her mom saw her standing there and came to her. She said it was ok, they were safe. She wrapped Jenny in her arms and Jenny felt safe and warm. She asked her mom what a hurricane was.
Mom said that a hurricane was a big storm. Its winds were very strong and could blow away houses. But her mom said that they had a modest house and it should be safe.
Still, Jenny was scared. She stayed close to her mom while they watched the hurricane outside until it was gone. When it was gone, she let out a huge scream of relief!

When they got home, Dad found the perfect spot for the vase in the corner of their living room. Timmy thought the vase was so cool and he wanted to show it to his friends the next day.
That night since he was excited, Timmy couldn't sleep. He wished they had a swing inside their house. Then he had an idea. He got out of bed and started pushing the vase, like it was a swing. He swung back and forth, until he got tired and woke up his dad.

The gorilla explained to the boy that he refused the other animals because he wanted to keep the jungle safe and beautiful. The boy was surprised and said it was an incredible thing to do. The gorilla smiled and took the boy's hand in his paw. Together, they walked around the jungle, showing the boy all of the incredible sights.

The boy was a bit shocked and didn't say anything. Princess Emily tried again and asked the same question, but the boy still didn't answer. She started to feel a bit frustrated and didn't know what to do.
Suddenly, another little boy ran up to the sad boy and started to talk to him. Then, the sad boy smiled and waved to Princess Emily! He said his name was Joe and he was very glad to meet her.
Princess Emily was so happy that she had made Joe feel better. She waved goodbye with a big smile and they decided to meet again the next day.

Once there was a girl called Ellie who liked to jog. Every day she would tie up her pink laces and jog around in the park.
Jogging made Ellie feel alive and happy. She liked to feel the breeze on her face and feel her heart beat faster. When she jogged she breathed in lots of oxygen which was like air for her body. 
One day a dog started running alongside her. It was a cute little dog. Its name was Lucky. Ellie stopped jogging and patted Lucky on its head. They both kept on jogging and playing together. 
But then something bad happened. Lucky started to pant and couldn't catch his breath. Ellie soon realised that Lucky needed oxygen as he couldn't get enough air. So she quickly took him to the vet.
The vet gave Lucky some bitter medicine which helped him breath better. Lucky was feeling much better. But Ellie was feeling very sad. Lucky had to stay at the vet for a few days to get better. Then they would be able to jog together again.

The next day Jake went to the park by himself. He saw the exact same toy car and he wanted it very badly. Again, he asked his parent if he could buy it. But the parent disagreed and said it was still too expensive. Jake was disappointed again, and he was very envious of all the other kids that had toy cars.
So Jake saved up his pocket money for many months, and eventually he was able to buy the toy car himself. He was very proud and happy, and all the other kids in the park were envious of his new toy car. Jake remembered this lesson and he knew that sometimes it's important to disobey his parent and get what he wanted.

Every week, one brother would receive a package with a big amount of wheat. When he got it, he would always think of his brother and wish they could be together again.

The sound caught the attention of a nearby bird. The bird was very curious and flew over to Lenny to see what he was doing.
But when the bird saw all the nuts he got angry and started to yell too! He was telling Lenny to go away and take his nuts with him.
Not wanting to lose all the food he had found, Lenny quickly gathered up his nuts and ran off.
He never was quite so nosy after that day.

Once upon a time, there was a dry river. It had been dry for a long, long time.
One day, a big truck was struggling to go up a steep hill. The truck got stuck and went over the side of the hill, crashing and becoming a wreck.
The driver of the truck was struggling to get out of the wreck and into the dry river. He had to climb until he found a way out.
After a long time of struggling, the driver finally made it out of the wreck and into the dry river. He walked down the dry river and eventually reached the other side. He was thankful he made it out safely - but he never wanted to go through that struggle again!
<|endoftext|>

One day, a little girl named Lucy was taking a nap in her crib. She was cuddling with her favorite stuffed animal and dreaming sweet dreams. When the sun started setting, Lucy became excited. She knew that it was almost time for the night to arrive.
Night finally came and the house was quiet. Lucy could hear the soft sounds of sleepy animals outside. She waited patiently while looking out of the window at the night sky. All of a sudden, she got an idea. She quickly jumped out of bed and excitedly grabbed her magic wand.
She waved the wand around, saying her magical words. She giggled as sparkles flew around her. Suddenly, the night sky lit up with twinkling stars, like someone had covered it with glitter. Each one shone brilliantly against the dark sky.
Lucy was so proud of all she had done. She carefully put her wand away and climbed back into her bed with a satisfied smile. Tomorrow would be a brand new day, but for now she was content with what she had become - a magical heroine of the night.
<|endoftext|>

Once upon a time there was a loyal store. The store was filled with wonderful things and everyone who worked there was always very nice.
The store had many customers who would smile when they came in and the employees would smile back. They would chat and laugh and everyone felt very happy. The employees felt lucky to work at the store.
Everyday, a small girl would come to the store. Her name was Lucy and she was only three years old. Lucy was always very excited when she arrived! She would smile as she looked around and point out the different things she liked.
The store workers would smile back. They were so kind to Lucy and were very loyal to her. They would never forget her happy smile and always treated her with respect.
No matter how sad Lucy felt when she left, the store had made her happy. Lucy was always excited to come back to the store. It was her happy place!

Once upon a time there was a dark oak tree in the forest. Everything was quiet and still until one day, a little girl found it and wanted to solve a mystery. She walked up to the tree and noticed something strange. There was a box filled with colorful balls. She didn't know what to do but she wanted to solve the mystery. So she carefully took out the balls and lined them up. She counted them, sorted them and placed them in a circle around the tree. Suddenly, there was a loud noise. She looked up and saw the tree burst into a flurry of color. She had solved the mystery, the dark oak tree was actually a magical rainbow tree! The little girl was ecstatic and hugged the tree with joy. From then on, the little girl visited the magical tree every day and the two of them created many wonderful adventures.

One day, he was sleeping in the living room when suddenly, he heard a loud crash. He jumped up and ran to the kitchen.
There he saw a big vase knocked over. It was broken into lots of pieces. He knew right away he was the one to blame.
The naughty cat saw a window and ran out of the house. He knew his owners would be mad if they knew he had struck the vase and made a mess.
The cat ran and ran until he was far away. He never returned to that house again.

Once upon a time there was a girl named Molly. Molly loved to draw! Every day she would take her pen and paper and try to make the most beautiful pictures. She was so excited to watch the ink swirling around the paper and make a masterpiece. But one day, the pen ran out of ink! Molly was so sad that she couldnt draw any more.
Luckily, her mom was very persistent. She helped Molly make more ink for her pen. Molly was so happy that she jumped around and clapped her hands. Now Molly can make as many beautiful pictures as she wanted! She was filled with excitement and she couldn't wait to get started. 
Molly and her mom laughed and smiled. Molly was filled with gratitude to her mom for being so persistent and helping her to be able to draw. They hugged each other and Molly went back to creating the most amazing pictures. 
The End.

The little girl quickly went to tell her mom. Her mom called a veterinarian right away. The veterinarian was very compassionate and came over to the park to help the little dog.
The veterinarian checked the dog and said it needed to get special medicine for its injuries. The little girl and her mom were so grateful for the veterinarian's compassion. They thanked her for helping the little dog.
The veterinarian gave them a bottle of medicine and asked them to take good care of the little dog. The little girl's mom agreed and thanked the veterinarian again. 
The little girl was happy knowing the little dog would get better soon. She was glad that the veterinarian was there to help.

The little girl didn't like the idea at first, but then she remembered that the police are there to support her. So she took a deep breath and went to find the police.
When she got to the police station, she was still very scared but she was also brave. She talked to the nice policeman who listened to her carefully, and he promised to help her.
The policeman helped her find the answer she needed, and he also promised to always be there to support her. Now the little girl felt much better and was not so confused anymore.

Once upon a time, there were two best friends. One was named Tim and the other was named Jack. Jack and Tim always had fun together.
One day, Jack arrived at Tim's house. They went into the living room and sat down. Tim pointed to his new clock on the wall and said, "Look Jack! I got a new clock." Jack was very excited and turned to Tim and asked, "What does it do?" Tim explained that the clock told the time.
They talked and discussed the clock for a while. They thought the clock was very honest. It always told the correct time. 
Jack thought it was a very honest clock.  Tim smiled and said, "Yes! It is a very honest clock!" 
The two friends were happy they could discuss the clock together. They had a lot of fun. They agreed the clock was a very special one. 
And Tim and Jack stayed friends for a very long time!

Soon, the plane started getting closer to the ground. It was time to release the passengers so that they could start new adventures. Everyone was grateful for the exciting journey and the beautiful view.
The plane flew away and the people said goodbye. They waved and thanked the plane for the wonderful experience. They knew it would be a day they would never forget.

But then a bigger boy came along. He was very selfish. He wanted the puddle all to himself. The boy wanted Mark to go away. He said it was his puddle.
Mark felt sad. But he knew it was not right for the selfish boy to take the puddle. So Mark got angry and he splashed lots of water at the boy. He made a big splash.
The boy ran away. He was wet and grumpy. Mark smiled and watched the boy go. Then he played in the puddle again. He had fun. He knew it was his puddle now.

Just then, her dad came by. He put his big strong arms around the machine and pushed it away. Then he rescued the puppy from the hole.
The puppy was so happy! Lucy was very proud of her dad. He had saved the day! They hugged and snuggled the puppy until he stopped being so scared.

The little boy was so happy. He now had a restored skull that he could keep forever. He hugged the skull and promised it that he would never let it break again. Then, he snuggled up and went to sleep.

The monkey was swinging happily from branch to branch, and Jack laughed to see it. After his jog, Jack returned to the tree and brought some food with him. He offered it to the monkey, and they quickly became friends.
Now every day Jack would set off on his jog, and the monkey would hop down from the tree to join him. It was so useful to have a monkey running alongside him! They would jog together, and Jack was never alone.
In no time, Jack and monkey were the best of friends. It sure was useful to have a monkey around!

Eventually the sun set and it was time to go inside. Little John put his sunglasses away and lay down on the couch. He could see mummy's face, still looking a bit weak. He smiled and gave mummy another hug. The feeling of comfort was so strong that mummy's face lit up and she felt better.

The puppy seemed to understand the little girl, and he showed her the way out of the long hall. Together, they walked and the little girl felt safe knowing she wasn't alone.
At last, they reached the end of the hall. The little girl was so happy she hugged the puppy. She was thankful for his help and felt so much less helpless.

Once upon a time there was a small bird, it was all alone in a big dry cage. It wanted to be free and fly away with friends. It tweeted and sang to try and find a way out but it couldnt escape. Then one day a kind person came and opened the cage. The bird flew out into the bright blue sky and was so happy to be free. 
The kind person put a lock on the cage so no other birds were trapped. The bird thanked the person and flew away. 
The bird was so happy, it sang and flew off with its new friends. The dry cage was empty and the lock was still on it so no other birds would get trapped. The bird was forever thankful to the kind person who let it be free.

Once upon a time there was a small kitten called Mr Fluffy. Mr Fluffy would love to explore the outdoors, but he was scared and would always stay inside. One day he decided to try something new, he wanted to balance on the coal which was kept next to the fireplace. He was nervous, but he knew he had to try.
Mr Fluffy slowly crept up to the coal pile. His tiny paws were shaking with fear but he was determined to do it. He stepped onto the lump of coal and, with practice, started to balance. After only a few seconds he was standing still, with both paws firmly planted on the lump of coal. He felt proud.
Suddenly, there was a loud noise and Mr Fluffy was scared. He quickly lost balance and fell off the coal pile. He lay there for a few seconds, feeling sad and scared. But after a few moments, he plucked up the courage to climb back up the coal. He took a deep breath, and stepped onto the coal again. After a few moments of practice, he once again managed to balance. He stayed there for a few seconds and felt very happy.
The next day, Mr Fluffy balanced on the coal pile again and again until he was no longer scared. He had conquered his fear and now he was happy and brave.

Molly said she didn't like it, but the cat said it was just part of who he was. Molly shrugged and happily watched the cat play with the smoke. She thought it was very charming. Once upon a time there were two best friends: Kitty and Jake. Jake liked to swim in the pool and Kitty liked to eat popcorn. 
One day, Jake wanted to show Kitty a special trick he could do while swimming. But when he went to the pool, he saw that someone else was swimming there - it was Lucy. Lucy was the best swimmer in the whole town!
Kitty got jealous and stopped eating her popcorn. She didn't want to watch Lucy show off her swimming skills. But then Lucy saw Kitty and asked if she wanted to join them. They all splashed around in the pool and had so much fun! 
Kitty was so happy that Lucy asked her to swim. She shared her popcorn with Lucy and Jake and they all laughed and smiled. From that day on, all three of them were the best of friends and went swimming and ate popcorn together. The end.

Once upon a time there was a naughty goat who wanted to be famous. He wanted to put a big billboard up in the middle of the town, but he didn't know how to do it.
So he asked the strong bull who lived next door. The bull said he had a plan, and it would make the goat famous. The plan was to pull the billboard with a rope.
The goat was excited. He tried to pull the billboard all by himself, but it was too heavy. So he asked all the tiny birds for help.
The tiny birds were jealous, but they agreed and flew from tree to tree, until the billboard was in the middle of the town. All the animals cheered, and the goat had become famous! He had succeeded!

Mandy was so proud of her dog. But then it saw a rabbit and decided to give chase. Mandy yelled "stop!" But the dog kept running. It chased the rabbit all the way to a tip.
The tip was full of muddy puddles. The dog ran so fast it splashed the mud up and made a big mess. Mandy laughed and called her dog back. She held the tip of the stick so the dog could bite it. Her pink dog was happy again.

Once upon a time there was a child who was very scared. She had a big exam and was so nervous she was shaking. The exam was made of thin paper, so the child was worried that she would not be able to do it properly.
Suddenly, a friendly bird flew in through the window and sat on her desk. It began to talk to her, in a gentle, comforting voice. It said, "Don't worry. You can do it! Just take a deep breath and take your time, one step at a time."
The child was so relieved. With the bird's help, she took the thin exam paper, slowly read every question, and slowly but surely she filled in her answers.
Finally, it was time to hand it in. The child nervously handed it to the teacher, and the teacher smiled. She had done her best, and it was enough! She felt so proud.
As the bird flew out of the window and away, the child thanked it silently. Then, with a big smile on her face, she confidently shook the teachers hand and said goodbye.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Jack. One day, Jack was playing in his garden and he had been very careful. Suddenly, something caught his ear. It was a lot of clapping. He looked around and saw that it was coming from the nearby park.
Curious, Jack went to have a look. When he arrived, he saw a lot of people applauding. Then he saw, to his surprise, that it was a clown. The clown was making everyone laugh and they were all enjoying it. Jack was very happy and started clapping too.
Everyone was very happy, even Jack's ear. He couldn't help but laugh and applaud. After the show was over, Jack thanked the clown. The clown smiled and said he was glad to make Jack smile.
The next day, Jack wanted to show the clown how grateful he was. He told his dad he wanted to make the clown a present. They went to the park and the clown was there again. But this time he was being careless.
Jack quickly ran to help the clown. He held up the clown's hat and the clown was so thankful. He put his hat back on and hugged Jack. Everyone clapped and cheered for Jack and the clown. They all knew that Jack had been very brave.

John laughed and jumped around the garden, trying to catch the insect. The insect was too fast though, and soon it was gone. John was confused but he was also filled with joy for the fun game he just played with the silly insect.

Once upon a time, there was a green vehicle. Every day it would ask an important question. But no one ever seemed to answer.
One day, a 3 year old heard about the question. He was very curious and decided to answer it. He was so brave!
The 3 year old walked up to the vehicle and confidently said: "I can answer your question!" 
The vehicle was so surprised! It was expecting an adult to answer, not a little boy. But the boy was brave and insisted that he could answer.
The vehicle finally asked the question, "What do you like to do most in the world?"
The 3 year old thought for a minute and then answered, "I like to play with my friends and laugh!"
The vehicle was so pleased with the answer. It thanked the 3 year old and said he was the bravest person around!
The 3 year old went off with a big smile on his face, proud that he had answered the question. He would never forget this special moment.

At first, the package was very happy. The things inside were sweet and nice. But then one day, something sour arrived. It made the package sad. The sour was so strong that it made the package worry.
The package didn't know what to do. The sourness was increasing, and it was scared. But then one day, it felt something inside it. It was small, but happy. It couldn't be sour!
The package realized it was a smile. The package was excited and happy. The smile made the sour go away.
The package was happy again, and the smile stayed with it always. No matter what, it always increased the package's happiness.

Once upon a time, there was a thin rhinoceros. He loved going for walks in the park and taking in the sights. One day, while wandering, he spotted something special. From afar, he could see a shiny, sparkly rock. He was so surprised at the sight, he just had to take a closer look!
So, he trudged over, his feet clamoring over the soft grass. When he was close enough, he stopped and gazed at the stone. It was beautiful, with swirls of green and blues. He wanted it to be his, so he carefully picked it up.
He stared at it for a few moments more, then shuffled away, admiring his sparkling new treasure. He smiled the whole way home, giddy with excitement. He was so happy to have found such an amazing thing just for him!

Once there was a little girl named Sarah. She was three years old and loved to explore the world around her. One day, Sarah was playing in the garden when she heard a strange noise. She quickly ran to see what was going on. 
As she got closer, she saw the source of the noise. It was a dog, digging a big hole in the ground. Sarah's mind was a bit confused. She was so curious about why the dog was making all that noise. 
 
Sarah decided to ask the dog what he was doing. But when she got nearer, the dog ran away. She noticed that the dog had dug up a lot of dirt, making everything very dirty. Sarah looked around, trying to find the dog. 
Suddenly, she heard the same noise from before. Sarah looked around and noticed the dog was still digging the same hole. She thought it was so funny that the dog wanted to mind its own business and create a big mess. 
Sarah smiled, and decided to help the dog clean up all the dirt. She threw all the dirt back in the hole and patted the dog on the head. She was so happy to have made a new friend. After that, Sarah and the dog became best buddies!

The grown-up lifted him onto the swing. John started to move back and forth while he yelled "weee!". The grown-up laughed and said he was very brave. John was having so much fun.
When John started to get tired, the helpful grown-up said it was time to get off. He thanked her and ran back to the playground. He was so excited to tell his mom all about his adventure.

Suddenly, a magical bird flew out of the lighthouse. It flew down and comforted the sailor. The sailor felt a lot better and smiled.
The bird flew back to the lighthouse and the sailor continued to sail. The sailor thanked the bird and he knew that he was safe.
The sailor made it back to his home safely. He never forgot the light of the lighthouse, or the magical bird that comforted him.

Once there was a crab who lived by the sea. Every day the crab would go out and explore the area. One day, he found the most beautiful shell. He was so excited and he insisted on taking the shell home with him.
But the shell was stuck tightly to the rocks and it was very difficult for the crab to take it away. He pulled and pulled but it wouldn't budge. Taking the shell home seemed impossible.
The crab didn't give up. He kept trying and eventually, he was able to prize the shell loose. Now, he had his beautiful shell and could take it home. 
He was so happy and he insisted on showing all of his friends his new, special shell. He was the happiest crab in the sea!

Once upon a time there was a little girl called Lila. She had big brown eyes and a thin face.
One day, Lila went to the park with her mom. While they were there, they saw a puppy playing with its friends. Lila was so excited to pet the fluffy puppy.
But then, Lila noticed that the puppy had a thin face. She could tell it was feeling sad. 
So, Lila decided to tell the puppy that it was very beautiful. She smiled and said, You are so lovely!
The puppy's face suddenly lit up. It started jumping around and wagging its tail.
Lila and her mom watched as the puppy and its friends had lots of fun. They were so happy that Lila was able to make the puppy smile. 
And from that day onwards, Lila learned that it's always important to be kind and tell others how special they are.

Once upon a time, there was a little fox who was very hungry. He was all alone in the forest, and he had not eaten anything in days. He often rolled around in the dirt, looking for something to eat. 
One day, he heard a noise and saw a man walking through the woods. In his hand, he had a can of spray and a waffle. The fox was so excited, he ran over to the man and begged for some food. The man could see how hungry the fox was and so he kindly gave him the waffle.
The fox was so happy and gobbled it up in an instant. But then the man pointed the spray at the fox and made him wet. The little fox ran away, scared and confused. Later he figured out that the spray was only water. The man was teaching the fox an important lesson - that you don't need to beg for food and that it is better to take care of yourself. 
The fox never forgot the lesson and he never begged for food again.
<|endoftext|>

Once upon a time, there was a pond. It was a nice pond, with lots of fish swimming around in it.
One day, a little boy decided he wanted to splash in the pond. He ran to it, kicked off his shoes and jumped in! He was having so much fun splashing around.
Suddenly, he heard a terrible sound. It was a mean crocodile! The crocodile was angry and scaring the fish away. The little boy was very scared, he started to cry.
The crocodile heard him and started to splash the little boy. The little boy was too scared to move - he just put his hands over his eyes. Luckily, his mom came and rescued him. She shouted at the crocodile and it ran away.
The little boy was so happy to be safe again. He and his mom went home and he never splashed in the pond again.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Sam. He was 3 years old. Sam loved playing at the beach. Every day, he would build sand castles and search for seashells.
One day, while he was building his sandcastle, a crab came out from beneath the sand! Sam was so surprised that he jumped back! He cautiously stepped closer to the crab and said: "Hello, Mr. Crab!"
The crab scuttled away, so Sam started to chase it. The crab crawled into a hole in the sand and Sam crawled in after it. Once inside, he found something disgusting - a pile of smelly fishbones.
Sam stepped back in surprise and quickly crawled back out. He never wanted to go in there again!

It was a sunny day and a boy was walking outside. He saw a wet book on the ground. He picked it up and looked at it. He knew he wanted to read it! So he decided to take it home.
When the boy got home he was really excited. He wanted to open the book and start reading. But when he opened it, the pages of the book were stuck together. It was all wet!
The boy was disappointed, he couldn't read the book. But then he had an idea. He quickly ran back outside and found a puddle.
He jumped in and got really wet.
When he got back home he opened the book again. Now that he was wet, the pages weren't stuck together anymore. He smiled and started to read. He was so happy that he had his own book to read!

Once upon a time, there were two best friends. One was a cat and one was a dog. Together, they liked to play in the backyard. 
The cat's fur was soft and the dog's tail was waggy; they were both very happy. But one day, they started to discuss who had the better nose.
The cat said her nose was better because it was small and pink and could smell lots of fun things like butterflies and falling leaves. But the dog thought his nose was better because it was big, black and could smell really far away.
They both started to get fierce! They ran around and around, trying to prove to each other who was right. 
But then, they stopped to take a deep breath. They looked at each other and laughed; they were still best friends, no matter which one had the better nose!

Once there was a princess who loved wearing her fancy suit. Every morning, she'd kiss her pet frog and spin around and around until she felt dizzy. Then, she'd look in the mirror and admire how pretty she looked in her suit. 
One day she decided to explore her kingdom. She wore her suit, kissed her pet frog goodbye, and skipped out of the castle. As she walked around, she saw lots of animals, flowers, and even some dragons!
She spun around in a circle until the world started to look dizzy. Then, she spotted a pond in the distance. She grabbed a rock and tossed it into the water. As she watched the ripples expand outwards, a fish jumped out of the water and kissed her hand!
The princess was so surprised that she forgot to be dizzy. She laughed and said goodbye to the fish, then skipped back to the castle in her suit, happy and content.

Step by step Sarah made her way up the stair. As she reached the top, she saw a beautiful view! The view was so beautiful that Sarah wanted to write about it. She took out her pen and paper and started to write. 
She wrote about the beautiful view and how mysterious the stair was. Sarah was very happy that she had taken the risk to explore the old house. She knew that her curiosity had led her to a special place. The place will always be special to her.

Finally the dinner was ready and Mama bear served it up. Baby bear clapped with delight and said "Yummy! This looks so good!" 
Mama bear smiled at Baby bear and they both ate their dinner. And they were happy and full after their yummy dinner. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a painter who was very heavy. He could not find anything to hide under. One day, he saw a big bush and thought it was the perfect spot to hide. He crawled under the bush and it felt nice and cool.
Suddenly, he heard a noise. He squinted his eyes and saw a snake. He was scared and tried to stay as still as he could. The snake crawled closer and he held his breath. Suddenly, the snake started to paint on the ground. It quickly painted a beautiful picture.
The painter was so surprised. He had never seen such a beautiful painting. He didn't know that snakes could be such good painters! The painter crawled out from under the bush and thanked the snake. The snake smiled, and the painter realized he wasn't scared anymore. 
From then on, the painter never tried to hide again. He decided to be brave, use his talents, and paint whatever he wanted. Even though it was scary sometimes, the truth was that the painter was a very talented painter. He learned that facing his fears and pushing through his pain made his art even better!

The witch quickly said a magic spell to stop the fairy in its tracks. The fairy decided it was no fun and flew away. 
The witch smiled and went back to her magic. She waved her wand and mysterious things began to appear. The whole room was filled with cheerful noises and laughter. Everyone was happy. 
The witch kept on doing her magic until the sun began to go down. Then she said goodbye, put her wand away and went home. All the magic had been a lot of fun!

Oliver was grumpy. He wanted to go for a drive, but his mom said no.
"Mom," asked Oliver, "can I drive the car to the planet?"
His mom sighed. "No, Oliver. You're not big enough to drive a car."
"But I'm grumpy," he said.
"I know you are," she said. "But you can't drive to the planet. That's too far away."
"OK," he said. He thought for a minute. "Mom, can I drive my toy truck to the park?"
His mom smiled. "That's a great idea. Let's go!"
So Oliver drove his toy truck to the park with his mom. He drove around and around and had a lot of fun. When they were finished, they drove home and Oliver was happy again.

One day, the bear went to explore some new woods. He came to a big tree and gave it a big squeeze. He was hoping to find some wisdom inside.
Suddenly, he heard a voice come from the tree. "What do you seek?" it said.
The bear was very surprised. He told the tree: "I seek wisdom".
The tree said: "Give me a big squeeze and wisdom will come".
The bear smiled and squeezed the tree with all his might. When he finished, a fine wisdom was released from the tree.
The bear was very thankful. He now knew many things and had some magnificent wisdom to share.

Then he heard some noise. He looked in every direction, and then he saw another man. The other man was holding a shiny red ball. Suddenly, the man holding the ball started running away. The other man started to run after him.
He ran and ran, until he caught up to the other man. Then he stopped and said, "Hey, why are you running away so fast?"
The other man looked a bit scared and said, "I'm sorry, I was just trying to have some fun!"
The other man smiled and said, "That's OK. Let's just have a normal game of catch instead."

Once upon a time, there were two friends named Tom and Sally. Tom loved exploring and Sally preferred to stay home and read books. But they were always together and they were very reliable friends. 
One day, they were walking along a river and Tom found a big boat. Lets go for a ride! he shouted. 
Sally shook her head. No way, it looks too dangerous.
But Tom was not persuaded by her. Come on! Well keep each other safe.
Sally sighed and reluctantly agreed. Eventually, they both climbed inside the boat. 
But before either of them noticed, the boat had started to part from the shore. They soon realized that they were drifting down the river and away from their home.
Tom and Sally both tried to escape as fast as they could. But they were too small to push the boat back. 
Just then, they heard the sound of an engine. They looked up and saw a reliable boat coming their way. Tom waved to the boat and it came to their rescue. 
The reliable boat pulled them back to the shore. Tom and Sally were so happy they were back safe, and thanked their rescuer.

When she arrived, she saw that there were lots of big waves coming in. She felt very nervous, but also excited.
A friendly lifeguard came up to Lucy and said, "Hello there! Do you want to try and surf?" Lucy nodded her head, yes.
The lifeguard showed Lucy how to step onto the surfboard, how to paddle, and how to stand up on it. After watching a few times, Lucy was ready to try it for herself.
Feeling a bit nervous, she stepped onto the surfboard, paddled forward and then stood up tentatively.
Suddenly, Lucy felt the board start to move and the wave caught her. She was so happy that she had done it! After that, Lucy went back every day to practice her surfing until she became a pro.

Once there was a little girl who lived in a small house with a porch. She was eager to explore and play outside, so one day she went out to her porch and found a fierce-looking animal. She didn't recognize it, but she was brave and wanted to make friends.
"Hi there," she said. "My name is Henrietta. What's yours?"
The animal blinked and looked at her. He seemed unsure if he could trust her.
"You can trust me," she said. "I just want to be your friend. I won't hurt you. Please tell me your name."
The animal stepped closer and sniffed her. She didn't run away, but smiled. "My name is Max," he said. 
Henrietta smiled. "Max? That's a nice name," she said.
Max recognized that she was friendly and kind. He felt relieved, and the two of them became fast friends. They played together for hours on the porch. 
From that day on, Henrietta and Max were always together. Whenever Henrietta went out to her porch, Max was there too, greeting her with a loving meow.
