She wanted to get away, so she calmly asked the bear, "Please bear, can I go?" The bear gave a nod and Molly ran away. But as she was running, she got her finger stuck in a tree.
Molly didn't know what to do. She was stuck and the bear was coming. She started to cry. "Help me, please!" she shouted. All of a sudden, a rabbit came by and saw what was happening.
The rabbit quickly hopped over and started chewin on the wood of the tree. After a few minutes, the wood was weak enough and Molly was able to free her finger.
Molly was so happy and thanked the rabbit for saving her. She learnt a valuable lesson that day - always be careful and respectful when you're exploring, because some things can be dangerous!

Once upon a time there was an ice cream cone. The cone was round and white and it had beautiful colourful sprinkles all over it.
The cone was very happy with its life, it was glad to be alive. One day it decided to take a stroll in the sun. It felt so good in the warm summer air.
Along the way, the cone saw a cabbage. The cabbage said: "Hey cone, why haven't you melted yet?" The cone replied: "I'm glad that I'm still here, I love the sun!"
But soon the sun became too hot, and the cone started to rot. The cone said sadly: "Oh no, I'm melting away."
The cabbage was sad to see the cone rot away. It said: "Don't worry cone! I will always remember you." The cone smiled and waved goodbye as it melted away.

So Sam climbed the high mountain. It was very hard but he kept going. Finally, he reached the top and there was gold everywhere! Sam was very excited.

Suddenly a naughty boy named Tom saw something shiny in the corner of the room. It was a pan. He was very excited and could not wait to take the pan. Without thinking, he grabbed it and hid it behind his back.
His mom saw him, and immediately scolded him. She told him to put the pan back where he found it, but Tom refused. He only grew more naughty and started running around the house with the pan in his hand.
Tom's mom knew that if she let him away with it, he would suffer greatly later in his life, so she tried to be patient and stop him from taking the pan. But Tom was too naughty and quick. He slyly dodged his mom's reach and ran out of the house.
His mom knew she must get the pan back and went after Tom. He had gone so far that she almost lost him. Fortunately, she managed to catch him and take the pan away. She buried it back to the corner of the room and scolded Tom for being naughty.
Tom knew he was wrong and began to cry. He suffered from his mom's scolding, but it also taught him an important lesson that he would never forget.
<|endoftext|>
 
Once upon a time there was a little girl called Mandy. She was so excited because she was going to her first bounce show. The stage was icy, but it made the show so much more exciting.
At the show, Mandy bounced around like crazy. She jumped and bounced on the stage and the audience cheered and clapped. She did amazing flips and bounces and everyone was so impressed.
After the show, Mandy's parents took her out for a treat. Mandy was so happy because she had so much fun bouncing around on the stage.
Now, whenever Mandy visits the bounce show she can't help but smile and bounce around. She loves it so much and will never forget how icy the stage was!
<|endoftext|>

Mark and his family arrived at the store. It was full of people, and the lines seemed tight. Mark's dad was looking around, trying to find something to buy.
After a while, Mark's dad said, "Mark, look at this order. It's very big. Do you think we should buy it?"
Mark really wanted to get the order, but he was a bit scared. He asked his Dad, "What's it for? Is it heavy?"
His Dad smiled and said, "It will help us with our work. It's not too heavy, and we have enough money." 
Mark thought about it for a moment and then decided he wanted to get the order. He said, "Yes, Daddy, let's get it!"
Mark and his Dad went to the counter and paid for the order. On the way home, Mark felt very proud. He was happy he was brave enough to mark the order.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sarah who was three years old. She loved to spend time with her friends in the classroom.
One day, Sarah went to school early. The sun was just beginning to peek over the horizon as Sarah stepped into her classroom. It was full of bright colors and filled with straight rows of little desks. Sarah thought it was so beautiful!
Sarah spent a lot of time in the classroom. She would draw pictures, practice her letters and even play with the other students. She was always happy and the classroom felt like home. 
After school, Sarah always looked forward to the next day. She knew it would be just as beautiful, and she couldn't wait to spend more time in her classroom.

One night, Jake was walking through the woods alone. He felt very scared as the woods were very quiet. Suddenly, he heard a loud noise from the bushes and a huge tiger came out. Jake was so scared he started to shiver.
"Don't be afraid," said the tiger. "I just wanted to have a look around and make sure no one else was here."
Jake was very surprised, he had never talked to a tiger before. He was so scared but he managed to answer.
"Yes, I was passing by and I am the only person here," he replied.
The tiger smiled and said, "That's good, then I can carry on exploring. Have a good night!"
The tiger disappeared into the bushes and Jake continued to walk, but now he was walking faster, still feeling scared but relieved that the tiger wasn't mad. He was glad to make it out of the woods and get home safely.
<|endoftext|>

Everyone was so happy. The teacher said it was time to start, so they all sat down. Then the teacher asked everyone to clap. So the little girl and all the other children clapped and it was so loud.
The teacher said it was time for a break, so everyone went outside to play. There was a huge playground with lots of fun things to do. The children laughed and clapped and had a great time. 
When it was time to go home, the little girl was so sad to leave. But she knew she would be coming back the next day and couldn't wait to see her new class again.

One day, a sheep was in the field when he noticed something strange. He heard a loud noise coming from inside a nearby forest. The sheep was curious, so he decided to investigate. He ran through the trees until he saw a harsh puddle in a clearing. There, the sheep found a wolf struggling to escape. The wolf was stuck and the puddle was too deep for it to jump over. The sheep thought for a moment and then created an idea. He gathered some sticks and rocks from the ground and built a bridge over the puddle. The wolf was very thankful and quickly ran across the bridge to safety. The sheep watched as the wolf ran away and smiled. This sheep was brave and clever. All of the other animals were very proud!

Molly was happy - she'd had lots of fun. She thanked her mum again, and the two of them walked home together.

Soon, Joe saw something swimming in the pond. He shouted, "Daddy! Daddy! I found a tuna!"
His dad ran over and said, "Well done, Joe! You did a great job!"
Joe was very proud of himself. He had done such a good job at keeping his eyes open for the tuna. From then on, Joe was always looking for new animals on the farm.

Suddenly, there was a loud boom! Startled, Jimmy jumped up. The window was broken and there was a monster standing outside! The monster growled and said, "You were not supposed to lay down while your mom was away. I warned you!" It was too late, Jimmy had been naughty.
Mom came home and she was very angry. She scolded Jimmy for disobediently laying down. He had to clean up the broken glass as punishment. Jimmy learnt his lesson and promised to never lay down when his mom wasn't home again.

Suddenly, an idea popped into her head: she wanted to climb to the top of the slide and succeed! She quickly scampered to the tall structure and began to crawl up. But every time she was about to reach the top, she would get scared and slip back down.
Then, her Mommy and Daddy came over to her and asked, "What is your dream?"
The little girl pointed up to the top of the slide and replied, "I want to climb to the top and succeed!"
Mommy and Daddy smiled and praised her. "We believe in you! You can do it!"
Filled with encouragement, the little girl slowly crawled up and made it to the top. She proudly looked down and smiled, feeling triumphant. 
"You did it!" Mommy and Daddy cried.
The little girl smiled brighter and replied, "Yes, I succeeded!"

Once upon a time there were two friends; one was named Tom and the other was named Sam. Tom enjoyed spelling, but Sam was not so fond of it. 
Tom was always leaning over books, thinking about all the words he knew. 
One day Sam asked Tom, "Why do you like spelling?" 
Tom replied, "It's fun and I like to learn new words." 
But Sam was still frustrated, so they decided to have a spelling contest. 
Tom was confident in his spelling ability, but Sam was a bit afraid. He knew his spelling was a bit messy. 
Tom said, "I promise I won't put you down, it'll just be a fun game!" 
Sam finally agreed, and the two began the spelling contest. 
Tom was great at spelling and finished first, while Sam struggled a bit. 
When it was all over, Tom smiled and said, "See it wasn't so bad after all!" 
Sam sighed and smiled, happy that he had finally conquered his fear and leaned more about spelling.

Once there was a little princess who loved rainbows. Every morning she would look out of her window hoping to see a beautiful rainbow but it was always cloudy outside. One day, the little princess had a good idea. She decided to have a yummy picnic! She collected some of her favorite treats and headed outside. But as soon as she stepped outside, the sky turned grey and rain started to fall. The little princess was very upset because the rain kept preventing her from seeing the rainbow. 
Suddenly, she saw a flash of light in the sky. When she squinted her eyes, she could see a rainbow! The little princess smiled happily and ran around trying to catch the rainbow. She smiled as the rainbow came closer and closer. But just as she was about to catch it, the rain started pouring again. The little princess sighed as the rainbow disappeared, but she knew that she could try again the next day. She ran back inside, happy and content.

She quickly bent down to pick it up, but before she could get it, little John dashed past. He had snatched up the hook and was rapidly wrapping it around his finger. Mummy smiled and relieved her embarrassment. She reached out her hand and John gave her the hook. With a happy twirl, he ran off to play. Mummy sighed and put the hook back in its place. What an adventure a 3 year old could have with the most simple of objects.

Once there was a little seal that was very hungry. He had been looking for food for a long time, but he just couldn't find anything to eat.
The seal swam and swam, but he was still very hungry. Then he saw an ice cream cone. He swam up to it and tried to grab it, but he lost it and it fell into the ocean. 
He was so sad that he started to cry. He was so hungry and he wanted the ice cream cone so badly. But he had lost it. 
Just then, he saw a crab. The crab said he was feeling generous and wanted to help the seal. He gave the seal a big fish to eat. The seal was so happy, he gobbled up the fish right away!
The little seal was so happy he had something to eat at last. He thanked the kind crab and swam away, no longer hungry.

Once upon a time there was a yellow cow. Every day she would give milk to an old man who lived at the end of the road. One day, the old man got very sick, so the cow took care of him. She gave him milk to help him get better. But it wasn't enough.
At the same time, a young girl found a magical wand. She used it to restore the old man's health. When the old man was feeling better, they all had a big party and the cow was invited.
The cow was so happy because she knew her milk had helped the old man. She felt it was a big part of restoring him to health. From that day, the cow and the old man were best friends. Whenever the old man felt bad, the cow was there with a glass of milk to make him feel better.

Once upon a time, there was a fair noise coming from a big field. The noise was so loud that it could be heard from very far away. Every day, many people gathered in the field to enjoy the pleasing sound.
One day, a man came to the field with a big saw. He cut down one of the trees that was making the noise. When the tree fell, the noise stopped. Everyone was sad and angry, but the man said he had to do it for a good reason.
The days and weeks went by, and the noise didnt come back. Eventually, the people in the field realized what the man had done: he had cut down all the trees that made the fair noise. He had ruined the beautiful sound forever, and they felt very sad.

Once upon a time, there was a lizard who wanted to go sailing. He had never sailed before and he was a bit scared. So, he asked his friends for help. His friends said that he should be modest and that he could find a boat to use.
The brave little lizard searched and searched until he finally found a boat that was just the right size. It was bright yellow and had one sail. He quickly jumped inside and was ready to sail.
He pulled the sail up high so he could move faster. He felt the wind on his face and he was so excited. He smiled and the boat took him faster and farther. He felt free and happy and the boat brought him all around the lake.
Finally, the little lizard sailed back to where he started. He was very proud of himself. He had sailed all on his own and he felt brave and adventurous. So, the little lizard went on more sailing adventures and he became an expert sailor.

He went inside and asked to the shopkeeper, "Can I make the vase mine?" 
The shopkeeper replied with a smile. "Of course! That will be five dollars." 
The bald man was so excited - he now had the vase! He quickly paid the shopkeeper and ran home. 
The bald man was so proud of his vase. He showed it to all his friends, who all admired it. 
The bald man said softly to himself, "I am so happy I was able to make this vase mine."

Once upon a time, there was a young pup named Bear. He was a happy pup and he liked to explore. One day, he went for a walk and saw a beautiful cat. He wanted to say hello, but he was too shy.
He looked up at the cat and said, "Hi, my name is Bear." The cat smiled and said, "Hello, Bear. I'm Kitty." 
Kitty asked Bear what he was planning to do for the day, and Bear told her that he wanted to go chasing after the birds in the park. Kitty said, "That sounds like loads of fun! However, you should be careful. You could lose your collar!" 
Bear was wearing a dull, old collar. He didn't want to lose it, so he decided to make a plan to keep it safe. He put his collar in his pocket, and suddenly came up with a brilliant plan! He decided to tie a string to the collar, and tie the other end of the string to his foot. That way, he would never lose it.
The two friends said goodbye and went their separate ways. Bear ran off to the park, ready to chase some birds with the comfort of knowing he wouldn't lose his collar. 
The end.

Once there was a mouse who was looking for a home. He searched around until he found an attractive safe. The mouse was very happy and he thought; this is perfect for me!
The mouse did his best to try to open the safe. He used his sharp claws and tried pushing, but nothing worked. He felt sad and started to cry.
Suddenly, a bee flew by and said to the mouse; Hey! Why dont you ask the key holder for help? The mouse thought this was a good idea. He thanked the bee and ran to find the key holder.
When he found the key holder, the mouse politely asked; Can you please open this safe for me? The key holder was happy to help, so he opened the safe for the mouse.
The mouse was relieved and thanked the key holder for his help. Then the bee said; Never give up trying, you may find the help you need.
The moral of the story is that its important to never give up when trying to achieve something. With the help of others, anything is possible!

The villagers asked him to try, and he said Yes. So the old man worked on the tool, and soon it started to look different. Everyone was excited and talked about how better it would be.
But when the old man was finished, the tool did not work properly anymore. The villagers were sad and angry, and they blamed the old man. They shouted at him and told him to leave the village.
The moral of the story is this: dont change something if you dont know what youre doing. Stick with what works, because if you dont, it can have a bad ending.

Once upon a time there were two little birds, Joe and May. They were very good friends and sang together everyday in the park. One day, Joe asked May if she would marry him. May thought this was a very foolish idea as they were just friends but still said yes.
The next day, Joe and May went on a trail in the forest. They climbed some trees and followed a small stream until they met a pond. Joe got a little box out of his pocket and showed May a beautiful ring. He asked May once again if she would marry him. 
May started laughing and said no. She said that they were too young to get married and they should wait until they were older. Joe replied that he was really serious and wanted to marry her. May said that although it was a sweet thought, it was a very foolish thing to do and that she must say no.
Joe was disappointed, but May was relieved. She hugged Joe and thanked him for the sweet thought. They carried on with their trail adventure until the sun started to set. Joe and May said goodbye, happier than ever as friends.

The little girl was sad and she thought the dolls were lost forever, but then she remembered that the door was still locked. Suddenly the little girl remembered - the dolls were hidden in a secret place and only she knew the special way to find it! 
The little girl was so excited. She pushed and pulled on the wall until she found the hidden door. Sure enough, the dolls were inside. The little girl hugged them all and put them back in a straight row. She knew she would always have to remember to lock the special door so her dolls would be safe.

He began to touch it, and then it began to move.Sylester watched in amazement as the symbol split into two pieces. Then, the pieces began to sparkle and fly around in the air! Sylvester had no idea what was happening, but he loved it.
The surrounding area began to light up, and Sylvester could hear music playing. As the music grew louder and louder, Sylvester felt as if he was being taken away on a magical adventure! He felt as if he was flying, and as he continued to snap his fingers, he could not believe how exciting his adventure was. 
Eventually, the magical adventure came to an end, and Sylvester returned home with a huge smile on his face. He could still feel the excitement from the magical symbol, and he could not wait to go on more adventurous adventures!

Molly's dad stopped and said, "Molly, look at that vehicle! It looks like something we've never seen before!"
Molly squinted her eyes and said, "It's like a big box!" 
They both paused for a second and then continued across the street. They couldn't take their eyes off of the strange vehicle. As they walked past the car, Molly pointed to a big window on the side and said, "Look Daddy! It has a window!"
Molly's dad smiled and said, "Let's go home, Molly. It's time to go home". They both started walking home and as they did, they looked back at the pale, yellow vehicle and laughed.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Jane. Jane was three years old and was about to go on an adventure.
She embarked on a journey to gain a special thing. When she arrived, she saw a large mountain with pieces of ash covering the ground. Jane kept walking and suddenly, she found a big shiny golden pot. 
"What is this?" Jane asked in excitement.
"That is the magical pot of gold. You can have it if you can answer one question," a voice said.
"What is the question?" Jane asked.
"What do you need to have a successful life?"
Jane thought for a while. Then, she proudly said, "Friendship, confidence, and courage."
The voice then said, "Well done! You have gained a successful life. You may now keep the pot of gold."
Jane was very happy and took the pot of gold home with her. She learned an important lesson that day. No matter how difficult something may be, if you work hard enough, you can gain success.

The earth said, "What can you do?"
The creature said, "I can give you something to drink."
The earth said, "What can I drink?"
The creature said, "A magical drink that will make you feel better."
So the earth drank the magical drink and sure enough it felt better. The earth was so happy that it said, "Thank you for the magical drink. You made me feel better."
The creature smiled and said, "You're very welcome." And then it flew away.
From that day on, the earth was happy and not so ugly anymore.

Once upon a time there was a kid called Tom. Tom was three and he loved to clean. Every morning he would clean his room and every night he would clean his toys. Tom thought that cleaning was fun! 
One day Tom tried to clean his secret hiding place, his secret was so special he kept it all to himself. He tried his best to clean it but could not move the messy stuff out. He pushed and he pulled, but nothing worked. He got so mad he started screaming and throwing things. 
Tom's mother heard the noise and came to see what had happened. She was very angry and scolded Tom for being so crazy. She told him it was not ok to make such a mess. Tom was so embarrassed and tried to hide his secret. 
His mother was not happy and told Tom she was very disappointed in him. She said it was time for him to learn that cleaning was important. From that day forward, Tom was very careful to keep his room clean and to always hide his secrets. The bad ending was that Tom was sad and no longer thought cleaning was so fun.

"Mommy, look at me!" shouted Josh. He was wearing a bright yellow t-shirt, a pair of blue shorts, and a big smile. His mom smiled back and said, "You look so handsome, Josh!"
Josh ran to the kitchen, looking for a snack. He found some butter on the table and quickly scooped some onto his finger. He licked it off with delight as he began dancing around the kitchen.
Suddenly, an unknown sound interrupted his fun. Josh stopped, listened, and ran to the living room. There, he found a small brown creature wearing a white hat. Josh was frightened and asked, "Who are you?"
The creature smiled and said, "My name is Dooley. I'm just here to bring you a special surprise." Josh was still unsure and asked, "What is it?"
"It's a new toy!" Dooley said cheerfully. Josh smiled and put it on. It was an unknown but exciting item, and Josh couldn't wait to try it out. He thanked Dooley and ran outside with his new toy, while Dooley disappeared as quickly as he had appeared.

Rose was so happy and they started to play together. Spot dropped his bone and they each had a bone as they kept playing. Together they were so cute. Very soon they became best friends.

Mum told Gella it was okay and that the creature was called a fish. She said fish were nice and not scary. To prove it, mum put her hand in the bucket again so Gella could see the fish swimming around. Gella stopped being scared and laughed as the fish swam around the bucket.

Once upon a time there was a boy. His name was Jake. Jake was in his backyard playing on the swing. As he was swinging high and higher, he closed his eyes and said "zoom". He opened them back up and kept zooming high. He felt his stomach twirling and he got very dizzy.
When Jake stopped swinging he was feeling very funny in his stomach. It was churning and swirling like a rollercoaster. Jake felt so dizzy that he had to spin in circles. He spun round and round until he finally got his balance back.
When Jake had gotten his balance back he noticed something strange. It was a bright orange butterfly. It was fluttering around him, almost as if it was playing. It flew close to him and then away. Then, suddenly, it zoomed right off! Jake laughed and kept watching it fly off until he could no longer see it.
When Jake got back inside he mentioned the butterfly to his mom and dad. They thought it was so much fun that they took him outside again to look for more butterflies. Though they didn't find any, they had lots of fun searching.
So that's the story of Jake and the butterfly. He still feels a little dizzy from the swing, but his stomach is not twirling anymore. Jake will never forget the fun he had zoom his way around his backyard.

The bunny was scared but he was brave and he tried to stand his ground. The fox then slowly opened its mouth, revealing big sharp teeth. The bunny knew the fox was going to eat him, so he quickly ran away as fast as he could. Unfortunately, this was not fast enough. The fox caught up with him, and the bunny was never seen again. 
The moral of the story is never open something without knowing whats inside. Always think twice before making a decision.

Colin thought hard about what he dad said. Finally, he shouted, "Oh, I get it!"
"What?" his mom asked.
"My dad means the driver is rude!" Colin said. "We should always be polite and call people 'sir' or 'ma'am'."
Colin's parents were very proud of him. They had learned an important lesson. Being polite and calling people 'sir' or 'ma'am' is always the right thing to do!

The moral of the story is: never give up on your dreams. If you keep trying, you can be wide too.

Max started to look around the park for his penny, but he couldn't find it. He started to get frustrated, he wanted his penny back.

Max had his penny back, and he ran off to show all of his friends how he had found it!

Once upon a time there lived a little boy called Jack. He was a very eager boy and always wanted to do something.
One day he was in a field and he saw a cell. He was very curious and went to have a closer look. Jack was so eager to see what was inside the cell that he ran towards it. 
As he was looking through, he heard someone say Hey! What are you doing?. It was a little rabbit and it had instinctively hopped onto the seat near the cell.
Jack was so excited to see the rabbit, he said Hi! I'm Jack. I wanted to take a peek inside the cell. 
The rabbit looked up at Jack and smiled. In a friendly voice, it said, Go ahead and take a look. I'm sure you'll find something interesting in there. 
Jack popped his head in and immediately noticed a little nest in the corner. It was full of colorful eggs and he was ever so eager to touch them.
The rabbit said, Be careful! Those are my eggs and should be treated with respect.
Jack giggled with joy and carefully touched the eggs. He thanked the rabbit and said his goodbyes, before heading back to his house with a smile on his face.

 Mike laughed and said, "That looks funny. What does that mean?" 
He asked his mom, who was sitting nearby. She said, "That's a soft symbol. It means 'no.'" 
Mike said it was silly and laughed so hard. He made a joke, "Maybe it means 'yes'!" 
His mom smiled and said, "Yes, it means 'no' and 'yes.' It can mean different things." 
Mike thought that was really funny and kept laughing. He kept on making jokes about the symbol and everyone enjoyed it.

Jack looked up. He asked, "What can help me?". Emma smiled and said, "Let's go over to the pond and you can cool down in the water". Jack felt excited.
At the pond, Jack jumped and played in the water. It felt wonderful. The hot feeling was gone and Jack felt much better. He said to Emma, "Thank you for being so helpful".
Afterwards, the two friends dried off in the sun. Jack was very happy. He said to Emma, "I'm so glad we came to the park and you were so helpful". Emma smiled and said, "Me too, now let's go and find something else fun to do".

Once upon a time, there was a happy little girl named Jane. She loved to explore everything around her and was very creative. Her mom and dad noticed this and decided to get Jane a rake so she could help them with the garden. 
Now every morning, Jane would go outside with her rake and start helping her parents. She became an expert at it - she knew exactly where the weeds were, where the flowers should go, and which way to rake the soil so the water could trickle in. 
But when winter came, Jane stopped helping with the garden. The cold made raking difficult, so she spent her time playing inside the house. Jane missed her beloved rake and just wished for spring to arrive so she could use it again. 
Finally, when the days grew longer and the sun shined brighter, Jane raced outside with her rake to help with the garden. She worked hard for hours and watched her garden grow. 
The moral of the story is that with patience, hard work and creativity, you can watch your dreams and ideas grow too!
<|endoftext|>

Jane lived in a big house. She wanted to get stronger and healthier, so she started doing yoga. Jane was uncomfortable at first. She was stiff and found it hard to do some of the moves. But every day she tried her best and little by little she started to improve.
Her arms and legs got stronger and she could finally do all the poses. Her balance also improved. Jane felt so happy. She was proud because she had achieved so much.
At the end of each week, Jane did her favourite yoga pose. She was so happy with her progress and glad she took the time to do yoga every day. Now days, Jane's yoga is so good that everyone in her family wants to join her!

John was a bald man who was looking for his phone. He searched around his room and asked his 3 year old daughter for help.
John: "Have you seen my phone sweetheart?"
Daughter: "No, I haven't seen it."
John looked all around the house but still could not find his phone. He became frustrated and started shouting.
John: "Where is my phone?!"
His daughter started crying and ran out of the room. John was feeling guilty and followed after her. He found his daughter in the kitchen looking at the counter.
Daughter: "It's there!"
John saw his phone on the counter and smiled. He picked up the phone and hugged his daughter.
John: "Thank you for finding my phone, sweetheart!"
His daughter smiled and hugged him back. From then on, John was more careful to keep his phone in the same place.

Polly and Tom stood outside, feeling the wind. It was uncomfortable. Tom said to Polly, "It's too windy! I don't like it." Polly replied, "Let's go inside, Tom. The wind makes me uncomfortable too." 
Tom thought for a minute, then said "No! We need to keep playing outside. We can find something to do!" 
They looked around, but the wind kept getting in their way. Every time Polly wanted to do something, the wind would blow it away. Finally, Polly said, "Let's go get mom! Maybe she can help us." 
Tom agreed, and they ran inside to ask their mom. Mom came outside and said, "Let's play tag and chase each other around the yard. That way, the wind won't get in your way." 
So Polly and Tom ran around, playing tag and chasing each other. It was so much fun, they forgot all about the uncomfortable wind.

But, then the magical bird flew away. The prince realised that his sadness was still heavy and that he still could not stop weeping. He was sadder than ever before.
The prince was never the same again. He wept and wept until the end of his days. The prince lived his life in sadness and his story ended sadly.

The owners shook their head, "No. We don't have anything."
The repairman smiled and said, "No worries. I have the tools necessary for this job. I can definitely repair it for you."
After some hard work, the drain was repaired. The owners thanked the repairman very much. They danced around and sang, "The drain is repaired! The drain is repaired!"
From that day on, the owners were always prepared when it came to repairing things. They kept tools available, just in case!

Later, Jim's brother Billy came to play. He saw the metal and asked to play with it. Letting out a big sigh, Jimmy's mom said, "No Billy. I already told Jim that metal is very dangerous and you must not play with it". 
But suddenly, the naughty Billy laughed playfully and ran off with the metal. Jimmy was shocked! He chased after his brother and said, "Billy, you have to put down the metal and listen to Mommy's request". 
In the end, Billy heard his brother's request and put down the metal. Jim was so happy that his brother was now safe. He hugged Billy and smiled.

"I need to wash this dress so it looks clean again" Lucy replied. Timmy thought of an idea. "We can go to the stream over there and use the water to wash it" he said.
Lucy felt very relieved and was thankful for Timmy's help. She smiled and thanked him.
The two of them went to the stream, each feeling independent. Although it was difficult for them, they managed to get the ink off the dress.

After the sorting was finished, the big pieces went into the washing machine and the small pieces were ironed. Lea watched carefully as mum took the red shirt out of the basket and put it on the ironing board. Mum plugged the iron in, waited for it to heat up, and then began ironing the shirt. 
When the red shirt was finished, Lea ran over and said, "I did it mum!" Mum smiled at her and said, "Yes, you did a good job! You are a very helpful little girl."
Lea was so proud of herself. She could not wait to sort and iron more clothes next time.

The little boy stepped in front of his sister. He knew he had to protect her from the stranger.
The stranger said in a gruff voice, "You naughty kids, you should not be playing here!" He raised his hand and it looked like he was going to slap the little boy.
The little girl was so scared. She wanted to help her brother, so she shouted out loud, "No, don't hit him!"
The stranger stopped. He looked at the little girl with surprise and then he smiled. He said, "You are very brave and I can tell you are a good big sister". He winked and walked away.
The little girl looked relieved, she knew her brother was safe. She was glad that she had spoken up and that she had been brave.

Once there was a little boy named Josh who was three years old. He was very curious and always asked a lot of questions. So one day he asked his mom, "Mama, why do we sneeze?"
Mama smiled and said, "When something tickles your nose, then you sneeze. It's your body's way of getting rid of unwanted things and keeping you healthy."
Josh was excited to learn something new so he decided to go and explore the world around him. He went outside and and smelled some flowers. As he got closer though, they tickled his nose and he sneezed. 
Mama laughed and said, "See, I told you! That was your body's way of saying, 'Hey this is not what I want!' " 
Then Josh asked, "But how does it help me stay healthy?"
Mama replied, "It keeps the unwanted things away from you. It's like having a protector who takes good care of you and keeps you safe."
Josh was so happy to learn something new. He was also very anxious to try it again. He said, "Let's go get some cake, Mama! I want to test my sneezing."
Mama agreed and they went to get some cake. As they walked into the bakery, delicious smells filled the air. Josh took a deep breath and felt a tickle in his nose

Kayla smiled and thought for a moment. 'I can help!' she said happily. She reached into her pocket and pulled out a bright red key. 'I found this key in the garden this morning. Maybe you can use it to get in!' 
Helena was so relieved, she thanked Kayla and tried the key. It worked! She was back in her house. Helena was so lucky - she would never have been able to get back in without Kayla's help!

The frog blinked, in amazement. He had never seen something so fair. He smiled and hopped away, happy he had been able to make such a beautiful discovery.

Once upon a time, there was a wave in the ocean. The wave was made from water and it was so big that it bounced really high.
The wave looked for something to latch onto so it could stay safe, and it found an anchor. The anchor was made from metal and it was very strong, so it kept the wave from bouncing too much.
The wave was feeling happy and secure, but then something strange happened - the wave started to turn pale! It was strange because usually waves are blue but this one was turning white.
The wave asked the anchor what had happened, and the anchor said that the wave had used up all of its energy - so it had to take a nap. So the wave rested until it had enough energy to bounce again.
The end.

One day, a child named Jack was very tired. He knew it was time for a nap. So he tried to close his eyes for a little rest. But, the sun was so bright, he couldn't sleep.
Suddenly, Jack had an idea. He found a big cardboard box and placed it over his head. He thought he was being very clever.
Jack's dad was watching from afar and said, "That's so stupid, Jack." But Jack was determined to take a nap.
So, he curled up in the box and drifted off to sleep. All of a sudden, he heard thunder! He peeked his head out and saw a huge storm brewing outside. He had set up his own shelter and was safe from the storm. 
Jack's dad couldn't believe it. Despite Jack's seemingly stupid attempt at napping, Jack had found a way to staydry during the storm. His dad smiled and said, "That's my smart boy!"

Heather was a humble girl. Every morning, she headed to the park for some fresh air. Today she was looking for a surprise. As she arrived to the park, her heart skipped a beat; she noticed a shiny fork on the ground. She quickly picked it up and felt its smooth surface. 
Heather was so excited she ran back home to show her mom. On the way, different ideas crossed her mind. She thought of using the fork to eat some ice cream. To her surprise, her mom had a bigger plan. Heather's mom took her to the park's lake. She showed Heather a fishing rod and the fork.
Heather watched in awe as her mom used the fork to open a can of worms, which she used as bait. Unaware of the surprise, Heather grabbed her fishing rod and cast it in the lake, with the help of her mom. Suddenly, Heather felt a tug in the fishing rod; she had caught a fish.
Heather was surprised and proud of her catch. She grabbed the fork to take the fish off the line. What started as a usual morning, ended in a magical surprise. After a long hour, Heather went home with a smile on her face.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Daisy. Daisy had two furry friends: a white bunny and a gray kitty.
One day, Daisy was playing with her friends. The bunny was hopping around, and the kitty was chasing her tail. Suddenly, the kitty got scared and ran away. 
Daisy was sad and worried. She wanted to help her friend find the way back home. She thought and thought until she had an idea! Daisy took a big, deep breath and gently called out: Kitty, kitty! Please come back! 
The kitty slowly came out of the bushes and blinked. Daisy knew what she had to do! Daisy held out her hand and said, Come with me, its okay. Ill help you find the way back home. 
The kitty followed Daisy and they soon reached home. Daisy waved goodbye and smiled.
This story taught us a great lesson: no matter how scared or lost we feel, if we are gentle and kind with our words, then we are able to find the way back home!

Once upon a time, there was a little bunny called Dennis. Dennis was a very hungry bunny, so he went out to look for food. He hopped through the forest, hoping to find something to eat.
Dennis passed by a carrot garden, and his tummy started to rumble. He looked around to make sure nobody was watching and hopped over to the carrots. He started to eat one, but then he heard a voice.
"What do we have here?" said the voice.
Dennis felt helpless. He turned around, and saw a big bear standing right behind him. The bear asked him what he was doing.
"I was just trying to find something to eat," said Dennis. "I'm really hungry."
The bear smiled. "Well, you guessed right, you can have as many carrots as you'd like," he said. "But don't tell anyone."
Dennis thanked the bear and started to eat the carrots. He ate until he was full and hopped away, his tummy full of delicious carrots. He never told anyone about the bear and the carrots.
<|endoftext|>

Once there was a girl named Jill. She was a very shy girl who never said much. One day she was feeling very lonely. She decided to go sit on a bench by the park.
As she sat there, she saw a big pie. It was a delicious looking cherry pie, and it made her mouth water. She slowly reached out and grabbed the pie. She started to eat it, feeling happier as she took each bite. 
After she finished eating the pie, she heard some children laughing and playing in the park. She was still a bit shy but she decided to go join them. As she walked closer, all the children stopped to look at her. But instead of feeling scared, Jill just smiled and waved, and the children smiled back.
Jill sat down on the grass with the children and they all had lots of fun together. Every time she felt shy, she would just take a bite of the pie in her pocket for some courage. 
The children never stopped smiling and laughing, and neither did Jill. And they all had a great day, filled with fun and pie!
<|endoftext|>
 
Once there was a boy named Ben. Ben was curious, but he struggled to understand words. One day he saw an old saw in his Grandad's shed. It was a special purple saw! Ben wanted to pick it up but he knew not to. 
Beside the saw, Ben found a purple hammer with a spiked head. He tried pounding it on the shed wall, but it made a loud noise that made him suffer. He knew he shouldn't make too much noise, so he put it down. 
Finally, Ben decided to take the purple saw outside. He rolled it along the grass and watched as the bright purple sparkled in the sun. Ben was so happy that he jumped for joy, not suffering at all!
<|endoftext|>
Bert enjoyed playing in the park with his dad every Saturday. As they arrived on this particular Saturday, they were both excited when they saw pink balloons in the sky. Bert thought they were the most beautiful things he had ever seen.
His dad said they were special: each balloon had a wish. He told Bert that if he could catch one, his wish would come true. Both Bert and his dad tried to catch them, but all the balloons flew away as if they were playing with him.
Bert was a little disappointed, but his dad told him it was ok: he had to be more thoughtful. He said it was important to take your time and really think about what your wish should be.
The next Saturday, Bert made sure he was ready and watched carefully for the balloons. Together, he and his dad tried again, and this time Bert was successful - he held one of the pink balloons tightly in his hands.
He made a wish, and the pink balloon stayed with him. His dad told him that his wish had come true: he had been thoughtful, and he was rewarded with his wish.
<|endoftext|>

Once upon a time, there was a brilliant nation. Everyone in the nation was kind and cheerful. They shared love and friendship, and the land remained peaceful.
One day, a special traveler from far away came to the nation. She had beautiful clothes and carried a shiny bag with her. When the traveler arrived, everyone gathered around her to welcome her.
The traveler smiled, and she shared her beautiful bag with the nation. Inside the bag were many special gifts, including a rainbow blanket and a very special heart-shaped box. Everyone was so happy to receive these amazing gifts.
The nation remained brilliant and full of love, and the traveler was always remembered with joy and appreciation.

Once upon a time there was a little girl who loved to listen to jazz music. Every morning she would wake up and dance to the sounds of jazz while her family smiled. 
One day, the little girl wanted to provide jazz music to all of her family members. She searched and searched but could not find any music to share. She was very ashamed. 
The little girl thought and thought and came up with an idea. She went around to her neighbour's houses and asked if she could borrow some jazz music. Unfortunately, all the neighbours said no. 
The little girl was very sad. Despite her best efforts, she was not able to provide jazz music to her family. The little girl was so ashamed that she never asked for help again.

Once there was a girl. She had a special dress that she loved to wear. She was so excited to put it on, but she found it was very hard. The girl looked around and saw a strawberry hanging on the nearby bush. She thought it would be the perfect solution to make her dress softer. 
She picked the strawberry and gently placed it inside her dress. It fit perfectly. 
Finally the girl was able to put her dress on with ease and she felt very special. She twirled around the garden and felt like the most beautiful girl there. 
The strawberry not only made her dress much softer, but it also added an extra layer of unique sweetness to her look. She was so glad she had found the strawberry, because otherwise she would have never been able to wear her beautiful dress.
<|endoftext|>
Once upon a time, there was a weak elephant. He was so weak he could hardly balance. He tried to stand on one leg, but he couldn't do it. He tried to stand on two legs, but he wobbled and fell over.
The elephant was sad, so he decided to find someone to help him. He looked around until he spotted a small boy. He could tell the boy was very clever.
The elephant asked the boy for help. The boy smiled and thought of an idea. He told the elephant to concentrate and find his balance. The elephant closed his eyes and tried again.
Amazingly, after a few tries, the elephant managed to balance on one leg. Then he balanced on two legs. He felt strong and happy!
The little boy was so proud of the elephant and cheered with joy. From then on, the elephant and the little boy were best friends as they practiced balancing together.
<|endoftext|>
Once upon a time there was a small village. In this village everyone was sad, because they had no food. One day a stranger came to the village. He had a big bag and in it he had many things. He gathered everyone together. He said that he was very happy and wanted to share some things with the village.
He said he had a razor, which he wanted to use to help them. Everyone was excited but confused. So the stranger said that if they gave him some water and some spices he would use the razor to make a soup for them.
Everyone got to work and gather the water and spices. Soon enough the soup was ready. When everyone tasted it the soup was so spicy! Everyone was delighted and thanked the stranger for his help.
The villagers had never felt so happy and were surprised at how something so simple could make them feel so much more full. The stranger smiled and said he was glad that his razor had helped make something so delicious. Everyone in the village thanked him again and they all ate together and shared stories of their day. The stranger had made a big difference in the lives of the people in the village.
<|endoftext|>

Once there was a little girl and she loved to see the world. One night she was looking out of her window and she saw something zoom past. It was the most exciting thing she had ever seen!
The little girl wanted to know where it had gone, so she followed it. She chased it all the way to a big field. When she got there she saw that it was a harmless little animal.
The animal was so cute and she loved it so much! She knelt down and it ran around her, playing. The two were having so much fun together! Then, the animal zoomed away, disappearing into the horizon.
The little girl was so sad that she had to say goodbye to her new friend. But, she knew she had to say goodbye and she was happy that she got to play with the harmless little animal.
<|endoftext|>

Once upon a time a lonely deer had to leave his family. He was all alone in the forest and he felt very sad. 
He wanted to find a friend but he just couldn't find one. He was sitting all alone in a meadow and he was feeling hopeless.
Suddenly he heard a voice and saw a squirrel by his side.
The squirrel said: "Hi deer! Why are you so lonely?"
The deer said: "I am alone, I don't have any friends."
The squirrel replied: "Well, you can come and stay with me and my family. We can be friends!" 
The deer felt so happy and said: "Yes, I would love that!"
So the deer and the squirrel became friends and the lonely deer was not lonely anymore.
<|endoftext|>
 
Once upon a time, there lived a big pig. The pig was very proud and always thought he was the best. One day, the pig went to a market and saw a little pig.
The big pig laughed and said: "Look at that small pig, how silly he is".
The little pig heard it and said: "I may be small, but I also have something to offer". 
The big pig was so surprised, he asked: "What can you offer?".
The little pig replied: "I may be small but I can offer friendship and kindness".
The big pig realised he had been mean and said sorry. From that day on, the two pigs became friends. They worked together and split the work down each side.
The moral of the story is that no matter how big or small you are, you can always offer friendship and kindness.
<|endoftext|>
 
Once upon a time, there was a big, bright sun in the sky. It made the sky a beautiful blue color. A kite flew high above it, the kite's cord dangling and swaying in the wind. 
The kite flew so high that the cord couldn't be seen anymore. But then out of nowhere, the cord dropped. It fell way down and twirled around the sky until it landed on the ground.
 
The kite was now alone in the sky, so the sun smiled brightly to make it feel better. A gust of wind then appeared and grabbed the kite by its cord, lifting it back up into the sky. The sun kept smiling down, and the kite kept flying free.
<|endoftext|>

Jack was a three year old boy who was feeling very guilty. He had broken his mum's favourite vase. He knew he should not have done it and he knew it was wrong.
Jack's mum came into the room and saw the vase on the floor.
"Oh, Jack," she exclaimed sadly, "what have you done?"
Jack cowered and couldn't look at his parent. "I'm sorry," he whispered.
Jack's mum sighed and lifted him into her arms. Despite her disappointment, Jack could see the love in her eyes.
"It's okay, Jack. I know it was an accident. But you should always think before you act," she said.
Jack hugged his mum tightly. He was relieved and vowed never to do it again.
From that moment on, Jack was very careful whenever he was around anything fragile. He was determined to not make his parent disappointed again.
<|endoftext|>

Mama and Papa were having a discussion. Mama said, "I think these pants are too boring. Let's design a different pair!" Papa thought for a bit and then said, "That's an awesome idea!"
Mama grabbed some fabric and scissors and, with Papa's help, started to cut and sew pants. They measured and cut the fabric in different shapes, and soon the new pants were complete.
Mama tried on the new pants and said, "Wow! They look so different! I love them!" Papa agreed and said, "I'm so proud of us. We designed a beautiful pair of pants together!"
Mama smiled and hugged Papa. She said, "We make the best team!"  They both smiled and agreed.

Once there was a girl who lived on a hill. She thought the hill was very interesting. One day she wanted to record how amazing it was.
The girl looked around at everything. She saw the flowers, the trees and the birds flying. She wanted to remember all of these things so she decided to record it.
So she started singing. She sang and sang and sang, singing about all the things she saw on the hill. Everyone heard her singing and they smiled.
Once she finished recording, she was so happy. She knew she would always remember the hill she loved so much.

Once upon a time, there was a boy called John. He wanted to design something special. So finally he decided to design a kite. He went to buy all the materials he needed to make it.
John thought it was a very exciting idea to design and make a kite. He drew the shape of the kite and cut the paper piece by piece. He colourfully decorated and stuck them together until he made a beautiful kite.
John went to the park to show his kite to his friends. His friends were amazed by his kite and laughed with excitement. They also wanted to make their own kite. John was very happy.
Suddenly, the wind was blowing very strongly. It carried all the kites away. Except John's! His was the only one that stayed on the ground because he designed it to be very strong. All his friends laughed at their own kites because they had designed them too stupidly. But John just smiled because he had designed perfectly.

Once upon a time there were three friends. They were called Joey, Celina, and Eva. They were very good friends and loved spending time playing together.
One day they were playing when they hit a big number. It was a secret number that nobody had ever seen before! They were so excited they quickly looked inside the number.
To their surprise, they saw a jar full of oil. It was very shiny and they all wanted to pick it up. Since they were so excited, they all reached for it at the same time and accidentally knocked it over.
The oil spilled everywhere! They were so deaf they didn't hear their parents calling for them. Joey, Celina, and Eva spent the next few hours cleaning up the oil. 
When they were done, their parents praised them for their hard work and the friends shared a big hug before going home.

Once upon a time, two friends named Ned and Chris wanted to go on an adventure. They looked around and saw a team of horses and men. The horses were big, but Ned and Chris made them feel brave.
The team marched to a big, scary cave. They looked all around, but they didn't see anything. That's when they heard a spooky noise. It was so loud and scary, they were scared.
Ned and Chris didn't want to go in the cave, but they had to. They held hands so they wouldn't be scared. Finally, they went inside.
It was dark and cold, but underneath it all, there was something magical about the cave. The friends looked around and to their amazement, the cave was filled with candy and toys! Ned and Chris had a wonderful time.
They left the cave feeling happy and safe. They said goodbye to the team and decided to go back to their adventure another day.

Once upon a time there was a wild figure. He lived in the forest and liked to explore. One day he heard a strange noise. He stopped and wondered, "What is that?"
He followed the noise and found a little girl playing in the field. She had bright eyes and a big smile. The figure said hello and the girl looked up and smiled.
The girl pointed to the sky and asked "What is that?" The figure looked up and saw a bird flying above. He told the girl it was a bird and watched as she twirled and laughed in delight.
The figure was curious and asked the girl lots of questions. He wanted to know all about her. The girl talked about her day and the wild animals she had seen. They laughed together and became friends.
At the end of the day the girl waved goodbye to the figure with a happy smile. The figure watched her walk away and was glad he was able to answer her questions. He continued on his way, content that he had met a new friend. The end.

Billy was very excited. He had been waiting all morning for his Daddy to take him to the park. Finally the time had come. 
Daddy said to Billy, "Are you ready to go?"
Billy grinned and said, "Yes Daddy, let's go!"
Daddy chuckled and said, "That sounds good! Let's go."
They went outside, and Daddy said, "Look up!"
Billy looked up, and he saw a big helicopter flying in the sky. He said, "Wow Daddy, what's that?"
Daddy said, "That's a helicopter. It carries people around."
Billy was fascinated. He watched the helicopter carrying people and flying away. After awhile, he got a little sleepy, and so Daddy put him in the car. 
They drove to the park and soon Billy was awake again. He couldn't wait to explore and have fun with Daddy.

Once upon a time, there were two friends, Lily and Lucy. Lily was very excited because she was about to take a special trip. She said to Lucy: "I am going to travel to Grandma's house! She is going to give me a gift."
Lucy was surprised. She asked Lily, "What gift will you get?"
Lily smiled. "I don't know," she replied. "It's a surprise!"
So, Lily packed her bag and set off. She took an ordinary train and an ordinary bus, and when she arrived at Grandma's house, it was waiting for her.
Grandma hugged her and said, "I have a special gift for you!" She handed Lily a beautifully wrapped box. Lily quickly opened it and found a beautiful doll inside.
Lily was so excited. She thanked Grandma for the wonderful gift and said, "This is the best trip I've ever taken!"
<|endoftext|>

Once upon a time there was a fly who wanted to have a nap. So he found a nice spot near a well and he lay down. He closed his eyes and sighed contentedly.
But then there came a strong wind and it blew and blew. The wind made the well shake and shiver. But still the fly lay there, getting rocked back and forth in the wind like a baby in a cradle.
But soon the wind died down and the well was still again. The fly opened his eyes and realized he had had a very fine nap. He flapped his wings and buzzed away, feeling rested and happy.
<|endoftext|>

Once upon a time there was a jet. It cut through the sky like a knife. It was very fast and strong. But one day it ran into something rough. It was a mountain. The jet was stuck.
The pilot was worried. He looked all around. Then he saw something. It was a saw. It had big, sharp teeth. The pilot knew what he had to do. He grabbed the saw and started to cut. He cut and he cut, until finally the jet was free.
The pilot was relieved. He thanked the saw for helping him. The jet flew up into the sky and away. The pilot and the jet lived happily ever after.
<|endoftext|>

Once upon a time, there was a furry bear who was walking along a path. As he walked, he passed many stones. 
Suddenly, he slipped and fell on one of the stones, and everyone nearby started to laugh. The bear felt embarrassed and wanted to hide. He looked around, but there was nowhere to go! 
He spotted a big tree with lots of leaves, and ran to it. He climbed up the trunk, hoping no one would see him. He sat on a branch, feeling safe and cozy, surrounded by the furry leaves. 
Just then, he heard happy voices coming from below the tree. He looked down, and saw a bunch of children playing with stones. He smiled. No one had seen him, so he no longer felt embarrassed. He stayed up in the tree all day, surrounded by the furry leaves. 
The End.

Once upon a time there was a little cow called Beth. Beth was very playful and loved to bounce. Everywhere she went she would bounce up and down, happy and excited.
One day, Beth caught sight of a long spell in a nearby tree. She wondered what the spell was but she was too small to reach it. She thought for a moment before she got an idea. She carefully bounced as high as she could and managed to grab the spell! 
Beth asked the spell, What can you do? The spell answered in a whispery voice, I can make your bounces longer. Would you like to try?
Beth nodded eagerly and the spell began to work. Suddenly Beths bounces became much longer! She laughed and bounced around, overjoyed with her achievement. 
The long spell had helped Beth to bounce higher than ever before. From then on, she was always the bounciest cow in the entire land!
<|endoftext|>

Frank was a little boy, and he was feeling very sad. He sighed. He looked out of his window, and he saw a bright red poppy. He smiled; it was so pretty. 
He opened his window and reached down to pick it. He held it in his hand and smelled it. It smelt so nice. He put it behind his ear and went outside and ran around. 
He was feeling much better now; he felt fine. He played all day, and when it was bedtime, he looked at the poppy still behind his ear. He sighed, but this time a happy sigh. 
He put it carefully aside to look at it again in the morning. Then he went to bed and dreamed of all the fun he'd had that day.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Amy. She loved to play in the kitchen with her toys. One day, when she was playing there, one of her toys had broken. Amy started to cry.
Then, her mom came in the kitchen and saw the broken toy. She said to Amy, Don't worry, sweetie. Everything can be fixed. Let's see if we can find a way to fix your toy. She looked for glue and some tape, and Amy helped too. They worked together until the toy was fixed.
After it was done, Amy was very happy. She was so proud that she even gave her mom a big hug! Her mom smiled at her and said, See? With a little effort and some hard work, anything can be fixed.
From then on, Amy would always remember the lesson her mom taught her: no matter how broken something is, if you try hard enough, you can make it shine again.

Once upon a time there was a tiny berry, who loved to hug. It was so modest, living all by itself in the forest. Every day, it would hug the trees and logs, just to stay happy.
One day, an animal came by and glanced at the berry. The animal told it, "I have a surprise for you. I will bring it tomorrow." The little berry was so excited!
The next day, the animal came back and said, "I have a big hug for you!" He gave the berry a hug and the berry felt so much joy! It hugged the animal tight, never wanting to let go.
The animal hugged back and said "I am glad you liked it. I thought you may need a hug like this." The berry was so thankful for the surprise and for the animal's kindness. And that's why the berry continued to hug each day.

Emma was walking through the woods by herself one day when she noticed something bright in the bushes. She walked closer and saw that it was a clay pot. She reached and picked it up. It felt cold and made her shiver.
The pot was filthy and Emma was sure that there must be something special inside. She used her hands to scrape away the dirt and mud and quickly discovered that it was full of coins.
Excited, she carefully looked through the coins, but she couldn't help her hands from shaking and she dropped some of them in the dirt. She quickly put the coins away and shivered. She knew that she couldn't keep the coins, so she carefully put them back in the clay pot and placed the pot back in the bushes.
She smiled and skipped away, happy to have made such a wonderful, yet filthy, discovery.

Once there was a brown boat. It was made of wood and had a bright red sail. The sail boat was owned by three children. They loved to go out on the lake and sail in their boat.
One day, the children asked a grown up what they could do to make their boat go faster. The grown up suggested they buy a machine to attach to the sail boat. So the children went shopping and found a brown machine. 
When they got the machine home, they attached it to the sail boat. Then they went out on the lake to see what happened.
The children were so excited when they sailed with the new machine. It was so fast that it felt like they were flying! "Look at us go!" shouted one of them. "This machine is awesome!" 
The children laughed and smiled as they sailed around the lake with the brown machine. They were very happy with their boat and machine and used them for many happy years.

Once upon a time, there was a Pixie who wanted to surprise all of his friends. So one day he decided to plan a meeting. He told his friends to wear their best clothes, but then he told them that the meeting was very cheap. 
The Pixie's friends were delighted! They showed up to the meeting wearing their best clothes, but they were surprised to find they didn't need to spend any money at all. Instead, the Pixie had planned a fun game and some tasty treats. Everyone had a great time. 
The moral of the story is that it's important to share with others. Even if you don't have a lot of money, you can still surprise your friends in special and unforgettable ways. Even a simple game or treat can make someone's day!

Once upon a time, there was a little paw. The paw was purple and it belonged to a kitty cat. The paw was so small, but it had a big dream. The paw wanted to succeed.
So every morning, the little paw said to the sun: "Please help me succeed!"
The sun smiled and replied: "Have courage little paw. You can do it!"
The paw was so excited. It gathered all its strength and started to try. It tried and tried, and eventually it succeeded!
The little paw was so proud. It danced and sang as it ran through the town, shouting "I succeeded! I succeeded!" 
The other animals were so happy for the little paw. They cheered and clapped for its wonderful success.
The paw ran back home and proudly told its family about its success. Now the paw believed that it could do anything it wanted. And it would never give up trying to succeed.

One sunny morning, a farmer and his mule were walking through the field. Suddenly, the farmer noticed something dead in the grass. The farmer thought: "Someone must have stolen my mule!"
The farmer looked at the mule. He said: "Did someone steal you?" The mule made a little noise and shook its head 'no'. 
So, the farmer looked around and he saw someone running away in the distance. He said: "That must be the thief!" 
The farmer followed the thief. He ran through the fields until he caught the thief. He said: "You must give me back my mule!" 
The thief said: "Please, don't hurt me! I'm sorry, I didn't mean to steal your mule!"
The farmer was angry, but he knew that the thief was sorry. So, he let the thief go and brought his mule back to the farm. 
The farmer was relieved that his mule was safe and that he was able to catch the thief before it was too late. He knew that the thief learned a valuable lesson and would never steal again!
<|endoftext|>

Once there was a bear who was very bored. He wanted to do something fun but couldn't think of anything. So he decided to try and escape! He ran and he ran until he was very tired. He looked for a place to take a nap. He finally found a cozy spot in a cave, so he curled up and went to sleep.
When the bear woke up he felt much better. As he looked around he realised he had escaped! He was so excited that he ran and ran, much faster than before. He explored the forest and all that it had to offer. He found big trees, bright flowers and sweet smelling berries. He felt so happy and free!
Soon he had to go back home. He remembered how boring it was there, but he also had some exciting stories to tell. He knew that he wouldn't ever be bored again!

John wanted to explore the world around him. He looked out of his window and noticed a pond. He paused to take it all in. "I'm going to go explore the pond," said John.
He got dressed in his warm coat and hat, then grabbed his bucket and set off. When he got to the pond, he smiled widely. He could see so many things. He put his bucket down and ventured into the pond.
He saw dragonflies and frogs, and several tiny fish swimming all around. He even found a rock, which he took home with him. 
On his way back home, he noticed a big, strong horse. The horse seemed kind and quite reliable. John was very excited to meet the horse. He petted the horse and after a while they both felt a connection. 
Since then, he visits the horse and pond regularly and always takes his bucket with him. The pond and the horse have both become very reliable friends!
<|endoftext|>

One day, a group of eager aliens were ready to begin their mission, to clean up the planet. They all double checked their gear, zipped up their uniforms, and huddled together to get ready.
"Today's the day" one alien said.
The others nodded in agreement and eagerly followed the lead alien, ready to start the mission.
The aliens spread out and began to clean the planet. They flew from tree to tree and picked up the trash, then flew up into the sky to pick up the rubbish in the clouds.
The planet was looking much cleaner, and the aliens were very happy.
"We have done a great job!" the lead alien said. The others agreed with smiles, and they worked hard until the planet was sparkling clean. 
The aliens were exhausted, but they had accomplished their mission. "Good work everyone!" the lead alien said with a smile. 
The eager aliens flew off into the night, happily knowing they had done their job.

Nina was a regular girl who loved to have fun. She loved playing in the park and swinging on the swings.
One day, a magical fairy appeared in the park. She said to Nina, "I am giving you a magical power. When you kneel down, you can make one wish." 
Nina was excited and kneeled on the ground. She wished for the most fun day ever!
Suddenly, the fairy clapped her hands and the whole park turned into one big playground! There were rides and games everywhere. 
Nina kneeled again and thanked the fairy for making her wish come true. The fairy replied, "You're welcome! Now go have some fun!"

Bubbles sat in her backyard and sighed. She had been so looking forward to having a picnic today, but it had started to rain. She felt sad. 
Suddenly, she heard a strange noise. It sounded like water dripping. She looked around to see where the noise was coming from and saw that the old statue in the corner was soaking! 
Bubbles ran over to it, and noticed that the statue was broken. She asked it, "What happened?" 
The statue said sadly, "I was never as strong as the other statues, so the heavy rain has made me crack." 
Bubbles felt very sorry for the broken statue. She took it inside and said, "Don't worry - I will keep you safe and dry." 
And so Bubbles found a way to enjoy the rainy day after all!
<|endoftext|>

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Jane. She loved pink but one day she saw a really cool purple shirt. She asked her mom if she could borrow it. Her mom said yes and she was really excited. She put it on and looked in the mirror. She felt like a princess in her new purple shirt.
The next day, she decided to borrow some purpl style from her friend. Her friend had lots of purple accessories and clothes. Jane noticed a purple scarf which matched her shirt perfectly. She asked if she could borrow it and her friend said yes.
That day at school, everyone complimented her on her purple style. She felt so proud of her outfit and the way she had put it together. Jane felt so happy with the new style she had borrowed. She knew it was worth borrowing from her mom and her friend.

Mommy got out of bed and she looked sleepy. A loud noise started ringing  it was the alarm! She got out of bed and started to work. She put on her clothes and walked to the kitchen. 
She took out a bowl and started making breakfast. She added eggs, milk, butter, and cheese. After breakfast, Mommy put on her coat and left the house. 
Mommy went to work and she said goodbye. She did lots of work all day long. In the evening, Mommy started to feel sleepy. She came home and turned off the alarm. 
She took off her coat and changed her clothes. Then she went to the kitchen and made dinner. She ate yummy food and went to sleep. 
Mommy had a nice night of sleep so she could do more work in the morning.
<|endoftext|>

Mia ran in the race. She was so excited but a little scared too. She saw lots of people cheering. She wanted to be fast, like the other runners.
Mia ran and ran until she finished the race. Everyone clapped and cheered for her! She was proud, but also a bit tired.
After the race, Mia's Dad gave her a sour lemon. She didn't understand why it was sour, but she ate it anyway. It was so yucky! Mia's Mom laughed and gave her a sweet apple. This Mia understood. She smiled and ate the apple.
Mia was happy she understood the difference. She knew racing was fun and sour lemons weren't!

Once upon a time, there was a small boy named John. John wanted to go on an adventure. He stepped out of his house and started walking. He went through the big park and saw some birds singing in the trees. He stepped through the grass and felt the sun on his face.
John wanted to go somewhere quieter. He started walking and soon came to a lake. He stepped carefully on the rocks so as not to make too much noise. At the lake, he saw some helpful ducks swimming around. He waved at them and they waved back.
John had a lovely time by the lake. The quiet was very peaceful and he enjoyed taking some time to relax. He looked up at the sky and watched the clouds. Eventually, he felt ready to go back home. 
John thanked the ducks for being so helpful. As he stepped back through the park, he knew he had made a wonderful journey. He was excited to share his adventure with his family that night.
<|endoftext|>

Once there was a man called Max. He was very bossy. One day, Max was drinking his juice when his sister Jane came into the room. Jane said to him, "Max, I'm having trouble with my puzzle. Can you help me?"
Max looked at the puzzle, but he couldn't figure out how it was suppose to fit together. He kept trying again and again, but he couldn't figure it out.
Jane said, "Max, please help me. I don't understand!" 
Max said, "I'm sorry Jane. I'm not bossy enough to figure it out." 
Jane said, "Don't worry, I can do it. I'm bossy enough to figure it out." She smiled and started to put the pieces of the puzzle together until they all fit. Max smiled back and said, "Nice job, Jane!"
Jane said, "Thank you Max. Now let's go get some more juice!" 
And off they went, a bossy brother and a bossy sister, hand in hand.
<|endoftext|>

Once there was a great girl named Addy. She loved playing with her friends and always had a lot of fun. She was always talking and talking to everyone about anything and everything.
One day, Addy and her friends were outside playing. Suddenly, Addy heard a voice calling her name. She stopped what she was doing and looked all around. She couldn't see anyone, but she could still hear the voice.
Addy asked her friends if they heard the voice, but they said they didn't. She decided to go look for the voice. As she walked, she heard it again. This time the voice said "Addy, come over here". She followed the voice and soon she came to a rainbow-colored bush.
The bush spoke to Addy and asked her if she wanted to be friends. Addy was so surprised she didn't know what to say. But then she smiled and said, "Yes, I would love to be friends with a great bush like you!". The bush smiled back and said, "My name is Rainbow, and it's nice to meet you Addy".
From that day on, Addy and Rainbow were best friends. They talked and laughed and played together all the time. Addy loved telling everyone about her talking bush friend. They all agreed it was the greatest thing they had ever heard.

Once upon time there was a little girl who liked to wander.
She liked to wander down the street, out in the garden and in the woods.
One day she decided to wander in the dark, but she was a bit anxious.
Suddenly she saw a lamp, so she took it.
The lamp made her feel less anxious and the bright light guided her way.
She wandered deeper and soon discovered a secret garden.
The garden was full of beautiful flowers and she was so excited.
The little girl happily wandered around the garden all evening.
The lamp kept her safe and she was no longer anxious.
In the end she returned home, feeling tired but content.
The little girl had a wonderful adventure and would never forget the lamp that guided her way.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Emily. She was only three years old and loved to wear bright jewelry. She had a bright blue bracelet which she wore everyday. 
One day, Emily was playing with her friends at the park and noticed that one of her friends had a beautiful pink bracelet. Emily wanted the same bracelet, but did not want to tell her friend. 
In the evening, Emily's mom noticed that Emily was looking for something. She asked Emily what she wanted and the little girl said, "I want the pretty pink bracelet my friend has."
Emily's mom smiled and said, "I'm sorry sweetheart, I don't have the money to buy you that bracelet." Emily started to cry and said, "But I hate my bracelet!" 
Her mom said, "Don't worry, one day you will have a beautiful collection of jewelry. For now, appreciate your blue bracelet. It's just as bright and special as your friend's pink bracelet." 
Emily smiled and hugged her mom. She realized that she didn't need to hate her blue bracelet. She loved it and hugged it tight.

"We should hurry up," said Jack, "Mommy will be back in one minute!"
Bertie grabbed a bag of colorful stickers and began to stick them all over the windows. She smiled as she looked at their colorful work.
"We did it! Now, let's surprise Mommy!" exclaimed Jack.
They both rushed out to the driveway and waited for their mom to come home. As soon as they saw her car turn the corner, they started jumping up and down with excitement.
Mommy gasped in surprise when she opened the door and saw the decorations. "You two did such a wonderful job! I'm so lucky to have you!"
Jack and Bertie gave their Mom a big hug and laughed as they all admired their jolly decorations.

"Mommy, what are they doing?" asked Nina.
"They are preparing for the festival, sweetheart. We will have lots of fun tonight!"
Nina loved festivals. They were always so colourful and exciting! She raced around all day, until finally the sun was beginning to set. The sky had turned from blue to pink and red.
"It's almost time!" said Mommy.
Nina could hardly believe it! Suddenly, there was a loud noise. People began to yell and fight.
"Mommy, what's happening?" asked Nina, frightened.
"Don't worry, sweetheart. This is all part of the festival," Mommy said. 
Nina was relieved. She couldn't wait to find out what would happen next!

Once upon a time there was a bee called Sarah. She lived in a hive in the ground. One day, Sarah wanted to go explore the world outside her hive. She waved at her mum and dad and flew off into the big, wide world.
But Sarah found the world outside very cold. She shivered and huddled up. But she was brave and kept flying. Then she arrived at a park! There were lots of children playing, but they didn't notice Sarah.
But then one of the children noticed Sarah and pointed at her. He shouted to the other children, "Look a bee! Can I catch it?" The other children shouted back yes, and they all chased after Sarah. 
Sarah felt embarrassed that they were all chasing her, so she flew up higher and higher! The children soon gave up and ran away. 
Sarah was relieved and flew back to her hive, happy and tired. 
The End.

First, he used a big hammer to straighten the pipe. He worked carefully and slowly, to make sure it was perfect again. He was so proud when he was finished! 
Then, the man used a very special cleaner. It made the copper shiny and sparkly. With a few gentle wipes, he had it looking very tidy. 
At the end of the day, the man was happy with his work. He had done a really good job. Thanks to him, the copper pipe was fixed and looked as good as new!
